Defenders can steal a ball only during a pass or a shot (blocking it or rebounding), and if they're next to a player passing the ball or the one that catches it. There are steals, fouls and rebounds. Scoring is for 1, 2 and 3 points.

Hockey: each player has 5 players and goalkeeper. Goalkeeper cannot move out of the goal area. Moves, shoots and passes for maximum 6 hexes. All rules are combination of soccer and basketball rules written above.

Player wins after determined time or result. Producer recommends 2x30 min for soccer, 3x20 for hockey and 2x20 for basketball.

Mechanic: each action is decided by dice. In soccer - 1-2 dices, other sports: 1 dice.

2 sided board: on one side there's soccer pitch, on second - basketball and hockey.

name: Assalto alla Jac Bank
description:
Assault on Jac Bank is a game set in the Far West.
The game board is divided into two paths (game of goose style), each of 30 squares. A path is runned from the players who personify the good guys (the sheriff and the cowboy) and the other path is runned from players who personify the bad guys, the gunslingers.
The aim of the sheriff and the cowboy will be to prevent the robbery that the bad guys will try to accomplish in the Jac Bank (located in the center of the game board). At the end the players will have to compete in a duel with the use of the cards to determine the winner.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Suomirokkia trivia 2
description:
A trivia game about Finnish rock music from the 70's to 00's. The game includes a four-piece game board, 1000 questions, 30 pictures and a cd. The cd contains music samples. The publisher is a Finnish record company.

Players answer a question from their space and can advance if they answer correctly. A maximum of 2 advancements in one turn.

name: Elexikon
description:
An electronic dictionary quiz game with over 1100 questions and answers with images for one or more players.
Players answer the questions with an electronic pen which flashes green if the answer is correct.
Whoever has the most correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Vorsicht Qualle!
description:
A sea-creature themed memory game for children.

The game contains 20 sea cards, 18 "yuck!" cards and 2 "wanted!" cards. Sea and "yuck!" cards show the same sea creatures. Some are very similar, differing only in colour or other small details. Cards also have a point value from 1-3.
The sea cards are shuffled and laid out face-down. The "yuck!" and "wanted!" cards are also shuffled and placed in a face-down stack. The player whose turn it is turns over the top card from the stack and a sea card of his/her choice. If he/she turns over a card that matches the current "yuck!" card from the stack, he/she has to take the "yuck!" card, returns all the open sea cards to the face-down state but gets to look at as many sea cards as there are points on the card.
If the top card from the stack is a "wanted!" card, players instead try to find (rather than avoid) the matching sea card. The player who earns a "wanted!" card can use it to remove one of his/her "yuck!" cards from the game.

The game ends when a player has received 5 or 7 "yuck!" cards (number depends on number of players). The player with the fewest "yuck!" cards wins the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Kubeni
description:
Put your hand, eye, and brain to the test with this fast paced app-enabled card game! It's Great for groups too!

The object of Kubeni is to take what you see on the three dimensional image - which is displayed on either a card or app screen - and recreate it in "real life" before the timer runs out (30 seconds)- easy right? But there's a bit more to it... Different modes add new elements to the game and a connected app introduces the possibility of new game modes and kards via update.

name: Star Wars Rebels: Abenteuer auf Lothal
description:
Together with the Rebel heroes Ezra, Kanan, Zeb, Sabine and Hera in Star Wars Rebels: Abenteuer auf Lothal, players explore the planet Lothal. With the help of dice throws, skillful bluffing, and Chopper the grumpy Astromech droid, they are making rapid progress — but who is bold enough to risk a battle with the dreaded Inquisitor and his clone troopers?

Who will be the first to get back to the Rebels' spaceship "The Ghost"?

The international (France/UK/US) release is titled "Star Wars Rebels Adventure Game".

name: Recall of Cthulhu
description:
Recall of Cthulhu presents the horrors of the mythos in a way they were meant to be, cute and cuddly! This classic matching game can be played by the most deranged patient in the Sanatorium, as well as young cultists aged 4 and up!

Included in the game are 60 tiles representing 15 creatures, items and places of the Cthulhu Mythos, as well as a player aid for playing the advanced game.

The game can be played as a simple matching game, or the advanced game can be played which adds a layer of complexity to the game. In the advanced game, tiles have varying point values, as well as effects on the game itself. The advanced game is suitable for young cultists aged 8 and up.
categories: Children's Game, Horror, Humor, Memory, Novel-based

name: South America (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Frozen: Auf zum Eispalast!
description: Publisher's description: In this exciting dice game, you go on a thrilling journey through Arendelle and make your way to Elsa's Ice Palace with all your favorite Frozen characters! With a little strategy and luck of the dice you will be the first player to reach the Ice Palace and win the game!
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sokieba
description: Try to score in Sokieba by throwing five soft colorful dice at the white target dice, which are placed two to five meters away from the throwers. You'll score based on the numbers indicated on the die you hit and the die you threw, so throw accurately and hope for the best!

name: Snowball Fight
description:
Game #1 of the "Pick Your Battle" series of card games from Toresh Games

Players take turns drawing a card from a deck of 100 cards of Snowballs, Splatballs, Snowball Piles, Snow Walls and Snow Forts. After drawing a card, the player may throw the Snowball(s) or Splatballs at another player; place a Snowball Pile, Snow Wall or Snow Fort card in front of them to protect them; or discard the card if it cannot be played. Once a player has been “hit” by 10 snowballs, they are out. The last player standing is the winner.

Game instructions include 2-player and Strategic Play variants.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game

name: Fábrica dos Sonhos
description:
No matter their race, origin or desires, everyone has the right to be a child. Be it a knight or a magician, when we lie down to sleep the unconscious thoughts seem to transcend all realities. It is up to us, which is the connection between desire and thought, and the best children to all as persons. There are so many dreams created that are not so much that they have nicknamed our house of Factory of Dreams!

Take control of a mystical character such as Fairy, Unicorn, Gnome or Ente and build the dreams that citizens both crave in thoughts. Each character has a special ability that assists in their production and each citizen's card has a different dream to be built. During a match, it is necessary to send out items and emotions cards on the table according to what each citizen card is demanding.

How about joining that magnificent sword, a little courage, and giving the Warrior the glory of that very successful moment for him to kill the fearless Dragon ... in his dreams, of course! Can you be the best mystic in the game and be the employee of the month in the Factory of Dreams? Come and test your gifts, come and dream of us!

GAME SETUP: Each player stands at one end of the table. Your position is important because it determines whether a Desire card is valid for you or not according to the arrows of the cards. All players choose a character. Shuffle the Wishes deck (6 types) and reveal 16 cards in the center of the table placing four cards per row creating a 4x4 square. Shuffle the deck of Dreams and deal 2 cards to each player. The Dream cards are the template from which the player must form the same configuration with the cards arranged on the table.

GAMEPLAY: Fábrica dos Sonhos is divided into turns and actions. Each player on his turn performs the following mandatory actions:
World Change - You must remove a Wish Card from the table and place it in your hand, then replace that card with another one from the top of the Desire Deck or another one in your hand ( maximum of three cards in the hand). If you exceed the limit, before you pick up a new card, you must discard one of the cards in your hand.
Intercept - Choose between moving Desires Cards on the table or buying a new Dream card. The movement of Desires is simple. The movement points you have are equal to the number of players +1 . You can swap two orthogonally adjacent cards, or two cards diagonally that are on the corners of the 4x4 diagram. You can still rotate a letter anywhere. Each change of position or rotation counts as a point of movement.

GOAL: The objective of the players is to format the cards of the table according to the template of the cards of Dreams in their hands. The winner is the player who can achieve 3 dreams first.

COMPONENTS:
1 Rules Book
4 Character Sheet
20 Dreams Cards
38 Desires Cards
mechanics: Hand Management, Storytelling, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Wir spielen Baustelle
description:
Ui, on this site is something going on. Who helps to find the right building materials?
The children learn how to build a house step by step and to find out what kind of work and materials are needed. The adults support the children by declaring and naming construction work, building materials and vehicles after the six building lots.
When navigating the road network between construction sites, the kids also train their fine motor skills. Then the children let the colorful trucks ride along the streets. With the help of the small trucks, the children now transport the wrongly supplied building material to the right construction sites.
Depending on the development stage of the children, only three and later all construction sites are to be supplied. In assigning and discovering the colorful construction site, the everyday knowledge and logical thinking of the little ones is stimulated playfully. For older children, game variations with first rules are possible and the color cubes are used.

name: Lords
description:
Lords is a two player, card only game set in the world of SoulFall.

Each player is in charge of a fledgling tribe, growing in numbers and power along the shore of a strange land. By worshiping the four remaining fickle Lords of this peculiar land, players can expand their tribe, build temples, gather powerful shells, and pledge their allegiance to the four Lords, all in hopes of being the most powerful tribe.

Each turn, the Active player chooses 2 Actions and performs them. The other player then selects an unchosen Action.

Beseech or Deify the Lords. Prospect for Shells to gain points or abilities. Help your tribe to Flourish by gaining Followers or building Citadels. Meditate to draw more cards.

Each card gained is worth variable points, depending on how it is used.

Once all Shells or all Followers are gone, or no Temples remain, the game ends. Players gain points for the cards in their Tribe.

name: DICE Bowling
description: Dice Bowling uses two 10-sided dice and can be played with any number of players from 1 - 100. Each bowler has their own bowler card that will be based on their actual bowling statistics.

name: Monopoly: Thunderbirds 50 years limited edition
description: The classic monopoly boardgame, with a Thunderbirds themeing.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Out of Order
description:
Have you heard the hit song “WES WILL COOK JOE”? Or seen the classic movie “YOUR WRIST PUMP”? How about the children’s book “FOOD FIGHT DUDE”? What? You mean you don’t know them? That’s because they’re OUT OF ORDER! Take away a letter here, add a letter there and in 5 steps the correct answer is revealed! Clues are read one at a time. Be the first to unscramble and identify the OUT OF ORDER title to win!

—description from the publisher

name: El extraño caso de la calle Morgue
description:
A funny game of imagination.

Morgue street lived a time of maxium splendor. Its good location, the large gardens that surrounded it and its proximity to the Wax Museum were the incentives for a good number of people to decide to open their business there.

Its many shops, crossed between generations, filled the area with life and color. Unfortunately, this situation would not last forever. The mysterious disappearances began to happen in the neighborhood, night after night. With them, businesses lost their customers.

The result? The wonderful street turned into a dark and gloomy space. The only one who seemed to dare cross it was an old journalist, moved by his curiosity. He knew that a murderer was on the loose, but how to find him? In these cases, a saleswoman in a clothing store seems as suspicious as a vagabond ...

After an intense investigation, he found the answer. He hurried to call the neighbors to communicate their suspicions, but when they arrived at the newsroom, the situation they found could not be much worse: the journalist had disappeared and, with him, any evidence.

Inside the Strange Case of Morgue Street, we found a brochure entitled 'Rules of the Game'. However, it only narrated the setting and listed the components.

Cefa proposed us to initiate an investigation. A group of young people would enter the mysterious street, ready to find the identity of the murderer.

One of the owners of the inhabitants of the neighborhood would be marked as a murderer. The way and the way to discover it are the rules that you have to invent. From there, the manual left blank lines for its owner to invent game mechanics.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Un divertido juego de imaginación.

La calle Morgue vivió una época de máximo esplendor. Su buena situación, los amplios jardines que la rodeaban y su proximidad con el Museo de Cera fueron los alicientes para que un buen número de personas decidiese abrir allí su negocio.

Sus muchas tiendas, traspasadas entre generaciones, llenaban de vida y de color la zona. Por desgracia, esta situación no duraría eternamente. Las misteriosas desapariciones comenzaron a sucederse en el barrio, noche tras noche. Con ellas, los negocios perdieron a sus clientes.

¿El resultado? La maravillosa calle acabó convertida en un espacio sombrío y tenebroso. El único que parecía atreverse a cruzarla era un viejo periodista, movido por su curiosidad. Sabía que un asesino andaba suelto, ¿pero cómo encontrarlo? En estos casos, una dependienta de una tienda de ropa parece tan sospechosa como un vagabundo…

Tras una intensa investigación, encontró la respuesta. Se apresuró a llamar a los vecinos para comunicarles sus sospechas, pero cuando éstos llegaron a la redacción del periódico, la situación que encontraron no pudo ser mucho peor: el periodista había desaparecido y, con él, cualquier prueba.

En el interior de El Extraño Caso de la Calle Morgue, encontrábamos un folleto titulado ‘Reglas del Juego’. Sin embargo, en él sólo se narraba la ambientación y se enumeraban los componentes.

Cefa nos proponía iniciar una investigación. Un grupo de jóvenes se adentraría en la misteriosa calle, dispuesto a encontrar la identidad del asesino.

Uno de los dueños de los habitantes del barrio quedaría marcado como asesino. El modo y la manera de descubrirlo son las reglas que tú tienes que inventar. A partir de ahí, el manual dejaba líneas en blanco para que su propietario inventase la mecánica de juego.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing

name: Evil Overlord
description:
You are an Evil Mastermind, just waiting for your time at the top!

Of course, you're not alone in that, and you'll have to defeat the others if you want to rule the world as the Evil Overlord!

Unfortunately, your rag-tag army won't fight together, so you'll have to go to the "Evil Minion Market" and trade away the minions you don't want!

Evil Overlord is a Deck Building game condensed into 5-10 minutes

It is for 3-10 players of ages 6+

The cards represent the troops in your army

You can only play one army type, so you trade away the cards you don't want to the other players!

Everyone gets to trade, not just the loud people!

Doesn't require a moderator or phone app!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Trading

name: Run! Metro
description:
The city of Emi is continuing rapid development, so development of a railway network is needed. The players are rival development chiefs for this network.

Players will lay tiles to extend each line and increase revenue, hopefully passing tourist destinations along the way. Each connected station earns the player greater revenue. The player with the greatest revenue at the end of the game is declared the winner.

今、帝東の街は急速な発展を続けており、鉄道網の発達が望まれています。
開発主任となったプレイヤーは、ライバルのプレイヤーよりも多くの利益を会社にもたらすのが目的です。タイルを並べて各路線を延ばし、路線収入を獲得していきましょう！
​最終的に合計収入が一番多かったプレイヤーが勝利者です。
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Lost Tales of Cthulhu: Dunwich of the Dead
description:
This standalone expansion to Lost Tales of Cthulhu: Dunwich changes the horror from traditional Cthulhu horrors to Zombies. Can you save the world in a town overrun by the undead?

—user summary

name: Suomen Hauskin Huutokauppapeli
description:
Suomen Hauskin Huutokauppapeli takes the players to the world of auctioning all around Finland with Aki, Heli and Markku! Are you skilled enough to recognize the treasures among the junk and do you dare to offer enough?

In this game the players purchase items that are auctioned in Hirvaskangas and obviously try to make the most profit. The weirdest items can be the most lucrative, but the famous copper pot might tip the scales!

Suomen Hauskin Huutokauppapeli offers fun and excitement for the whole family up until the last strike of the gavel!

—description from the publisher

name: Secrets of Emerald Hill: A Murder Mystery Game
description:
At the outer reaches of London's most sought-after postcode sits Emerald Hill, the city's highly exclusive gated community. When Mr. Addington, the snobbish owner of the estate, is found dead on the marble floor of his en suite bathroom, it's clear that his death was no accident. Each of the residents, from Tiffany the VHS fitness queen to Keith the daytime soap heartthrob, is hiding an explosive secret, but only one of them would go so far as to kill in order to protect that secret!

Set in the 80s, when hair was big and shoulder pads were bigger, this immersive murder mystery will see you and your fellow dinner guests become both murder suspects and detectives for the evening. Will you be able to unravel the clues, pinpoint the motives and solve the murder before coffee is served?

name: Christmas Rush
description:
Christmas RUSH is an elimination game and played like the popular card game Spoons.

Game cards are quickly passed between players as the iconic sounds of the holiday season echo in the air. "Merry Christmas," "Jingle Bells," or "Bah, humbug," fellow players might say but don't get too distracted by all the ruckus and fray. Your goal is to collect a set of four identical cards and beat the Christmas RUSH for a game token or else you are out of the game!

The Twist...
Six special action cards add even more excitement to this fast-paced game! Say the phrase printed on these cards when passing them to other players or sing a couple of words from your favorite Christmas carol as you pass the Sing card.

Contents: 62 game cards, 7 Christmas game tokens, and game rules.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Voll Vereiert
description: Voll Vereiert is a roll-and-write-game where players try to find Easter eggs on their lawn. One players throws a single die each round and in each round the players have to graze one field on their lawn. If the number on the egg on this field is equal to the number on the die they find an Easter egg. The first player to find 4 of the same or 6 different eggs will win.

name: Crossing Fates
description:
In Crossing Fates 7 different nations fight for supremacy. But temporary alliances give players special powers with which they can score more points, or steal from their opponents.
Cleverly play and match cards for Fate Points and combine totems for various effects. A deceptively simple game with lots of strategy. Will you win the Battle of Fates?

Crossing Fates is a competitive card game for 2 to 4 players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Matching, Take That, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Octopie
description: Octopie is an undersea race to gather eight matching arms for your octopus! Roll the die to see whether you draw from the octo-pile, flip over a tentacle tile to reveal the color lying beneath, or swap with an opponent. Find an arm holding a pie, and you get a tasty extra action to help win the race. Be the first to complete your octopus to win.

name: Of Mines and Men: Roll and Write Edition
description:
A mysterious roll and write, print and play game. Explore the mines, find treasures and discover the secret that lies beneath the surface.
Choose your favorite miner, gather resources, craft objects and get out of the mines in time... but beware! Dynamite is extremely dangerous and unstable.
The game includes:
Single player campaign
Multiplayer co-op
PVP
Paper clicker game mode

Single Player quick rules
GAME SETUP

Choose the mission you want to play. It’s better to play them in order;
Pick the game map related to the mission you chose;
Choose your character wisely (the starting object may be crucial);
Choose the entrance where you want to begin your adventure. Analyze carefully


the tasks that you must accomplish in order to complete the mission, it’s important to pick the best spot to start;

The first turn begins. You have 16 turns to complete your mission and escape the mines. On the 17th turn, you lose the game. Don’t forget to mark the current spot in the progression bar placed at the bottom of the map.


TURN STRUCTURE
Movement: first, roll dice to determine the number of spots you can move. You can move in any direction, up to the number you obtained. If you roll 2 dice, you must choose one of the two results. You can use the other result to craft an object.
Action: once you’ve moved to the desired spot, check your Character Card to see the number of dice you can roll to perform actions. Both “Gathering” and “Extracting” have their own specific value that you must obtain to perform that specific action. You can use one or more dice to craft objects.
End of turn: once you’ve completed all your actions, mark the current spot of the progress bar at the bottom of the board. When you are in a “dynamite” spot, throw dice to determine where the explosion will block your way.

name: I felt...
description:
Cooperate with each other to guess how the judge is feeling!

I felt... is a cooperative game in which you are divided into “the judge” and “the respondent”. The challenge is to guess the feelings of the judge within the set time limit by asking questions and discussing with your fellow respondents. The game ends when each player has played the role of the judge. The goal is to get all the questions right and become “umomoi”!

Even through the same experience, how one reacts varies from person to person. Sometimes understanding how others feel can be confusing. But understanding how others are feeling is marvelous and exciting. I felt... is a party game that will continue to stimulate conversation even after the game is over!

—description from the publisher

name: Through The Woods
description: かばんにいっぱい ("Through the Woods") is a set collection and shopping game. Everyone becomes a forest animal and prepares for hibernation. During the three seasons of Spring, Summer, and Autumn, travel the path while collecting the blessings of the forest in your bag and shop at the Bear store at the bottom of the forest. Animals who are ready for the most wonderful winter retreat can stay at the Bear's Hotel and ride the super swing.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Track Movement, Turn Order: Time Track
publishers: Banjo Yugi Seisakujo BGM (盤上遊戯製作所 BGM), STUDIO U×F

name: Lucky
description:
Who can steal faster than a shadow? In Lucky, the entire crew is gathered to split up the huge haul of gold, silver, jade, pearls, and gemstones...but everyone wants the biggest haul of themselves, of course. This requires the right tactics and dice luck.

You all take turns placing your treasure cards in the middle of the table. Now the person whose turn it is rolls up to five dice, depending on the number of cards on display that are to be won. If the roll succeeds, the treasures from the center or those of the other players become their own. Treasures are never safe from the others, though, and can be stolen again...

name: War to End Wars
description:
This game consists of a thin BOX with artwork by Rodger MacGowan, a 17-inches by 22-inches 5-color Map sheet, 200 die-cut cardboard counters, a Rules Booklet, while players will have to provide writing utensils, a 6-sided DIE, and make copies of the STATUS sheet before play.

The area that the Map sheet covers is from the Western Front through Russia and the Mediterranean down through the Caucasus and Turkey with some of Persia & Egypt included.

There are also the Turn Record Track, Terrain Key & Effests Charts, Morale Chart, Troop Class table, U.S. Build Box, Turn Sequence, and separate Entente & Central Powers Morale Tracks.

A very small "Errata" sheet is included pointing out that the colors for the Greek, Serbian, Austrian, and Romanians weren't listed as well as clarifying the set-up of Austrian Class 2 units.

The game counters are of various colors such as Greek-RED print on YELLOW, Serbian-RED on Light BLUE, Austrian-BLUE on WHITE, U.K.-BLACK on RED, French-BLACK on BLUE, Russia-BLACK on Pale GREEN, Italy-BLACK on KHAKI, U.S.A.-BLACK on GREEN, Turkey-BLACK on YELLOW, Montenegro-WHITE on RED, Bulgaria-BLACK on Pale YELLOW, Romanian-BLACK on APRICOT, Germany-BLACK on GRAY.

The Rules have some charts in the back with the Combat Results Table, Artillery Table, Submarine Warfare Table, Summary of Factors Affecting Morale, & an additional rule, 9.7 Port.

The game consists of 18 Seasonal Turns with 16 Phases: 4-Strategic & 12 Tactical. During Strategic Phases the following is conducted: 1.Submarine Phase; 2.Neutrality Phase; 3.Production Phase; 4.Strategic Movement Phase-a)Entente, b)Central Powers. The Tactical phases are: 1.1st-Entente Movement, 2.1st-Entente Combat, then 3.1st-Central Powers Movement, 4.1st-Central Powers Combat, followed by this sequence 5 more times.

Included in the detailed Rules are provisions for Amphibious Invasion, Artillery Effects, Weather, Troop Class, Weather Effects, Supply, Sub Warfare, Morale Effects, Tanks, Stosstruppen, Fortified Cities, Surrender, and Production while the OPTIONAL Rules provide for Initiative, and the Austrian Navy Effects.

The credits include playtesters from the Boeing Employees Wargaming Club: John Brinley, Dane Anderson, Joe Buoy, Cliff Chapin, Todd Flegel, Paul Brown, John Eikanger, & Joe Gregg, as well as Gordon Patterson & Alistair Brown with Rules editing by Nicky Palmer & Joe Gregg.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Industry / Manufacturing, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Kumare
description:
Kumare - The Game from South America

"You are at Amazonas and the Shaman Serpent Head has stolen the spirit of your tribe. By [consulting] the Shaman Jaguar Eye you have obtained the amulets [your 6 playing pieces] which will help you to recover the spirit. Now you must reach the Kumare [the central 4 squares of the board], place one of your amulets there and [place] another three amulets on one of the lines of the sun. You will have to confront other players who, like you, are endeavoring to rescue the spirit of their tribe. However, only one will be successful."

Components: 24 Amulet Chips (6 of a distinct design for each of up to 4 players), Gameboard, 1 D6

Gameboard is an 8x8 grid, with the central 4 squares making up the Kumare. It is separated into 4 levels. Amulets (pieces) start off the board and enter at the arrows. You must move your amulets onto the board and move by the roll of the die within a level. You may only move up a level if you move one of your amulets between two other amulets belonging to any player(s). You may also send another player's amulet off the board (thereby needing to re-enter the first level) by surrounding it with 2 of your amulets or 1 of your amulets and one of another player's.

Win by forming 4-in-a-row with your amulets following the 'lines of the sun' (vertical, horizontal or diagonal lines which include the Kumare (the 4x4 central Sun space).

Made in Mexico - Rules in Spanish and English.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Press Start Pocket: Series 1
description:
Press Start Pocket is a 2 player game deck of 56 cards.

Each deck (Series 1, Series 2, Series 3) is a stand-alone 2 player game. Two decks can be combined for a 3-4 player game, and 3 decks can be combined for a 5-6 player game. Combining decks also gives expanded capabilities for warriors.


Battle to win control of the pixel world.

Players start with a video game warrior and battle their opponent to take control of the video game universe.

There is no hiding, to win you have to battle.

Overview:

Both players get 7 cards and the rest of the cards are placed in 2 piles face down in the middle of the table.

Pile 1 is a warrior card pile

Pile 2 is an action card pile

The first player draws and action card then either attacks, plays a gather card to earn points toward another warrior or discards.

During a battle the players follow the attacks and counters rule according to the reference card.

To win a player must win 3 battles or earn 4 soldiers all alive at once.

Integrates with:


Press Start Pocket: Series 2
Press Start Pocket: Series 3

name: Rubik's Game
description:
The world's most famous puzzle challenge is no longer a solitary occupation. It's now a mind-stretching, all absorbing, 3-dimensional strategy game, whose playing surface can be rearranged to form billions upon billions of different patterns.
So choose your cube colors, place the pegs on your cube squares, trying for three pegged squares of the same color, all in a row, all on the same side of the cube, and then give the cube a twist to foil your opponents' strategies

name: Månvalla med V5
description:
Månvalla med V5 is a Swedish game of horse-racing. It includes a system for betting.

The game is an updated version of a game called simply Månvalla from the 1950s.

Note: Månvalla harness racing track does not really exist, it's a paraphrase on Sweden's largest and most famous harness racing track, Solvalla in Stockholm.

name: Scooby-Doo! Get That Dog
description: Sixteen pairs of colorful pictures including Scooby-Doo in his funniest poses, all of his friends, and the Mystery Machine are hidden! On your turn, pick any two cards, trying to get a match. Find a pair and you get to keep it. Get a matching pair of Take Scooby and you get to take the Scooby figure. There s no better way to have fun and sharpen your memory skills than with Scooby-Doo.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Schweizer Reise
description:
Tour of Switzerland with super adventures
exciting dice game for 2-6 adventurous travelers from 8 years of age.

12 destinations are drawn before each game to provide a new and interesting route through the whole of Switzerland. On the journey players collect as many granite and gold pieces as possible. Granite is given to the first player to reach the destination by luck of the dice and tactics. Players who then guess or bluff correctly the <Population>, <Height above sea level>, <Canton and geographic position>, <Places of interest and history> or <Family activities> get more granite pieces. If you aim to hight, however, you may lose what you have already won. You can experience super adventures on the way to advance more quickly and get more granite pieces. The player holding the most granite and gold pieces at the end is the winner"

name: Bible Baseball
description:
Baseball is great family fun. Even young children can get a base hit or bring the whole team home with a dinger. Bible Baseball has been a home run in the classroom for years. Whether you use it as a “seventh inning stretch” between lesson series or as a “sandlot” game in a classroom learning center, Bible Baseball is a Christian education MVP. What a great combination: the big league thrill of baseball and the Word of God. Cheer your friends and family on as the knock one out of the park. You’ll have a great time and will also learn about the Bible.

The pitcher has hundreds of questions about God’s Word and the right answer can get the players on first, second, or third base. They can even get a home run! The colorful newly designed game board and pieces help keep track of who is on which base as well as the score and the number of outs. All that’s missing are the hot dogs and peanuts! Bible Baseball is great for family fun, but it also is helpful in the classroom or Sunday School setting.

name: Chicken Party
description:
A childrens game to test your reflexes. But also fun to play with adults.

Every player has a hen house with nests in four different colours, each filled with 1, 2 or 3 eggs. There are two dice: one with numbers and one with colours. In the middle of the table lies the egg.
On your turn you throw both dice. Each player who has a nest that matches colour and number of eggs and still without a chicken, tries to grab the egg in the middle. If so he can put a chicken on the nest. If someone catches the egg by mistake, he has to return a hen. When the die shows a feather, the player can take a chicken from an opponent.

The first to bring nine chickens in his hen house is the winner.

Content: 4 hen houses, 36 nests, 36 hens, 2 dice, 1 egg.

name: Kosminen kierros
description:
In Kosminen kierros ("Cosmic Tour"), the players are astronauts flying in a spaceship circumnavigating and exploring the solar system. Each player shares responsibility for ensuring that the ship makes it safely back to Earth, but at the same time should try to collect as much information about the solar system to win the game when the ship makes it back to Earth.
The game has two separate game boards. The first board represents the solar system, on which the players' spaceship pawn is moved. If the ship flies off the grid, hits a planet or the sun, the ship is destroyed and all players lose the game. The board also includes Event-markers, which are turned over when the ship flies on them, and have a surprising impact on game play.
The other board represents the inside of the spaceship, where players move their astronaut pawns. Each turn, a player must move from one module of the spaceship to another and carry out an action. The actions that can be carried out in the different modules are:
-Bridge: turn the ship's inclination (to determine which direction the ship moves in)
-Observatory: draw two Data cards (giving points at the end of the game)
-Storage: draw two Equipment cards (useful items to be used during the game to save the ship from destruction or help the player's own game
-Engine room: move the ship pawn forward one step.

The game has three levels of game play with increasing complexity. On level two, Captain's Orders cards are added to the game, which are played whenever a player moves to the Bridge, giving that player an additional action. Also, the scoring system for Data cards becomes based on set collection. On level three, Escape pods are included, which allow a player to win the game even if the ship is destroyed.

This game was custom designed to order, and is intended mainly for a specific target market, i.e. children aged 8-14. It is an educational game at heart, in which the players learn about the solar system, and the importance of working together for a common goal, while having lots of fun. But naturally anybody can play it, and it works specially well as a game that the whole family can enjoy together

name: Bejeweled Blitz
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Ready, set, match! Featuring lights and sounds from PopCap's popular Facebook game and mobile app, Hasbro's Bejeweled Blitz dazzles with sparkling, translucent three-dimensional gem tiles. Kids will have fun finding matches of three while building gem towers. The first to get rid of all their gem tiles before time runs out wins!

name: Bocce Dice
description: Bocce Dice is an action/dexterity game where players take turns rolling 4 standard six-sided dice towards a target Score Zone located on a rectangular play mat. Each player has their own Score Zone that gives them points, but the player can also attempt to reduce their opponent's points by attempting to knock their opponent's dice from the play mat. At the end of every round, the points are totaled and the player with the most points wins the round. The first player to win 10 rounds wins the game.

name: The Eng Chiang
description:
"The Eng Chiang" is a board game, that combines a Taiwanese retro game with a common snack food, roasted sausage.It is a very interesting and effective ice-breaker for events and gatherings.
Welcome to the sausage world of Taiwan!

The players put together a sausage with "The Eng Chiang Tao" Card x2 "The Eng Chiang" Card x8.

Starting with the Dealer, each player takes turn clockwise in rolling the dices.

The player who rolls the largest number takes sausage of the player who rolls the smallest number.

When a player could only put together a "mini sausage" (with only eng chiang tao card),the player with the longest sausage wins a Garlic,and the game resets to the next round.

Goal
a. A player who obtains three Garlics wins.
b. A player who obtains the most Garlics within 30 mins wins.

name: Laser
description:
Lazer is a cute kitty, and as such, loves to chase moving spots of light. To make the game more exciting for her, show her how to change the color by mixing 2 color frequencies with prisms and creating a third color. The player that can mix colors the best will be the winner here.

Semi-cooperative mode:

To set up the game the 12 tiles have to be placed on the table in a circle. Laser the cat will be placed randomly onto one of them. After this, the remaining 11 tiles each have to be filled with one prism meeple. The cards showing the color mixing rules have to be placed next to the tiles.

Each round starts by drawing two prism cards from the deck, these show the next color mixing tasks. The players have 30 seconds to find the solution, that is which meeples (or the cat) to move how many tiles to a meeple on another tile in order to make the requested colors. After 30 seconds each player shows a number 2 to 10 simultaneously, this indicates that they can solve the task in that many moves. The player with the bid closest to the starting player’s bid will join him/her. Without communicating, they have to solve the task by moving the meeples in turns under the indicated number of movements. If they succeed, they receive points equal to the number of movements. The winner is the player with the most points once the round is complete (everybody was starting player once).

Competitive mode

Setup is the same as in semi-cooperative mode, except you use the backside of the tiles (depicting 3 different types of floor: wood, stone, carpet) and the prism cards (not only the required color is indicated, but also the type of floor where the mixing is to be to performed ). When the first player claims a number of movements in which he/she can solve the problem, the 30 second countdown starts. In these 30 seconds all the players can decrease the bid by claiming a lower number. After the 30 seconds ends, the player bidding the lowest has to solve both prism cards in as many movements as the bid. If he/she manages to complete it, he/she will score points. If somebody fails 3 times, they will receive minus 6 points. The first player to reach 15 points will win the game.

name: Hidden Identity
description:
Intrigue, strategy, and knowledge await in the world of Hidden Identity where the answers are obvious, the clues obscure. Test your wits and challenge your brain.

Four clues are available as players attempt to uncloak the identity of famous people, places, times, and events. The fewer clues needed, the more spaces a player/team advances.

Be the first to move four pieces from the four corners of the Hidden Identity world to the center of the game to win. Or, use moves to bump opponents back.

Strategy and fun await. Test your wits and discover details of the famous whos, whats, whens and wheres. Battle to see whose brain can master Hidden Identity.

name: Ping Win
description:
Each player has 4 penguins. Place your penguins on the board and roll a die to move your penguin. Because of this movement other penguins get closer to the edge of the iceberg. The purpose is to keep your penguins as long as possible on the iceberg. Push other penguins off the ice and win.

From the back of Iceberg box:
The object of the game is to have the only remaining penguin or penguins left on the "iceberg" by pushing opponent's penguins off the "iceberg".
Each player chooses four penguins of the same color and places these on the correctly coloured dots on the playing board. By rolling the die players move either 1, 2 or 3 places to the left or right in order to push other penguins nearer to the edge of the iceberg. or even into the water. A penguin pushed into the water is out of the game. The game is over when only one player's penguin or penguins remain on the "iceberg" and this one remaining player is the winner.

From the back of the Ping Win box:

"The comical penguins have a rare old time playing at pushing each other off the "ice floe". The last player to have a penguin or penguins left on the ice is the winner."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Crown & Andrews Ltd., Hausemann & Hötte N.V., Jumbo, Milton Bradley, Nathan

name: Big Brain Bang
description: Big Brain Bang makes it possible to peek inside the human brain to see what happens there. Together with the other players, you take on the roles of competing thoughts that seek to take control of as many neurons as possible. A brain model built of cardboard neuron network tiles will appear right on your gaming table. By the end of the game, the owner of the biggest network wins!

name: Appalachian Trail Game: Backpacking Edition
description:
Create your own adventure on the Appalachian Trail as you hike your way along the nearly 2,200 mile footpath from Georgia to Maine. GEAR, CHANCE, and CHALLENGE Cards define your journey along this Trail's map.

1 TRAIL MAP - On your turn, move your DIY game piece 1 space (unless the Chance card instructs otherwise) along this waterproof, fold out game board map of the Appalachian Trail. Each space has a color indicating which type of card play occurs: brown, blue, or green.

20 GEAR Cards - These cards are distributed evenly at the beginning of the game and are visible in front of each player throughout. If you land on a Brown space, you have the option to swap 1 Gear card with the player of your choice.

50 CHANCE Cards - If you land on a Blue space, draw a Chance card and follow its instructions. Encounter opportunities to race ahead, hazards that slow your pace, or choose to stop and enjoy the trail. If you have a Gear card that helps you overcome a Chance card's emergency scenario and the Chance card has a point value, add it to your Trail Journal stack; otherwise, return it to the bottom of the main stack.

75 CHALLENGE Cards - Always keep 5 of these cards hidden in your hand, drawing another after one is played. If you land on a Green space, receive a Challenge question from the hand of a player of your choice. Answer Trivia (39 cards) about hiking first aid, Trail history, LEAVE NO TRACE camping and backpacking skills, or identify Animals (27 cards) and Plants (9 cards). If you answer correctly, add this point-having Challenge card to your Trail Journal stack; otherwise, add it to the other player's stack.

1 Thru Hike Card - The game ends when the first player takes the 5-point Thru Hike card -- arriving at one of the ends of the Trail. All players then tally the points from their Trail Journal card stacks and the player with the most points is the Winner!

name: Play Western
description:
Another game of the 4 square cardboard games from Scandecor (Play Racing, Play Olympic, Play Western, Play Pirates).

A railroad track crosses the longish board and a small train drives from left to right (and back if a longer play is wanted) with gold barrels in his wagon.

Each player has 2 desperadoes who must try to steal these gold barrels and bring them in his hideout. A turn consists of a roll of 2 dice, where one must be used for the movement of the train. Since the train must stop at all 5 stations spread around the board, it moves slow enough, that desperadoes of several players will meet it quite often and they can try to kill each other and take the gold barrel in this way.

As with all games of the series, the board is illustrated with funny comics.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Bristol Edition
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Bristol, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Heisse Öfen
description:
A motorcycle racing game for young children with beautiful wooden pieces. Players "press their luck" by rolling color dice and advancing around the track - but woe to the motorcyclist who rolls the same color on both dice! The first player to complete 5 laps wins the race.

Ages 4 and up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Jackpot
description:
Every round begins this way: One player is designated the contestant. The other players receive a folder. Every folder contains a riddle. All but one folder get a value card from $10 to $100. The remaining folder has a card that says “Jackpot!” The Super Target spinner is spun to determine a random three-digit target number and a random four-digit Super Jackpot number.

The contestant calls upon the others, one at a time, to add their value to the jackpot as long as the contestant can solve the riddles posed. The contestant changes places with riddler who stumped the contestant. When the Jackpot riddle is exposed, the contestant and the riddler split the jackpot if the riddle is solved. When the last three digits of the jackpot match the target number, the Super Jackpot is won by the contestant if the riddle is solved.

Another round begins when the jackpot riddle is revealed. The number of rounds played is equal to the number of players in the game. The player with most money is the winner.

The game is faithful adaptation of a television series. Two different versions of the box art exist. One has the game logo on the cover; the other shows a jubilant woman in front of the logo. Both boxes contain the same game.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Shake Bingo
description:
Players take turns rolling a pair of dice. After each roll, a player places two chips on the board to cover the two numbers he or she rolled. One's are wild, doubles make you lose a turn. The goal is to make a complete row of 6 chips across, up/down or diagonally.

There's also a variant for 4 players in teams of two.

name: Catch the Fly!
description:
The goal of the game is to catch the fly cards with a racket according to the die rolled.

If no visible fly are on the die roll, then player can try to catch the no fly card with their racket.

The player that catches the most flies wins the game

name: Se hva jeg kan!
description:
(From the box - translated from Norwegian)

Se hva jeg kan! (See what I can!) is a trivia game for the smallest children.

There are many things which needs to be learned and set in systems. Here the children learn of concepts, language, spelling, rhymes, numbers, seasons, weekdays and colours in a fun way.

The game is designed for children who has not started school yet, and prepares the child for the concepts that is used in school. Some questions may be easy for your child, but the game also contributes to the child getting conscious of it's knowledge and the concepts it is based on, and gives a experience of mastering. The game demands an adult to participate.

name: Blöff
description: Each player (from 2 to 4) has a special cup containing one single dice. The player in turn after shaking his special dice cup, secretly examine the result and announces it. This announcement can be or not in agreement with the actual result. The other players can distrust in the veracity of the affirmation and then control the dice result looking through the hole on the top of the device. If the suspicion was false, the player in turn moves his pawn the double dice result forwards. If the bluff really existed and was correctly pointed, the player in turn must move his pawn the double dice result backwards. If there is no suspicions, the player move his pawn the actual dice number obtained forwards. The winner is the first player to reach the final space on the board. Symbols on some fields change the position of the pawns when they land on them.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Damm / Egmont, Kirjalito, Pelito, Schmidt Spiele

name: Conni schnappt die Pizza
description:
Conni is a famous german children’s book character.

Conni baked with her friend Simon Pizza. Together with mama and small brother Jacob they nearly ate the whole pizza. Only one piece is left. Of course everyone wants to have it, even cat Mau.
Who can get move the piece of pizza on his plate at first? But beware of cat Mau!

name: Tintenherz: Das Spiel zum Film
description: Tintenherz Das Spiel zum Film is an abstract tile game based upon the film (Inkheart, in English), featuring scenes from the film. Players move around the board, looking for matched pairs as in a memory game. Each player takes the role of a character from the film, receiving a related special action to take during the game.

name: Monopoly: Boston Red Sox Collector's Edition
description:
For the die-hard Red Sox fan, could there possibly be anything better than a box seat at Fenway Pak for the World Series Championship? Until that elusive day arrives, the Monopoly brand is proud to present the Boston Red Sox Collector's Edition of the world's most famous board game. Commemorating one of the most storied ball clubs in Major League Baseball, this Monopoly game is a must-have collectible for the serious (and patient) fan of the illustrious Boston Red Sox.

This collector's game captures and brings to life the glory of the Olde Towne Team. Home to some of the greatest moments in baseball history, Fenway Park and its players continue to make for exciting play in this classic game of risk taking and deal making. "Fenway Faithful" can now buy, sell and trade the best of the Red Sox, and own it all - up to, but not including - # 6!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Too Bad!
description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

Too Bad! is a perfect information game in which players want to be the first to bring all their dice home. Each player has dice that start with the face-up numbers 1-4, with the 4s in the starting spot farthest from home, the 3s in the next starting spot, and so on.

On a turn, a player moves one of her dice as many spaces as the sum of all the dice sharing the same space. Land on a "slip & flip" slide, and you knock off any dice in the middle of the slide, while flipping your die upside-down at the end of the ride. Thus, a 4 becomes a 3, a 3 becomes a 2, and so on.

name: The Sadowa Campaign 1866 AD
description:
A person could make the case that Sadowa is the single most significant battle in the last 200 years.

What? An unheard-of campaign from an almost overlooked war(Austria v Prussia, 1866)? But consider... if the Austrians had won at Sadowa, there might not have been a powerful Prussia, who beats the French in 1870, unites Germany, and competes with Great Britain. Is there a World War I? Take away WWI, and is there a WWII?

Designed by veteran Jim Werbaneth, The Sadowa Campaign lets players explore the historical options, covering the entire campaign area--your decisive battles might happen somewhere else besides Sadowa! Initiative is key and captures the sweeping moves each side made (or tried to).

Can you, as the Prussia player, start the path toward Germany being a world power? Or can you, as the Austrian player, avert the future catastrophe Germany's ambition will bring to Europe?

name: Bacteria Hysteria
description:
Oh no, bacilli as far as the eye can see: In game "Bacteria Hysteria" Halskratzi, Schnupfentierchen, Bauchgrummelo and Co. swirling around in front of the other players around. On the cards, on the dice, practically everywhere the danger lurks. Although they look cute and harmless, they do not want anyone. Only those who dice well and act quickly can get rid of many of the microscopic creatures. For even more thrills, the 40-second timer, which works relentlessly.

In the middle of the table is a stack of 108 cards and 10 dice. From each side of the dice one of the six different colored bacilli grins cheekily into the round. Before you can start, each player places six cards face down in front of him. Now the youngest player grabs the dice, activates the timer and quickly turns his cards on. To get rid of these, he needs at least two identical bacilli and at least two cube images of the corresponding bacillus, about two green ear cucumbers or three gray-purple cough monsters. Was Fortuna merciful? Then two, three or even more of these Bazillenkarten come to a pile and new ones are drawn. It will be diced again until the timer jumps into the air after 40 seconds.

In turn, once each of the two to four players (from six years) on the train, is scored. Who made the most cards and routed most bacilli? Jackpot - the first winning chip is conquered, with three chips you win the fast dice game for the whole family, which requires a good eye-hand coordination and raises the body temperature from the hustle and bustle - even without "Fieberchen".

name: Süniálom
description:
Autumn has arrived, the hedgehog family is preparing for a winter dream. Hedgehog diligently collects the autumn leaves to line the soft nook under the bushes. Help him collect as many leaves as possible!

Players roll the die to collect 1,2, or 3 leaves from the tree. But don't roll the wind or all your leaves will be blown away.

Which player will be the most skillful? Who manages to get more leaves and put them on your hedgehog? Fun family board game - not just for preschoolers.

name: Magna-Tiles: Treasure Hunt
description: Magna-Tiles: Treasure Hunt combines the power of play with hands-on learning and creativity! Collect golden coins in Jungle Treasure, act like a monkey in Island Race, or create their own game by making new rules! Magna-Tiles: Treasure Hunt is a great first game that grows with your child and encourages fine motor skills, imagination, social development, and more!

name: Monopoly: Boutique Edition
description: This edition of Monopoly (which is a Toys R Us exclusive item for the Holiday 2007 season in the US) comes with an assortment of borderline-cliched items aimed at girls, including a pink board and dice, a keepsake box for storage (which also serves as a jewelry box), Boutiques and Malls (instead of Houses and Hotels), and Instant Message and Text Message cards in lieu of Chance and Community Chest cards.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Riverboat Showdown
description: With a hand of 8 cards, players must either play a lower card than one on display, taking chips from the kitty, a higher card, (paying chips into the kitty), or multiple cards which match the number on display. When one player plays all cards, the other players must pay that player chips equal to the remaining value of cards in their hand.

name: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea Game
description:
Concentration and good judgment are needed to pilot your Submarines to safety and win in this game. A fleet of eight WHITE friendly Submarines is at the BOTTOM OF THE SEA and eight BLACK enemy Submarines are on top. Using “torpedoes,” the BLACK subs try to destroy the WHITE ones. Both kinds of Submarines can only shoot Torpedoes in a forward direction, and destroy an Opponent’s Sub at close range.

The object of the game is to move your Submarine into close range, (a Red Dot next to an Opponent) swing it around into position to “shoot a Torpedo.” Moves are governed by the spin of the Dial. When one player has lost all of his Submarines, the other player wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical

name: Hot Hoops
description:
Hot Hoops is a battery-operated game that can be played by either one or two players. Each player selects a plastic player shooter and a set of balls to shoot baskets into a revolving backboard. The player with the most baskets at the end of 8 balls wins the game.

From the manufacturer's website:

In the mood for a little basketball action? Well, with Hot Hoops, the basketball game, you can shoot hoops whenever and wherever you want! One-on-one gaming action provides hours of intense basketball fun!

Hot Hoops Basketball Game includes four basketballs for non-stop play

FEATURES:

Be the First Player to Shoot All the Basketballs Successfully through the Hoop (Thereby Ridding Yourself of All the Balls) to Win
Connected Basketball Hoops allow Basketball to Pass from One Player to Another Thereby Increasing the Competitive Play
1- or 2-Player Game
Spring-loaded Lever Enables Quick and Challenging Basketball Shooting
Game Folds Up with Easy-Grip Handle for Easy Transport and Storage

name: Soul of Princess
description:
A game of bluffing and deduction.
Box Included:
8 cards number from 1~8:
1. Princess (whit)
2. Rats (Black)
3. Slime (Black)
4. Dog (whit)
5. Beast (Black)
6. Knight (whit)
7. King (whit)
8. Cat (Black)

10 Score Coins (2 sides, black and white)
1 Sand Timeer
1 Menu

Shuffle.
2 players: Each player draw 2, left 4 cards on table and 2 face up, 2 down.
3 players: Each player draw 2, left 2 cards on table and 1 face up, 1 down.
4 players: Each player draw 2, left 0 card on table.

Follow steps:
1. Play a card from hands(face down).
2. Turn the cards over in the same time, if any player play "princess," he must trade "princess" with another player hands of his choice.
3. The card that he trade, must play on table immediately. If he win, he can get a extra score coin.
4. The card with larger number on table can trade with any card on table of his choice(opinion), If he traded and win, he can get a extra score coin.
5. Shows hands, and compare score.
6. Score base on hands + the card that you played. Play with higher score win.

Japanese description:
王国と魔の軍勢の戦いの中、
その身を捧げる姫騎士の運命は･･･
ポーカーライクな頭脳＆心理戦ゲーム

name: Drive
description: Drive "The Exciting Motoring Game - for all the family" Is a road tile lying game from Great Britain. The road tiles are sections of street networks, with traffic signs, hazards, etc… Road tiles can help you or hinder your progress to the finish tile. You start by placing the start and finish cards in the center of the table and lay street tiles to further your cars to the finish tile. First car to the finish tile wins. This game is approved by the Royal society for the Prevention of Accidents.

name: Rough: The Card Game
description:
Some games are tough, some are torture, some are easy, but this game is Rough.

This game strives to take the game play dynamics everyone is used to and turn them on their head. A fast paced game where people are sometimes eliminated from the game before they even get to play a card.

Players get five cards at the beginning of the game. Players play a card on their turn that forces one player, two players, or the whole group to perform a physical, or ridiculous task to stay in the game. Asking the question, who wants it more?

Turn after turn people will be eliminated, and the winner of the game, is the last player in the game.

Designed for those with the super competitive edge!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play, Real-time
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Outburst Junior: Travel Edition
description:
The pocket-sized Outburst Junior Travel Edition offers a convenient way to take fun of Outburst Junior with you!

Just as in the original Outburst Junior! games, players (as individuals or in teams) have 60 seconds to yell out answers in various familiar categories. Teams may shout out as many answers as possible, but only the ten answers that appear on the Topic Card (as viewed through a special view-finder) will score points. Topic cards include such categories as "Things You Take on a Camping Trip," "Kinds of Boats," and "Ways You Know You're Getting Sick." Those who get the most correct answers and earn the most points will triumph!

name: Il Gioco della Patente a Punti
description:
In this game you take the role of a car driver, and the aim is to arrive at the end of the track with all having at least 20 points on the driving license.
During the game, you have to answer questions about the Highway Code and if you give the wrong answer, you lose points and you have to go back to a driving school to regain them.

name: Spitting Image
description:
The game is based on the popular 80's television series of the same name...

Each player is a world leader with three scandals to protect. The object of the game is to expose all the other players' scandals before they expose yours.

No dice are involved. A player may choose to move between one and six spaces clockwise around the board. The player then follows any special instructions written on the space that he or she lands on (these include collecting a Dirty Tricks Card, collecting a cash handout from the Hush Fund, calling a Press Conference, using the Shredder, hiding in a Safe House, or Passing The Buck). A non-player character, the Journalist, is moved the same number of spaces clockwise around the board. If the journalist lands on a space occupied by another player, one of that player's three scandals is placed in the middle of the board and auctioned off to the highest bidder. The player who wins the scandal card may then try to expose it by first landing on a Press Conference square, and then making an accusation against the player whose scandal it is. The accuser may choose to blackmail the accused and accept a cash payment in exchange for a temporary reprieve, or the players contest the accusation using Dirty Tricks. If the accusation is successful, the scandal is removed from the game and the accuser gets $50 Million as a reward. If unsuccessful, the accused gets a scandal back and receives $10 Million compensation. Once all a player's scandals are exposed, he or she is out of the game. If the player who owns the scandal gets to The Shredder before being accused at a Press Conference, he or she takes the unexposed scandal back. Play continues until only one world leader remains with any unexposed scandals... He or she is the winner!
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Political

name: Bandito
description: Players roll dice and then challenge other players to beat their highest roll. An action die is rolled at the same time and this affects the roll of the D6's in the game.

name: Cops 'n' Robbers
description:
Object: To be the first squad Car to catch Slippery Sid.

The notorious criminal Slippery Sid has escaped from Jail and is hiding somewhere in the City. Hunted by Police, he is on the move from one hideout to another. You have a Police Squad car and you must try and trap Slippery Sid on one of his hideouts before he escapes to another.

The playing area represents the street plan of the City: these are 25 colored sites where Slippery Sid may be hiding.

The arrows on the road indicate one-way streets and the telephone handsets mark the places where you can get a radio message from Police Headquarters. Some of the radio messages will give you clues about Slippery Sid's hideout.
publishers: Borras Plana S.A., F.X. Schmid, Holdsworth Thos & Sons, Joker, Nathan, Waddingtons

name: Gnomes: The Great Sweeping of Ammowan
description:
Gnomes: The Great Sweeping of Ammowan is a storytelling game that is designed to bring a shared adventure to life for age 3 to adult.

The game includes a storyteller's guide and letters from the gnomes, which provides the backstory and step by step instruction on how to take your kids on a memorable adventure to save Ammowan, a gnome kingdom that happens to exist in your yard or home!

The storyteller(s) will weave this magical tale about the gnomes, and the gnome’s arch enemy; trolls.

Every 365 days, the great sweeping hits the gnome kingdom. This is a time when trolls sweep through the area looking to capture gnomes. And they need your help.

This is an adventure meant to be led by an adult and experienced by children.

During the game, one player acts as the storyteller who sets the scene by placing evidence of a gnome civilization as outlined in the storyteller's guide and then leads players on a quest. As a cooperative experience, players must find clues and solve riddles placed during the set up phase by the storyteller (and included in with game). Players win if they can successfully discover all hidden items by solving the problems presented by the storyteller. They will lose if all items cannot be found through cooperation and deduction within a set period of time.

name: War of the Daleks
description:
Based on the popular Dr Who baddies "War of the Daleks" is a kind of sci-fi Space-Ludo with Daleks!

The game involves moving card Dr Who figures around a circular playing area aiming to get to the "control center" whilst avoiding the Daleks. The Daleks themselves are faithful plastic renditions about three quarters of an inch tall, inserted into concentric slots cut into the board. When the pale blue "control centre" hub in the middle of the board is rotated, the card disc underpinning these concentric slots also rotate, causing the Daleks to move around the board and "capture" hapless players.

If a player makes it to the central hub, they have a chance to destroy the control centre by lifting it up. Doing so reveals four panels one of which depicts the "King Dalek." If he's next to you he exterminates you and you start again!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Love Jenga
description: On top of the rules for traditional Jenga, each time you draw a brick, you must read what's written on it and answer the question or do what you're told to. As the title let you guess, some of the questions are "love"-related.

name: Ein Mann. Ein Spiel.
description:
A man must do what a man must do.

That's the guiding principle of Ein Mann. Ein Spiel. ("One man. One game."), designed by Marcel-André Casasola Merkle and based on the book "Ein Mann. Ein Buch." ("One man. One book.") It's not enough for a man to know a few things about life, but he must also act well. At times he decides to make a difference, sometimes he must be steadfast and other times he must escape.

Each man has important choices to make in his life: Will I father a child? Or would I prefer to become Pope? Perhaps both? Or would I rather give myself over to a life of crime? Am I tough, am I wise, or am I practical? Will I re-invent myself during this game? With strategic skill, the players attempt to master life, achieve goals and develop their personality. At the end of the game, they are scored.

name: 1 2 3 Game
description: A great way to have fun learning numbers! Shuffle the large picture cards and give each player three of them. The rest of the puzzle pieces are laid out face up on the table. Notice the three symbols on the die: one for numbers, one for fingers, and one for die dots. Roll the die and look for the match to one of your picture cards. If you have the picture card with seven frogs, and roll the symbol for numbers, that means you need to find the number card with the "7" on it. Once you find it, match it up with your frog card. You’ll know if you’re right because this game is self-correcting; only the right pieces fit with the right numbers. The first player to match up all of his picture cards wins the game. What Do you Learn? Number recognition of numbers 1 - 10 and the different ways numbers can be represented.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: UNO: Batman Begins
description:
Based on the 2005 Batman Begins movie.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: the special Justice Card.

"When a Justice card is played, the player who plays it may deal out 'justice' to the other players in the form of his/her cards. Starting in the current direction of play, the player dealing 'justice' gives one card to each of the remianing players until he/she is down to one card. Upon dealing the next to last card the player of the Justice card must call 'UNO' or be subjected to the two-card penalty. This card also functions as a regular Wild card allowing the player who plays it to call out a new colour when he/she finishes dealing out his/her cards."
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Brain Drain
description:
The game that gobble your Brain.

300 Brain Teasing Questions

Solve a riddle on a card. For example "Three scary dogs, one girl running. How many legs?" As soon as a question is answered correctly the player flicks a lever and starts asking the other player/team questions. All the time a Frankenstein monster moves down the players track - the lever switches to another monster for the other team. When the monster reaches the end of the track, its brain is sucked out and the team loses.

name: Marvel Super Dice
description:
"The world is filled with guys in tights with some power that they think makes 'em better than the average Joe. And every joker in a union suit is lookin' to slug it out to prove they're king 'o the heap. So, whenever two sets of supers meet, they're bound to throw down. Bring 'em on!"

Each boxed set includes 18 random dice (3 rare, 6 uncommon, and 9 common), plus full-color cards representing street sections, cut-out counters, and a rulebook. The rare and uncommon dice are the superpowered heroes and villains; the common dice are various civilians, minions, and military. Each die features symbols representing the powers and strength of each character's specific attacks and abilities. Although expandable, the X-Men Battle for New York City! box set was the only product released.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice

name: Legenda: czas bohaterów
description:
[English translation of the title: The Legend: Time of Heroes]
Ages ago, when lost forgotten countries were full of life, and terrifying monsters walked the earth you were born. Raised among stories you grew a desire to see the world. The time was named Time of Heroes, and let your journey be remembered as The Legend.

"LEGENDA: czas bohaterów" is an adventure boardgame set in a fantasy world. The game is played on a board made of 4 pieces that you can join in multiple ways. The players take the roles of the heroes journeying through the land of Ar'Andia in search of adventure, treasures and fame. The goal is for a player to reach a title of mightiest hero in one of 6 areas: strength, dexterity, courage, magic, knowledge or luck.

name: Stratego Dice Game
description: Stratego Dice Game is a two-player dice game, with each player having five dice, one red and the other blue. Each die is different, and on each turn each player tries to choose the right die; they then roll off to see who wins and who loses (or whether the battle is a draw). The used dice are placed on the side, then players start a new turn. Whoever first wins five battles wins the game!

name: Dinomite
description:
From the publisher:

The Dinosaur Adventure Game! Dinomite is the first dinosaur board game to mix the reality of prehistoric dinosaurs with a fantasy of amazing adventures. Young dinosaur lovers race from the Stego-Start-Us, past hidden caves, woolly mammoths, and ferocious carnivores, and on their way to the Dino-Refuge. Invented by a 9 year-old. Includes a Dino-Directory and dinosaur playing pieces. Parents Choice Awards Honor.

name: Combo
description:
Combo is a game in which Bingo-like cards (on which 5x5 grids are printed) are used and instead of calling out randomly drawn numbers, dice are used.

Each player is given a Combo card and during a player's turn, he or she rolls a red die and 3 white dice. If the red die's result matches one of those on his or her card, the player then matches and places their white dice to the printed faces in the column below. A player may also "steal" and use a white die that another player cannot use (because that player's red die column does not have that white die's face). The next player in turn then picks up and rolls the red die and 3 white dice to do the same. When a player has filled up an entire row, column or diagonal (the center space is considered already to be filled), he has scored a Combo (the amount of points received depends on whether it is a 4-die or 5-die row, column, or diagonal) and ends a round. The next round begins with new cards for everyone.

After completing a pre-determined number of rounds, the player with the highest accumulated score is the winner.

name: Carrott's Canny Captions
description: Jasper Carrott is a popular Brummy comedian who has fronted TV shows using funny TV ads. His photos front this lame game in which players write "funny" captions to "whacky" photos from the vaults of some photo agency library. Guess who wrote which caption and score points. 200 photos and a huge waste. Oh look, a dog on a lawnmower. Call an ambulance, my sides have split with "much hilarity".
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: BattleBots: Build' Em Bash 'Em
description:
Based on the TV series with the fighting robots, this is a two-stage game. You start with a chassis that also includes a basic weapon.

In the first part of the game, you bid on robot bodies, armor, and upgraded weapons. Each player has a hand of cards that are numbered from 0 to 3, plus a "Battle" card. To get a body, you play a "war"-like card game, blindly drawing one of your cards. The player with the highest card gets to choose from the four bodies available. The loser chooses from what is remaining. Next, the players bid for accessories, the armor and weapons. The loser of the body choice gets to choose the first accessory up for bid. Each robot has a specific set of armor that will fit it. If you lose the bid on it, you are at a severe disadvantage. However, your opponent will have had to use up bid cards and thus will have less for later auctions. You also can prevent your opponent from completing his robot by playing your "Battle" card in an auction. This gives the item up for bid to your opponent, but ends all bidding for accessories and sends you to the next stage of the game.

Once you have a robot and accessories for it, it is time to battle in the arena. You build your robot on a plastic arm that has a wheel control and trigger on the other side. Robots face off on any flat surface. Battles have a Rock 'Em Sock 'Em Robots robots feel, as the goal is to maneuver your robot where it can knock off your opponent's armor and expose a release button. Hit the release button and the opponent's robot pops off and you win the round. the first player to win four rounds wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Defender
description:
Object:
to win the most points by using your Defender ships to protect humanoids from waves of aliens.

A set of chance cards will bring the different aliens (bombers, landers and humanoids) into play.
Movement is determined with a spinner.
Players can move their defenders and aliens.

From MNG-AJM Games Catalog: Board game based on the 1980's arcade game of the same name. Both players control Defender ships which have to protect Earth from alien landers which seek to abduct humans and turn them into mutants which return to attack the Defenders. A spinner is used each turn to decide what type of move you must make, but in each case you can make use of the move to benefit yourself or hinder your opponent. Interestingly the game ends only when one player has lost all 6 of his Defenders, and the player with most points wins, which may not be the player who still has Defenders left.

name: Bird in the Hand
description:
Objective:
