To be the first player to bring 3 birds of any color home to your nest.

The man acts as moving counter. The birds are pieces to collect.

Player pieces will travel along the path. If the man pieces lands on a bird space you can pick one and put it on the perch (that is the first step to go into the nest). You can pick from the bush, or challenge another player, in order to steal one. When challenging you will need to guess in what hand the other player is hiding his/hers. If you are right you keep it, if not you loose the chance of getting a bird that time. This allows for great interaction between players. Here a bird in the bush (certain) worth more that one in the hand (uncertain)!

On certain fields, one can put the birds from the houses into the nests. When a player has three birds in his/her nest, he or she is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Dr. Livingstone, I Presume? African Adventure!
description: The object of the game is to find Dr. Livingstone's whereabouts, return to start, and announce his location. Along the way you get clues of whether Dr. Livingstone or an explorer has been in the area lately. The first person to deduce his location is the winner
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ink Blotz
description: Members of one team anonymously reveal their category descriptions of one inkblot, while the other team tries to match the descriptions with the individuals who made them. The team with the most correct matches at the end of the game is the winner. Or, for games of 2-5 players, each participant puts his mind’s eye to work searching out as many images as possible from a single inkblot.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Dinosaurs Gotta Love Me! Game
description: Take a trip back in time as you roam around the Sinclair's fabulous 3-D kitchen. Baby's hungry and that temperamental refrigerator has got his food. Every member of America's favorite fossil family is racing to feed him: Earl, Fran, Charlene and Robbie. Collect creatures to stash in the refrigerator. Then try to get baby food or bottles back out. But watch out for Grandma Ethyl because she'll send you back to start. Feed the baby his food or bottle and try to make him smile. If you do, you win.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Crown Red
description:
Crown Red is played on an eleven by eleven board. Each space is either a white or black circle. The goal is to be the first player to move their crowned king onto the red home space opposite from where it started.

Each player starts with one uncrowned king and two pawns. On each turn a player moves one piece 5 spaces in order that the gravity selector shows.

The gravity selector contains ten black or white marbles in a clear column with a red base. At the beginning of a turn the player inverts the gravity selector and then returns it to its upright position. For example, the selector shows WBBWB. A piece must be moved first to a white circle. Next to a black circle and so on. A piece can be moved forward, backward or sideways.

Before a king can moved home, he must possess a red crown (small red marble). A king earns a crown when the player captures an opponents piece. Kings can be captured which results in the king losing its crown and returns to its start position.

name: Maya Code
description:
Conquer the sun platform with wits and logic and occupy it with the code of your own tribal colors. Those eliminated are dropped into the pyramid chamber. The winner obtains the eternal Maya gold. Discover new and fascinating strategies with every round. (from the back of the box...)

Guess the game is described best as "connect four with different colors" (if I played it right as the rules are within the top ten of worst written rules...).

Players select their own "code" (pattern) consisting of one gold piece in the middle and two other colors. On their turn they either place a new piece from the reserve or move one of their pieces already on the board. When completing a pattern you've got the option of either taking a gold piece back to your reserve or to drop one of the opponents pieces into the pyramid. Winner is the the last player to be able to build patterns.

MAYA CODE game instructions for 2 players

Components
1 Earth platform with cardinal points
2 Game stone reserve
3 MAYA CODE bank for the 3 stones that form the pattern code: 1 gold stone
(A) in the middle and 2 different tribal stones on the left (B) and on the right (C)
4 Sun platform (removable play area!)
5 pyramid chamber for the vanquished(countersunk hole)

Necessary game pieces
8 gold pieces, each 7 pieces of tribal color in 4 types

MAYA CODE
A code (3) is formed from 3 pieces. 2 different own tribal colors (B, C) and in the middle 1 gold stone (A)

Objectives of the game: Dominate the sun platform by creating codes and conquer Maya gold
Each player tries to place as many tribal color codes as possible on the upper sun platform (3rd floor) Stones like the pattern, in a line, always gold in the middle, in every direction, e.g. also diagonally).
For each successful code you can take back one gold stone from the sun platform or take 1 stone away from the opponent and sink it; until it can no longer make any codes.
In the end, win all of the Maya gold on the solar platform.

Before the start of the game: Sunrise in the east
The player with the east side E may begin and chooses 2 tribal colors.
Each player puts his pattern code on the code bank with 2 different tribal colors and 1 middle gold stone. The reserve of game pieces is provided on the front and side of the earth platform (3 gold pieces and 6 each of the two tribal colors). The stones of the pattern code remain inserted and must not be used for playing!

Opening: The Mayan gold that is played belongs to both immediately
Alternately, 1 stone of your choice is placed in any place on the solar platform per turn in order to try to create your own codes or to prevent opposing codes.
Your own stones and all gold stones that have already been placed may be moved in steps.
Everyone can play with all gold stones on the sun platform: The gold stones can be used by both parties! Main battle: sink the defeated into the pyramid chamber!
Anyone who has completed their own code can and must(!) Remove any opposing or gold stone in the same turn:
Captured opposing stones are sunk.
Gold stones are taken into your own reserve.
Gold that has just been played may not be taken away in the same turn. Codes that are not self-made or those of others do not entitle you to remove a stone. If 2 or more of your own codes are created at the same time, 2 or more stones can also be removed.

Endgame: The winner receives all of the Maya gold!
- Whoever has no more stones of one tribal color is defeated. All gold on the solar platform 1s credited to the winner (1 gold stone = 1 point).

name: Spaß im Auto
description: Too often parents hear the nerve-wracking question, `Are we there yet? How much longer?' This small box contains ideas for 20 games to be played by kids and families in a moving automobile. The games are intended for entertaining play rather than winning.

In 007, players use the letters from the word BOND to select rows on a tile-filled board. This drives their choices in attempting to capture their opponents tiles or minimize the impact of their rival's captures. Chips are used to keep score during the capturing process.

Players play in teams of two, Black vs Red. During each round, all players place 1 of 4 letter tiles (B-O-N-D) upside down on a matching letter diamond on the board - black team on black letter , red team on red. Players turn the letter tiles over at the same time. Players follow the line from the letters place to the game board. Where the lines intersect, the scoring player picks up any tile of the opposing teams color. PLay continues till the board has been emptied. Scores are tallied and the highest score wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Scooby-Doo! Trivia Game
description:
Sure you may know that Scooby-Doo's best friend is Shaggy, that he's a Great Dane and that the tag on his collar is diamond-shaped. But there's A LOT more to know about this lovable dog and his crime-solving friends and Scooby-Doo Trivia Game has it all!

Packed in a unique tin, this trivia game features hundreds of entertaining questions in categories like: Villains and Monsters, Behind-the-Scenes, Places, Grab Bag, and more!

There's even a deck of cards written especially for younger players- with full color pictures.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Trivia

name: Pocket Geni: Familj
description:
This is a Swedish trivia game, in a travel edition.

Players roll a die to determine what category of question to answer. If they answer it correctly, they get to mark one such symbol on a score sheet. The goal is to score a complete line across the score sheet. There is also a twelve-sided die with "GENI" on some of the faces. If a player rolls that and gets "GENI", he gets to choose what category question to answer. If he gets a blank face, he doesn't get any question at all this turn.

This version has two different question decks: one for children and one for adults.

name: Reality
description:
Reality - "Sveriges farligaste spel" (the most dangerous game in Sweden) is a game featuring the all day life of a couple of petty criminals and junkies (the players' characters).

From the rulebook (translation):
"Reality is really easy to play. Basically, all you have to do is keep walk around and around, much like the inmates of the mental institution in the movie "Midnight Express"..."

To win the game you should raise enough cash to buy a one way ticket to India or simply kill the rest of the players. The most obvious way to make money in the game is by dealing drugs and making burglaries, but there are also legal and less violent ways... but they are quite few... It is also possible for the players' characters to start doing drugs themselves, which in the game mostly has positive effects (doing speed allows you to roll two dice for movement instead of one, for example). Not surprisingly, the game has received a lot of criticism for glorifying drug abuse. So... avoid the police, getting shot, getting AIDS and becoming a heroin-addict and you might just make it to India!
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Euroversal
description:
Trivia game with 2000 questions on Europe.

How much do you know about the history, culture and traditions of the 15 EU Countries,

Basically a European version of Trivial Puruit

The Winner is the first person to answer 15 of the game's 2,025 Questions.

Use your right to freedom of movement and start at a point of your choice in an EU country of your choice.. Visit the 15 countries in the game in any order you like. All Yellow, Blue & Orange points on the game board generate questions. If you answer a question correctly, you win a star of the same colour. Collect one star in each country. A player with 5 Yellow + 5 Blue + 5 Orange stars is the winner! The EU die has been cast

name: Hairy Maclary Game
description:
A children's game based on the characters from New Zealand author Lynley Dodds' award-winning Hairy Maclary series of children's books.

Hairy Maclary from Donaldson's Dairy and his friends Hercules Morse, Bottomley Potts and Muffin McLay, are out for a walk, and must return to Donaldson's Dairy without getting caught by Scarface Claw, the toughest Tom in town.

Object of the game - The winner is the first dog to complete its walk from its starting position on the board - around the playground, the zoo, the beach and the park to reach Donaldson's Dairy, avoiding Scarface Claw.

name: Renaissance Go Fish for Art
description:
(from the web site)

Go Fish for Great Art!

Learn about great art as you play "Go Fish" and "Concentration" card games. Use strategy and memory to collect all the works of art by each artist. You don't need to know about art to win the game and you learn a lot as you play.

All 3 Go Fish for Art games are winners of a Parents' Choice Gold Medal.

Renaissance Go Fish for Art:

A deck of 30 museum-quality playing cards and a guide to the artists. Ages 7 to adult.

name: Box Hex
description:
Box Hex is a Hex variant which is played on a three dimensional surface. The shortest paths of connection travel around the outside of the board - not through the center. There are four such paths: two for each player. This solves the strong first move advantage problem of regular Hex, in which there is only one shortest connection path, said path being shared by both players. There is no need for the pie rule in Box Hex.

In Box Hex, as in regular Hex, one connection must exist in a filled board, and opposing connections cannot exist simultaneously.

name: Sammakot satimessa
description: Sammakot satimessa is Finnish for something like "Frogs in the Trap." The idea of this game is to get four frogs that share a trait on the same line (orthogonally or diagonally) to score a point. It's a bit like Tic-tac-toe on a 4x4-grid. There's a possibility for double points if your frogs share two traits. It's also possible that more than one winning line is formed at same time. 5 points to win game.

name: Olympiad, the Game of Champions
description:
Taken from the box:

OLYMPIAD - The Game of Champions -
Will take you to the biggest and greatest sport spectacular in the world!!

As you strive to be the fastest, highest, or strongest, your one aim is to become Champion of five OLYMPISPORTS - Champion of the Games.

Take the exciting challenge for MEDALS with a simple roll of the dice or with questions to test your knowledge. You will compete the all-time greats of the modern era, in your favorite sporting events.

Collect vital points for each of your achievements on the track or in the field, with PARALYMPISPORTS or in the final sprint of the games. The Champion will not be known until the final sprint is won!!

name: Wiggle & Giggle
description:
Wiggle & Giggle is the ball balancing physical game of fun, a challenging game of physical movement and balance.

Players try to earn the most points by balancing the foam balls and performing the tasks shown on the spinner. For example: Hold a ball between your knees - jump 3 times. While still holding this ball, balance another ball on your shoulder (you can use your chin to hold it in place). Now, bend over, place your hands on the ground and leap like a frog! Once a challenge has been successfully completed, a point card is earned, and it's the next player's turn to try a hilarious task.

For ages 4 and up.

name: Scribe
description:
Scribe is a pen and paper game for two players. The board, a 9x9 super grid of 3x3 mini grids, is simple enough to be drawn by hand. There are two major components of play: a mapping mechanism and a system of glyphs, or patterns of orthogonally adjacent squares. The mapping mechanism works as follows. Your last move points to the mini grid in which your next move must be made. For example, if your last move was in the upper left corner of a mini grid, then your next move must be made somewhere in the upper left mini grid. The glyph system works as follows. There are 19 named glyphs of various sizes from 1 to 9 orthogonally adjacent squares. Glyphs that you form during play are worth points. The majority of points scored in a mini grid wins the mini grid. The winner of the majority of mini grids wins the game.

For the complete rules to Scribe, see http://marksteeregames.com/

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: Rettet den Regenwald
description:
An educational game about the protection of the rain forest. 4 bulldozers are placed at the outer border of the board. The players get a certain amount of rain forest cards in their hands.
A player plays a card and draws a new rain forest card. Aim of the game is to plant 25 trees onto the clearing as fast as possible. If you play a foster card, you can plant a tree and draw a new card. Another possibility to plant a tree is to collect three cards of a type (animal or plant) in a row.
Every time you plant a tree you get a certificate. The third possible card is a question card, which can be asked to any player. If he has a sin card in his hand, the questioner gets a certificate, otherwise the questioner has to give one certificate to the other player. The player can also lie about having a sin card. Then the player can ask for a vote of confidence and the player, who loses must pay two certificates.
Players then replenish their hands and have to fight off the bulldozers. A clearing card is being revealed and the players have to match the values on the card with the values on their disclaimer cards. If they win, the difference is payed out in form of trees and certificates. If they lose, the bulldozers move for every point of difference into the forest.
In the end the players win, if 25 trees are planted. The player with most certificates is the overall winner. If the bulldozers reach the last section of the board all players lose.

name: Padaxa
description: Form Triangles on a Hex-board and gain points every time you do.

name: The Raven
description:
This is the 6th "Bonsai Game" from daVinci, a complete games on a card (board on a side, rules on the other side), for two players.
It's a simple "hockey-style" game (played with two small coins). KOZAK Games Publishing shared this game as a gift for their customers in 2020 (COVID-19 Pandemic)
publishers: DV Games, Gaming Hoopla, KOZAK Games

name: Matoudematata
description:
A balancing game for children (3+ years). Players stack the cardboard animals into different kinds of towers trying to keep them from falling.

The game comes with 12 pieces: 1 aunt, 4 cats, and 7 smaller presents.

name: Marathon
description:
From the box:
12 gates are positioned on the board, in arbitrary sequence. Each player is issued 3 animals: one snake, one rhinoceros, and one elephant. Three of the gates are too low for any of the animals to pass under; three other gates can be passed only by the snake; another three gates are high enough to let the snake and the rhinoceros through, and three gates are high enough to allow all the animals to pass.

Players take turns rolling the dice, changing the position of the gates and advancing their animals towards the finish line.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: MaravilloZoo
description:
Canal 13 (Channel 13) and Ludik Toys have together developed a fantastic game based completely on the popular MaravilloZoo program.
The wonderful thing about this game is that, as in the TV show, you can learn a lot of interesting things about the animal kingdom.

CONCEPT OF THE GAME: Each participant must compete showing his knowledge about the Animal Kingdom. For it, they will have to:

answer questions or
fulfill the challenges proposed in the game:
draw an animal
make charades of an animal
explain an animal
mention animals that fulfill certain characteristics
discover an animal playing the "hanged person"
etc.



A game for the whole family
categories: Animals, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Team-Based Game

name: Bosconian-D
description:
Bosconian-D is a print-and-play solo dice wargame based on the old Namco arcade game of the same name.

In up to 36 sectors of space destroy your enemy's bases, or encounter various enemies. Destroy them or they will damage your ship.

Can you eliminate all enemy bases before your ship is sustains 100 points of damage?

All you need are the rules, dice and a pencil. Counters for your ship and the enemy bases, a simple grid board, and an encounter die is provided.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Events, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: People Game
description:
Despite its English name People Game is a German Word Game for at least 2 players or teams.

The cards show each uncommon or unusual German words with their explanation or definition. A sand timer of about 3 mins running time allows the players to do the following:
They read one term and the definition and are allowed to write two definitions of their own. When the time is up then they offer between 3 and 5 points to their adversaries. They read those 3 definitions and have to guess which one is correct.
If they get it right it's them who advance on the track otherwise it's the active players.
This continues until one team reaches the end of the track.

The game consists of the board, 420 cards, 8 standard pawns, 1 pad, 4 pencils, the sand timer and of course the rules.

name: Martian 12s
description:
The game of choice in Casinos all over Mars!

Martian 12s is a press-your-luck Icehouse game, similar in feel to Blackjack as played on Earth.
It requires 2 matching Treehouse sets (2HOUSE).

Rules are available on the Icehouse Games Wiki

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

name: Tango
description: Tango was published in Jeux sur un Plateau magazine, issue number 37. In this game, there are four male and four female dancers. Each player is secretly rooting for a particular male and female couple to encounter one another four times on the dance floor. In turn, the players move the dancers one to three spaces - females clockwise, males counterclockwise - subtly trying to get their own couple to meet enough times to win.

name: Gaga!
description:
The game consists of three sets of twelve cards: 3 to 9 and some special cards. Each player receives one set of cards

Gaga is a card trick game. The players play their card simultaneously and blind. The highest card gets the trick; if there is a two-way tie, the remaining player gets the trick. If there is a three-way tie, the winner of the next trick gets this trick as well. The special cards have other ways to win (or loose) a trick.

When one of the players has run out of cards, each player counts his points. Some cards show chickens, and are worth points; others show animal droppings, and lower your point total.

The player who has gained the most points after three rounds wins the game.

name: Traffic Patterns
description:
A 2-4 player game of changing lanes, high-speed turns, and flipping people off.

Game Summary:
Players move their car from row 1 to row 15, avoiding traffic and influencing other cars to get in the way of their opponents.

Components:
A bunch of toy cars (ten or more works well), of roughly the same size.
A six sided die for each player.
One sheet of scrap paper for each player.

Everything needed to play is available in the BGG files section, or at:
Games by Jeremiah

name: The Real Ghostbusters: The Game
description:
A basic Childrens board game based on the Real Ghostbusters cartoon TV series. The main aim is to move your character around the board, trapping "ghosts" along the way until finally trapping the boss character, "Mr Stay Puft".

Characters start in the middle of the board with players getting three cards each, a "ghostbusting kit" consisting of "trap", "proton gun" and "proton pack" cards.

Play is controlled in a clockwise manner by a spinner containing player moves, player & ghost moves, player move + take action card, or player move + "spook". Players can move along board street squares, through "subways" or in to "buildings", and can also move ghosts in the same way if given the option.

Action cards give either further movement options or the ability to trap a ghost outside a building.

Players can "spook" a separate opponent on landing on a square containing, or spinning, a spook option. This is a basic paper-scissor-stone option and the winner takes one of the loser's "ghostbusting kit" cards. Without all three a player cannon trap a ghost.

Upon moving inside a "building" with a ghost present (or landing on a ghost outside a building if owning the correct action card) you can trap it by using the spinner to select a "powerstream strength" number. If the number is higher than the ghost's "slime value" you trap it, otherwise you move out of building and play continues.

After the last ghost is trapped, players must move towards the middle of the board to trap "Mr Stay Puft" in the same way as regular ghosts.

The winner is the person with the highest total "slime value" calculated from all ghosts they have trapped.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
publishers: Falomir Juegos, Paradigm Games Ltd, Triotoys

name: Ancient Combat
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

Players represent armies of ancient warriors, each seeking to decimate the opposition. Players combat through tactical placement and die rolls. The winner is the player with the stronger fighting force after 20 rounds.

name: Monopoly: Oberhausen
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Oberhausen, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Waterloo Campaign
description:
Napoleon returned to power from Elba to find the Great Powers of Europe united against him. Realizing that he was massively outnumbered, he decided his best chance was to attack first and try to take out some of his adversaries before they could combine and descend on France. He chose to move against the English and the Prussians in Belgium. Furthermore, he thought that he could achieve a political victory if he could capture Brussels. The Waterloo Campaign is a small-scale, fast-play game that simulates the historical events of June, 1815 which ended the career of Napoleon Bonaparte. The goal of the game is to recreate the problems faced by Napoleon at the operational level and perhaps achieve a better result than arguably the greatest general in history.

Game Features

* Small Scale, Quick Play Microgame
* Only 28 Unit Counters
* Colorful Game Map 8 1/2 x 11
* Operational Level Play
* Four-Page Rules Booklet
* Game Play Sheet
* Counter Sheet To Cut Out
* Solitaire Play Level: HIGH

(from site)
Full Game: http://www.whitedoggames.com/pnpgames.html

name: Cranium Cloodle
description:
A fast paced cooperative play game where you have to figure out the clue that fits in the category. Work together as a team to draw and guess all the answers before time runs out.

Categories include: food, character, place, person, thing, band, action, and more!

Easy to modify if there are large amounts of players or the players are quick to guess the answers: just pull out more cards and continue until timer is up.

name: Thundercats
description:
A card game inspired by the animated television series of the same name.

One player uses the Thunder Cat deck and the other player uses the Evil Mutant deck. Opposing Character cards battle it out each hand, supported by Weapon, Companion, and Vehicle Cards. The player whose cards have the highest total Force value wins the hand.

The first player to win five hands wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Herr der Diebe
description:
The players represent members of a children gang (Prosper, Bo, Scipio and Wespe). They travel through Venice, trying to shake off the detective Victor, and to collect a big part of the treasure. The game ends after 10 rounds, when the players have used up their set of travel cards. The player who finished most laps (and thus was able to collect most money from the "star lair" hideout) wins the game.

A course is created by location cards. Each player in turn selects and (secretly) plays one of his set of target cards, with the intention to move to the next free location shown on it. But before he shows the card and makes his move, another player (who plays the role of the detective in this turn) swaps two location cards; he guesses where the player wants to move to, and tries to reduce his progress.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Défifoo Jaune
description:
The aim of the game is to be the first to get ride of all your cards.
Each player must place a higher card than the card already played. If he can't he has to pick a card from the draw pile.
Yellow cards are stronger than green cards and red cards are stronger then yellow cards
Red >> Yellow >> Green
There are three symbols:
Rock >>(breaks)>> Scissor >>(cut)>> Paper >>(wrap)>> Rock
There are also jokers cards (three colors), Skull-and-crossbones cards that can never be played, for a chance to win you must get ride of it.
There are also event cards.

name: UNO: The Dark Knight
description:
Based on the 2008 film "The Dark Knight."

Includes the exclusive The Joker's wild card, which forces an opponent to draw cards until they draw a card of the color of your choice.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Partini Mixers: Quick & Quirky
description:
Partini Mixers - Quick & Quirky is a great ice breaking party game for 4 or more adult players. Pass out the coasters and play the three fun games at random. In Pencil Head, you'll have to do your best to draw a recognizable object on your head. In Knowing Me, Knowing You you'll discover how your friends feel and how much they really know about you. In Hung Jury, decide who's most likely to be found in all kinds of hilarious situations. Break the ice at you next get together with Partini Mixers - Quick & Quirky!

Partini Mixers - Quick & Quirky can be played by itself or mixed in with your Partini game (sold separately)

name: Monopoly: My Fantasy Football Players Edition
description:
Enjoy the Fantasy of controlling the NFL’s top athletes!

It’s Fantasy Football, Monopoly style. The world’s best selling board game and the NFL’s top athletes team up to put you in charge. For the first time ever YOU decide the layout of the MONOPOLY game board. With over 100 players to choose from, like LaDainian Tomlinson, Brian Urlacher and Ben Roethlisberger, there are over ONE TRILLION possible player lineups! Removable and reusable player labels mean you can play a different game each and every time. Who gets Boardwalk? Which athlete will you put on Park Place? It’s decision time and you get to choose!

Create it...Play it...Own it all..Your way! Play ball!

Game includes six custom tokens: football, helmet, whistle, lineman, quarterback & cheerleader.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Smart 7 Children Against Adults
description: Smart7 is a set of entertaining and handy sized trivia games for the whole family. Each game contains 700 questions and answers, which are based on fun and exciting themes. The idea of these games is to collect 7 chips by answering correctly to 7 questions. The more you know, the faster you will be on your way to winning!

name: Transformers Animated Board Game
description: Welcome to Detroit, Autobots! Your mission is to protect Earth from the evil Decepticons and other enemies. Travel through the city in search of enemies to defeat. Try to be the first Autobot to reach Sumdac's Tower and battle Megatron and you're the winner!
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pekin Express
description:
Based in a popular spanish TV program by Cuatro, comes Pekin Express, the boardgame.

Players can choose between two diferents rutes: Moscow-Beijing (2008´edition) or Beijing-Bombay (2009´ édition)

As the real adventurers, each player tries to get over diferent trials and get the final goal to win the game


Después del éxito cosechado en televisión, llega el juego de mesa Pekin Express-

Los jugadores podrán escoger entre dos rutas: Moscú-Pekín (de la edición de 2008) o Pekín-Bombay (la ruta de esta temporada)

Como los aventureros en la realidad, los jugadores deberán superar diferentes pruebas para alcanzar la meta final

name: Wyspa
description:
The goal of the game titled "Wyspa" (The Island) is to earn a million dollars. Players acquire raw materials, build houses, hotels and farms. The factories produce products that are later sold in the markets. Trade, negotiate, exchange - these are the basic rules and ways to win.

The game contains the following components:

- the board
- 125 plastic resources
- a set of company flags for each player
- 48 building tokens
- the deck of 33 event cards
- 1 round marker
- banknotes
- the rulebook

name: Switch It!
description: An abstract counter placement game where the objective is to be first to have 4 counters in a row (or 5 or 6 depending on the difficulty level chosen). The board is a 6x6 grid which is made up of nine 2x2 squares. Instead of placing a new counter, a player may lift a square and rotate it 90 degrees, moving the counters on that square into new positions.

name: Wobbly Chef Junior
description:
This is a dexterity game where players have to try and balance food items on the two trays held by a waiter. What makes this a game is that the waiter's feet are not flat, they're rounded, so any addtion to the trays causes the whole mass to move about.

The loser is the person who causes the food to fall off the trays.

name: Weird Tales
description:
Will you be the first to finish in Weird Tales? It's a race to the end (card) as players pit their story skills against each other to emerge as the victorious storyteller!

Weird Tales is a storytelling game where players help to complete a story using cards in their hand. Every card will earn you points; the one with the most points at the end of the game is the winner!

Weird Tales is a storytelling card game for 3-6 players, aged 10 years and up. Earn turn, a player uses one of the five cards in his hand to contribute to the story being told. Players are awarded points based on the cards used each turn; points are tabulated at the end of the game. The winner is one with the most points!
publishers: I Heart Board Games!, Red Tin Bot

name: Turtle Soup
description:
A press-your-luck game of fraught cuisine for the Decktet.

Flip a card face up and then flip another. Continue until there are cards showing four or more of the six Decktet suits.

Active players simultaneously indicate whether they intend to take a bowl now or wait for more ingredients.

If the additional card makes it so that the face up cards include at least one instance of each of the six Decktet suits, then the soup has gone Turtle Butt. The soup night is over. Return any chips in the pot to the bank. Players who didn't take a bowl get nothing for that night.

The game should be played for at least five soup nights. Obviously, you can make the game longer by playing more nights. In the end, each small chip collected is worth 1 point and each large chip is worth 5. The player with the most points wins.

name: Var är katten?: Mitt första spel
description:
From the publisher:
Look for the cats among the many discs as you learn colors! A new game in the popular "My first game series." 30 tiles representing either cats or mice, and back have different colors. Spread the tiles face down. Turn the large color dice made ​​of wood and pick up a tray of corresponding color. Is it a cat? Keep the tray! Is it a mouse? Turn up the washer, but let it remain. When only mice are still on the table is the one with the most cats won.

name: The Smurfs: No Smurf Left Behind
description:
The Smurfs are trapped in the heart of New York City's Central Park, and the only way back home is through a magic portal that only opens once in a Blue Moon. However, the Smurfs' nemesis, Gargamel, has also found his way to Central Park and has captured Papa Smurf! Now it's up to the rest of the Smurfs to free Papa Smurf from Gargamel's lair and find their way home before Gargamel finds the spells he needs to close the portal forever!

Will the Smurfs make it back home, or will Gargamel succeed and trap the Smurfs? Play as the Smurfs or Gargamel and find out!

Smurfs moves on the board playing the cards. Gargamel moves up to 3 spaces and if he lands to space with Smurfs he bounces them back to start.
If all Smurfs escape through the portal before Gargamel finishes his spell they win!
Gargamel reveal cards and if he has 3 spell cards the Smurfs have only one more turn of they lose.

Contents:

6 game figures
Game map
25 cards
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Piastowie Narodziny Orła
description:
Try your hand as a Prince of the Slavic tribes. Prudent management of network resources to build economic power. Show your strength and courage and obedience among the warriors gain and advantage on the battlefield. Prove that you deserve to be called the first Polish ruler!

It is a breakthrough ninth and tenth centuries. The three ambitious princes at the head of the three great tribes are preparing to fight for the lands of Wielkopolska and Kujawy. Polanie, led by Siemowit extend their rule, the submission of its subsequent settlement and erected at strategic locations mighty castles. Goplanie tribe inhabiting Kujawy, led by cruel Popiel, are preparing to invade the lands lying to the left Noteć river. Lords of the Glapian tribe in Kaliska region push to the north, trying to grab the fertile lands of central Wielkopolska. The eyes of all the princes look at Gniezno, where is Lech Hill most important center of Slav worship. The prince, who will conquer Gniezno, will gain great authority among the Slav population, which may force the rulers of other tribes to submit to his authority. However, the princes plans can be thwarted. There are rumors that at the mouth of Warta strengthen the invaders from the far north, the Vikings ...

Board game "The Birth Piast Eagle" is designed for 2-4 people. Playing time is approximately 2-4 hours, depending on the number of players. Their task is to get as much the prince's authority as possible. They can expand it by winning the general, a reasonable policy, Stewardship of goods and skillful manipulation of the priestly caste. Players may also lose the authority as a result of shameful defeats or show weakness in intertribal political arena.

"The Birth Piast Eagle" is a history-strategic game. Players moving tokens, indicating different types of early medieval armies. Players giving orders have to decide what action it will take in the next stage of their subjects. Depending on the order of the generated power player, these activities take on momentum or slow down. Events included in the pages of random events can absolutely interfere with the planned course of play, forcing players to complete the reform of the established strategy.

Game Design is the winner of a competition organized by the historiographer Polish History Museum and funded by the Ministry of Culture and National Heritage in the financing of educational and cultural activities by the "education +".

Characteristics of the tribes in the board game "Piast Eagle Rise"

Glapianie:
This is the Slavic tribe has its headquarters on the southern edge of the board of the central stronghold - Kalisz. Their unmistakable tramp over the years built a network of trade and diplomatic relations and strong economic fundamentals. Due to the high economic potential of their treasury fills up quickly. Some minor deficiencies in the disposal of the military are offset by the money, according to the rule: "War is not so much a question of weapons, what the money" - Thucydides.

Glade:
This starts the game Slavic people in the central part of the board - in Giecz. This site brings with it a blessing and a curse. Is extremely advantageous location close to major towns in the game, including Gniezno. While the downside is undisputed that the Glade are surrounded by "benevolent" neighbors from four sides. Polan's strengths is military power, whose core is the cavalry, as well as the ability to quickly build great castles.

Goplana:
This is the Slavic tribes settled in the vicinity of Lake Gopło headquartered in Kruszwica. Begin the game in the eastern part of the board. Their military potential - economic development is balanced, thus, are very formidable opponent. Have the ability to quickly mobilize resources, and a lot of defensive capabilities.

Vikings:
The tribe is led by visitors from far northern lands. They begin the game board in the north west - the Santoku. Have the greatest military potential, the most important role is played by an elite infantry Scandinavian. Neither the army nor the stockade could not stop them in the march of Gniezno. The problem may be difficulties in the supply and finance - "Money is the nerve of war," Cicero.

name: Roundup
description:
A filler type old-style card game where you draw 1, play 1 to claim steer cards. Whoever has the most steer cards when the deck (45 cards) is depleted and all cards are played out (from 3 card hands) wins. You can claim a steer card directly by playing a Bar X card, or claim someone's steer card / Bar X stack by playing a Rustler, or claim someone's steer card / Bar X / Rustler stack by playing a Deputy.

The rules say it's best played with 2, 3, or 4 players, but 5 or 6 may play if desired.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition Österreich Ausgabe
description:
Part of the Genus edition of the TRIVIAL PURSUIT series this time questions are about Austria.

The game contains questions in the six familiar categories: Geography, Entertainment, History, Art & Literature, Science & Nature, Sports & Leisure.

name: Card Hockey League
description:
Card Hockey League is an ice hockey simulation game played with a standard deck of 52 cards.

The two players take on the roles of team managers. The game is played over 3 rounds (periods). The players should ideally play facing each other and have access to a 6-card inverted pyramid game area.

Each game area consists of 3 rows. The row closest to the player represents the goalkeeper. A single card is placed in this row. The second row holds two cards, representing defenders. The third, and final row, holds three cards, representing the forwards on the team. All cards are placed face up in a portrait orientation except the goalkeeper which is placed face down in a landscape orientation.

The first player, determined in whatever fashion the players desire, shuffles the deck and secretly looks at the top card. He can choose to place this card in any open position in his own play area. Once placed, the card cannot be moved. Once all six spots are filled, the deck is passed to the opponent who fills his own six spots in like manner.

Players take turns advancing on their opponent. Each turn begins with the player flipping over the top card of the deck and comparing it to his opponent's line of forwards. If the card matches or beats another card in value, both cards are discarded and the player is considered having advanced past that hockey player. If multiple cards meet the criteria, the player chooses which route to take.

There is a strategic element when deciding which route to take when advancing on your opponent. With your first card, you compare against the three forwards. Once you have overcome a forward, your options for advancement may be limited. At no point are you allowed to skip another card in order to reach a more favorable card.

Let's say that you use your first card to overtake the center forward with your first card — you now have clear line of sight to both remaining forwards and the two defenders, but the goal is still blocked. If, on the other hand, you advanced past the left side forward, only the center forward and left defender are "open" to you.

Once the goal is "open", you are free to attempt to score at any point. You simply announce that you will shoot instead of taking on a hockey player. Your card is compared to the value of the goalkeeper. If your card is higher in value, you have scored a goal. Regardless, both cards are discarded as usual.

Whether a goal is successfully scored or not, it is now your opponents turn. Play also switches if you fail to successfully overtake enough players to clear an open path to your opponent's goal.

Your opponent will begin his turn by first filling any open spots as was done when the game began. He then takes his turn as normal.

Special Rule: When only one card is left in the deck, a player may, on his turn, assuming his team slots are filled, attempt a shot on goal regardless of whether an open path exists or not.

Once the deck is exhausted, the period is considered having ended. All cards are gathered up, play switches to the next player who shuffles and drafts his team as was done at the beginning of the game.

Once three periods have been played, the player with the most goals is declared the winner. There are no rules for breaking ties.

name: MaCar
description: Cars are an indispensable part of our lives, and the tiles in MaCar can be put together in any number of ways to build cars in new styles and dimensions.

name: Nostalgia
description:
Players are collectors during the Era of Taisho(1912-1926), collecting the seven kinds of the animal cards.

The cards are a cat, a dog, a snake, a fish, a tiger and a elephant. They are three types, rarity, normal and variety.
There are two rules variants.

One is the trick taking game.
Each player is dealt three cards as hand. At first of the round, the turn player deals one card to each player. The turn player starts to choose to change the revealed card to the handed card or to keep it.
The trick is started as a "must follow". If the player has the same type of the lead card included in the opened card on the front of the player, the player must play the card or keep the opened card. When the player play the card, the opened card is added to the player's hand.
The winner is the player(s) played the different card against the lead card. The player get one card from the opened cards.
The rare and variety card have the special effect when following.

Two is the bluff game.
The preparation and the object are same. And at first of each round, one card is dealt to all players. The turn player plays one card with face up. Other players play one card with face down. After that, the turn player can change the played card by himself/herself.
The winner is the player(s) don't have the card with face up by the turn player on his/her hand excluded in the played card.
The card handling is more technical.

name: The Simpsons: Don't be a Donut!
description:
Don't be a Donut is a quick and easy to play card game featuring the whole cast of Springfield. This fast paced card game is easy to learn and is almost impossible to put down!

To play, shuffle all the cards and deal 6 cards to each player. Place the remaining cards face down in a DRAW pile in the centre, than turn over the top card of the DRAW pile. The first player has to match that card either by number or colour i.e. if the card is a red "3" the player must thrown down a red card or any other colour "3". If a player cannot go they must keep taking the top play until they have a card they can play. Donut cards can be played at any time as long as the background colour matches the existing colour in play and Krusty cards are wild cards and can be played at any time to change the colour of play. The first player to play out all their cards and shout "Don't be a Donut" wins.

A more advanced play for older children involves scoring and several rounds are played. A game is won by the first player to score an agreed number of points (usually 150). This game is great entertainment for children and because it is presented in a small box makes a perfect travel game. Game includes 54 jumbo sized cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ty Beanie Boo's Friends Game
description: The plushies are lost on the game board and Peanut needs your help to find them. Different colors and shapes make your task exciting. Learning about colors, shapes and numbers is fun with cuddly Ty toys!

name: Midmoon: The City of Guilds
description:
Midmoon: The City of Guilds is an economic strategy game with the elements of RPG. The action takes place in Midmoon, city of the Dreamscape carnival universe. Players take part in settlement development that gradually evolves from small town to a big megapolis. Players take roles of businessmen planning to capture the authority in future city.

It's possible to play in a legal way by building a trade empire that leans on the powerful guards or to rule from the shadows by hiring thieves and killers. A skillful player can combine both ways.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Hipster: The Card Game
description:
The Hippest of the Hip

Strategy is the name of the game as you compete to be the coolest in town in the game of Hipster. Collect your gear and play against others in your quest to be hipper than everyone else. But watch out, because once things become too cool they’re no longer cool.

In Hipster you want to be cooler than everyone else, and you want to do it first. Each player gets five cards at the start of the game, and they're each trying to match up three cards in front of them with the three cards in the center. Those center cards are "What's Cool Right Now" and the only way to win is to be cool like those cards.

But watch out: if too many people get into those center cards, those "Cool" cards are no longer cool, and the central cards go away, replaced by the latest, hippest thing in town. What's cool is always changing, ever shifting, so if you want to be hip you gotta live on the edge, adapting quickly to win the game.

Hipster features are selection of cards, with three different "Cool" card suits -- Culture, Fashion, and Trinkets -- along with instant cards you can play on others, Play When You Want cards, and new rules you can introduce to change the rules of the gam, Damn the Man cards. To win the game, you have to be fast, you have to be quick, and above all, you have to be the coolest, hippest hipster around.

name: Mars (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Rund um die Uhr
description: Discover clock and time. What’s the cuckoo doing inside of the clock? Why are the days longer in summer? What’s a second? With that tiptoi game children learn easily how to read the clock. The tiptoi pen is used to explain topics on cardboards which show daily events of Anna and her family. The main element of the game is the big adjustable clock. Depending on the difficulty children choose the front or back side. Children have to set the clock on several times to show which family event happens at which time. The tiptoi pen always supports the players doing that.

name: Senkokurei
description:
Senkokurei is a game based on Japanese historic war era.

Players would play historic characters and fight against each other.

There are three teams.
1. East Legion
2. West Legion
3. Neutral: Samurai

How to play a game?
1. There is a map,
in the beginning, players would divide into different teams,
and set up their camps and start fighting against each other.

2. Each player would draw a character card and would has his unique abilities.

3. Players would control their hand cards and use abilities and weapons to attack or defend.

How to win a game?
There is a leader in East Legion and a leader in West Legion,
if East Legion work together and kill the leader in West Legion, then the East side wins, vice versa.

As for Neutral group, any samurai who hunts two heads down wins. (no matter east side or west side)

name: BAHOOCHIE!
description:
An eejits card game.

If you have played Top Trumps, then you'll know how to play BAHOOCHIE! It's a very similar game with a Scottish theme where players battle with eejits to try and win them all! But the game comes with a wee twist.....

The BAHOOCHIE! cards can change everything! How you win or lose a single round or even how you win or lose the entire game.

Players battle curious creatures to try and win them all. Usually the highest score on the card wins, but shout BAHOOCHIE! and you can change how the game is played, how a round is won. Watch out, though - BAHOOCHIE! cards can be a help or a hindrance - it's the chance you take.

All cards feature unique art & curious eejits. There are 29 CREATURE CARDS and 16 special BAHOOCHIE CARDS – Deep Fried Battered Food Product (of some description), Bagpipes of Dooooooom!, Sporrans and other weird Scottish stuff are included in each pack!

name: Kritzeln
description: Kritzeln is a drawing game of some sort, with players needing to connect every dot in the grid as they draw figures.

name: Stand Up Sit Down
description: Stand Up Sit Down is a trivia-based party game for elementary-level children, with questions ranging from fairy tales to geography, from biology to history. Each child takes turns being the leader and reading the current question card, which presents players with an A/B option, for example, "Stand up if you think the rice dish paella comes from Spain. Sit down if you think it comes from Greece." All children sit or stand at the same time, then whoever is incorrect is out of the round. This continues until only one child remains. This child collects a point token, and whoever has three point tokens first wins.

name: Dudab Buba
description:
Prehistoric people were fishing, hunting, and gathering during their wandering. It was important to carry as few things with them as possible in order to move easily. They couldn't speak, but Dudab was one among their primitive words meaning "sorry".

When it's your turn in Dudab Buba, you can choose one of the two possibilities: lay down a card or draw a card. Then the next player's turn in clockwise order starts. Players need to collect as few cards and as few victory points as possible. To do this, they have to be very tactical, and say "Dudab" with proper timing. The player who can lead everybody else by the nose and collect the fewest victory points wins.

The game is a reprint for the original Dudab and contains sixteen extra cards that comprise two expansions.

name: Candy Crush: The Boardgame
description:
The most fun and tasty game, now playable with up to 4 players! Gather all the different candies and hurry up to be the first to collect the cherry. Test your creativity and create a magical chain of candies to reach the cherry in the middle of the game board. But be aware of your opponents, because when 3 of the same candies connect, your plan will fall apart! Is luck on your side and are you tactical enough to win the candy crush board game?

Candy Crush the board game is a 2 to 4 players strategic board game. The game is played with 6 dice all containing 6 different colors of candies. Players roll all dice a maximum of three times in their turn and try to roll as many of the same colors. Depending on the dice result, players place a number of candy tokens on the board. These can be place either on their own board or that of their opponents. The first player to reach the cherry in the middle of the board by placing enough candy tokens wins the game. But remember that your candy tokens will disappear when an opponent places 3 of the same candies on your board.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Minute Challenge
description:
Have you got what it takes to complete five one-minute long challenges? Choose to take on a mentally difficult or physically demanding challenge, and beat the timer to win!

From star jumps and hopping to naming zoo animals and remembering shopping lists, this game is sure to get your mind thinking and heart pumping!

name: Mein Schulranzen-Memo
description:
School is going to begin soon, and it is time to pack your backpack! Who has a good memory and can best remember where the books, scissors, and sandwiches are? The first player in Mein Schulranzen-Memo to arrange a backpack using six tiles wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Melbourne Edition
description:
On 25 June 1847, Melbourne was declared a city by letters patent of Queen Victoria.

By 1865, Melbourne had become Australia's most populous city, at a time when consumer confidence was high, credit was easy to access and steep increases were seen in the price of land.

Today, Melbourne is one of the most vibrant and liveable cities in the world and this edition of Monopoly captures the magic of this unique city.

Begin your journey in one of the famous laneways and marvel at the street art at Hosier Lane, or grab a bite to eat at Hardware Lane. Browse the outlets at Queen Victoria Market and cheer on your favourite horse at the Melbourne Cup at Flemington Racecourse. Take a tour of Old Melbourne Gaol, or surf a wave at Bells Beach. Kick your Sherrin football around Etihad Stadium or watch a 20/20 match at the MCG.

All these iconic sites and more have been immortalised in this edition of Melbourne Monopoly and you have the chance to own them all!

So locate your favourite Melbourne hotspots and roll the dice to begin your property building empire in this new version of the classic Monopoly game!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dragons: Das grosse Drachenrennen
description:
Berk's Dragon Riders organize a big dragon flying contest: who has tamed and trained his dragon the best and will win the exciting race? Hiccup on Toothless? Astrid on Stormfly? Fishlegs on Meatlug? Or Snotlout on Hookfang?
With great skill and dice luck, you can bring your favorite to victory.
The goal of the game is to bring your own favorite to the finish first.
—description from the publisher

Place every dragon on start. Every player take a dragon card and hide it from the others. Ommly you know your favorite. Everybody take a dice.place the dice board in the bottom of the box. The players have to roll the dice into the box, one after another. The fields on the dice board are assigned to the 4 dragons. Move the dragons with the dice points ont fiels. If a dragon hits a black field, he has to go 3 fields back. The game ends, when a dragon reached the finish. Winner is the player with his dragon in front...
—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kleptokittens!
description: Kleptokittens! is a push your luck, memory game where players take turns flipping cards in a set time limit. For each pair they gain a treasure, if they find catnip they can swiftly boost their score. But watch out! If you turn up a spray bottle, your kitties stash is gone!

name: Buddy Cop
description:
Buddy Cop is a cooperative card game of blockbuster action for 1-2 players. Set in the same universe as Brook City, Buddy Cop sees players take on the role of heroic cops tasked with bringing down criminal operations in the middle of an intense shootout.

Each round, players are presented with 4 cards, which represent the actions available to a player on their turn. Each card offers 2 options: pay the cost and play the card for its action, or discard the card to gain the resources listed. Players must manage their actions and resources efficiently if they hope to remain in the fight long enough to find the criminal boss and make the arrest.

Buddy Cop offers unparalleled modularity with its different fixed card decks that can be mixed and matched to create custom scenarios. Players first choose a cop to embody, wielding their unique cop deck to make use of their signature skills and abilities. Then, they’ll choose an operation deck, detailing not only the locations where criminal activity is taking place, but also what exactly the criminals are up to and how they win. Lastly, they’ll select a criminal deck to go up against, containing both the criminal mastermind behind the caper, as well as the minions they’ll unleash against our officers.

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Swap
description:
Swap is played with four standard dice and 12 chips in each of four colors. Players start with one chip of each color and the rest are placed in a row of supplies.

At the start of each round the dice are rolled and assigned to the chip supplies - the color on the left gets the highest die, the next color gets the second-highest, etc. Then each player in turn may trade; they can turn in chips to the supplies and take chips, but they must obey two rules: the total value of the chips taken cannot exceed that of those turned in, and at most one chip of each color can be traded.

After each round the start player moves. The winner is the first player to have two chips of each color. If playing solo the object is to reach this goal in as few turns as possible.

The book versions of the game include variants:


In Sway Swap the dice are not rolled each round; instead they are rolled all together only at the start of the game. On a player's turn they choose a die to roll, after which they re-order the dice and then may trade.



In Sellout the die rolling is handled as in Sway Swap, but it uses dice in colors matching the chips instead of ordering the dice. In this version the game continues until there is only one chip left in the market, at which point the player with the most chips wins.
publishers: Blue Terrier Press, Hugendubel Verlag, Pro Ligno Spielewerkstatt

name: Slide in the DMs
description:
Players rotate drawing a DM card while the rest of the group competes to play the funniest Play card. Once everyone has played their chosen Play card to submit face down, the rotating judge awards a point to the funniest one.

Contains: 150 “DM” cards, 350 “Play” cards plus instructions
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Elfmeter!
description: Both player simultaneously tries to play the right cards. One takes the role as attacker, and tries to pass the ball three times and take a shoot at the goal. The other player is trying to prevent exactly that. If he succeeds and grabs the ball the players immediately change roles.

name: Guess in 10: Cities Around The World
description: Ask up to 10 questions to guess the city on the Game Card! Is it in Asia? Is the capital of a country? Is it touristic? Think hard, ask intelligent questions, use your clue cards wisely, and be the first player to win 7 Game Cards!

name: Orchards: The Card Game
description:
Orchards is a strategic card game in which players will plant, grow, harvest and sell fruit in order to fulfil orders from the market. Each order fulfilled earns the player victory points. At the end of the game the player with the most points wins.

Plant the domino-shaped cards in a grid to form the orchard. Grow by adding cards to your hand matching the cards adjacent to the one planted. Harvest fruit by enclosing a card of that type within the orchard. Sell harvested fruit at the market to earn victory points and win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: GUATAFAMILY 'the family edition of Guatafac'
description:
The game of imagination and mental agility to laugh with your family :)

Answer in less than 8 seconds to questions of all kinds: family, school, moments, laughs ...

Win points by answering correctly to each card. The one who answers more questions corrrectly and has more points at the end of the game wins :)

A game to play from 8 years to 99, adapted to the family. Play in 15 to 60 min, 3 to 10 players and millions of possible answers.
Cards printed in the European Union on paper from sustainably managed forests. 1% of the profits are donated to charities.

name: Fais-moi un dessin 2
description:
2 teams face each other and the goal is to make your partner guess what you are drawing before the timer runs out.

The team that guesses the most drawings wins.

Based on the French tv show.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Action Timer, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: Crime Bet
description:
1888, in London. The torpor created by the recent murders in Whitechapel has not reached East End punters. While a new assassination is announced by the police, who refuse to reveal the sordid details to the press, the customers of the pub "the White Boar" embark on a day of slightly crazy bets. Their but? Bet on Jack the Ripper's new package.

In this competitive game of deduction and betting, players embody customers of the pub "The White Boar" who have organized some special bets. They will be able, throughout the day, to obtain crucial information on the circumstances of the murder, by bribing their informant, other players or the police. At betting times, they must use deduction and daring, while skillfully managing their supply of Beer tokens, to make the most worthy bets!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Communication Limits, Deduction, End Game Bonuses, Questions and Answers

name: Smile Life Girl Power
description:
The girls take power and redistribute the cards... Equally!
The Girl Power extension contains 60 new cards including 30 in-game professions in women's version and paid at equal salary!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Viva
description:
The cards show 1 or 2 of 6 possible colors. There are 3 spaces on the table for a card to be placed face up. The first card of the stack shows the actually blocked colors. On your turn, play a card without a blocked color in a vacant space or onto a face up card with matching at least one color. If all 3 cards show a common color, the table is cleared and the neighbors of the active player are punished with cards.
The last card of your hand must be placed onto the blocking card matching at least one color. The first player who got rid of all his cards is the match winner. The last player will be punished with a personal blocking card for the next match. After 8 or 12 matches, the player who won the most matches wins the game.

name: Donaumelodien Escape: Der Schatz im Stephansdom
description: Who doesn't know the legend of the treasure in the world-famous St. Stephen's Cathedral? Centuries ago, a chest full of gold is said to have been hidden there, and since then it has been considered lost. Immerse yourself in the Vienna of 1876, in a story full of riddles and mysteries, and go in search of the legendary treasure!

name: Bid Rights
description:
A "second-price auction" bidding game where bidding certain amounts (or using certain bidding cards) allows you to see the value of some of the unexplored planets up for bid.

Bidding is done with a small set of 11 bid cards, and players cannot bid the same amount, so it sometimes feels like a resource-allocation game (or even a worker-placement game, in a way.)
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Set Collection

name: Skylanders Island Quest Game
description:
Get ready for an ultimate Skylanders adventure as you battle Kaos and his minions. Place one of the fighting-action lenticular cards into your mover base and start exploring the 6 different islands. Defeat villains in order to collect keys and charms, but watch out! If Kaos shows up, all active Skylanders lose some of their power.

Contents: 6 island game boards, 32 lenticular Skylanders cards, 34 reward tiles, 34 challenge tiles, 8 starter activation tokens, 4 keys, 4 card holder movers, game die, rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: The Curse of the Pharaoh
description:
Plays on 3D board depicting a pyramid.
It is a Disney game, in which players took Minnie, Goofy, etc. and are trying to reach top of the pyramid. They have to complete tasks and answer tricky questions.
They move according to a dice throw around the pyramid on three levels, only on one place they can move up, but always can fall back down. On other places they have to take a card with task or question or get a torch, which can save your life before you fall down through the hidden door.
It is a children's game.
Pictures on the pyramid are very detailed with disneys attention to detail.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Children's Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Seek: The Original LDS Quiz Game
description: Targeted at members of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, this is a game that tests your knowledge in the following categories: Book of Mormon, Old Testament, New Testament, and Doctrine & Organization. The questions get progressively harder and worth more points. The first to reach a score of 150 is the winner.

name: Dinosaur King
description:
When the son of a world-famous paleontologist, along with his friends, finds some mysterious dinosaur cards and a stone slate, he discovers he has the power to bring dinosaurs to life! In fact, whoever controls the cards controls the dinosaurs. Our heroes in the making must ensure the cards, now scattered all over the world, don’t fall into the wrong hands!

The Dinosaur King TCG is a fun, easy-to-play Trading Card Game based on the exciting Dinosaur King Cartoon, where 3 kids, Max, Rex and Zoe, are searching around the world for lost Dinosaur Cards. The Dinosaur King TCG replicates the exciting battles seen on TV with Move, Dinosaur, and Character Cards. The Dinosaur King TCG also promotes collectability with amazing art and foil cards.

Home Page: http://www.dinosaurkingtcg.com
categories: Animals, Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric, Video Game Theme

name: Sanning eller skitsnack
description:
Objective: get as many victory points finding correct answers
- acting simultaneously -
active player draws a card and reads aloud; a matching answer generates a victory point; game wants to create fun by confrontating players with weird/useless questions

name: Finger Olympics
description:
We now announce the opening of the Olympic Games!
Players compete in a wide range of fingersports, on land and sea, in summer and winter, solo and teams. Whose fingers are higher, faster and stronger?! Simulate various events with your finger as the others try to guess what you are doing. You only have one attempt! Are you the Best of the Best?
—description from the publisher (translated)

手指奧運會正式開幕！
不論是水中還是陸上、單人還是團體、夏日還是冬季項目，所有人都使出渾身解數，務求取得佳績。看看我們的健兒……竟然全都是手指！？

用手指模仿各種體育項目，其他人要競猜答案來得分。但每人只有一次機會，可沒那麽簡單呢！你能在高手叢中脫穎而出嗎？

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Marinattack
description: This Swedish game is an early example of in-game electronics. It consists of a game board, plastic play-pieces, and a patented hand-held "computer" that replaces dice. Marinattack formed the basis for the hybrid computer/board game Tankattack published by CDS in the late '80s.

name: Missionary Conquest
description:
Each player is an American Christian missionary with the goal of visiting a number of countries on short-term mission trips. Various cards that are drawn poke fun of common experiences of those who go on short-term mission trips, including setbacks in raising money to go on the trip, and (in another country) finding out that the local cuisine does not agree with your stomach.

If you're behind in the game, you can go to a country that does not welcome outside religions - if you are martyred you get an extra bonus. You'd be out of the game but might win posthumously.

name: НЭП
description: Russian adaptation of monopoly
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Scrabble Crossword / Dominoes
description:
From the back of the box:

An exciting new way to play with words. Letters, instead of dots, turn this popular classic into a dashing, two-dimensional game.

Using basic domino rules, the object of the game is for players to take turns placing their lettered tiles "domino fashion" to build words and create a domino crossword.

Play ends when one player uses up all his tiles and the bank is empty. Points are deducted for tiles left in anyone's hand. And the highest score wins.

Inside, you'll find 50 tiles, each with numbered score points and two letters arranged horizontally on one side, vertically on the other.

Ages 10 and up

name: Dog Rush
description:
It’s dog walking time in the park. Oh, wait! A rabbit passes by, and all the dogs escape their owners to run after him, getting their leashes all tangled up. Quick! Find the end of the leash corresponding to the dog that was chosen at the beginning of the round in Dog Rush, pull it from the messy entanglement, and win a treat for your furry friend!

—description from the publisher

name: Hounds and Jackals: Game of the Pharaohs
description:
The Ancient Egyptian game known to us as "Hounds & Jackals" or "58 holes" appeared fairly late in Egyptian history, during the New Kingdom. Neither name nor game rules have come down to us, so how the game was played is up for debate an reconstructions. One assumption is that it has similarities to Snakes & Ladders.

In a reconstructed set of rules, each player races his team of pieces (hound- and jackal-headed sticks, respectively) on his side of the race track, which includes a couple of ladder/snake shortcuts. Since each player races on a separate track, there is apparently no direct player interaction.
publishers: (Public Domain), Fratelli Fabbri Editori  (Fabbri Editore), HistoryGames.it, Ludens Planet, Ludens Spirit, NewVenture Games, Pyram

name: Chasing Rabbits
description:
"One day, three Californian surfers, in search of perfect waves, take a shortcut across a farmer's field in their old-woody-surfwagon. The farmer, sensing a surfer's hunger for the sport, reluctantly grants permission to trespass. His only request, "don't let the rabbits out of the pen - or they'll reproduce and eat my produce." Well, curiosity doesn't kill the cat here, but it does create a stir, when one surfer inadvertently opens the pen containing the rabbits the farmer had retrieved from his property. Now, faced with humiliation and banishment from the farm, and their shortcut to good waves, the surfers must catch all the rabbits."

OBJECTIVE: To be the first player to have all his/her rabbits make into (sic) the safety of the brier (sic) patch. Each player always has two moves; rabbits first, and the woody second. (The 'White Die' moves the Rabbits, the 'Blue Die' moves the Woody).

name: Yenta
description:
A free game from the Cheapass Games double-secret website.

From the website:

"Yenta is based on a game by Aaron Richards called 'Stoopid Cupids,' sort of a cross between Liar's Dice and Go Fish."

name: Aqeuropoly
description:
Aqeuropoly covers 4 continents and 24 countries. Your musketeer (player) journeys with the aim of setting up companies in the various countries. The end goal is to dominate a continent with large holding companies.

Players gain points by offering different services and holding companies and having the largest market share. Players may simply build and start companies or can do a hostile take-over of other opponents companies.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Klau Mau
description:
"Klau Mau" is a variety of the classic card game "Mau Mau". In "Klau Mau" you are playing a thief trying to get the most valuable cards. Upgraded with some special cards you have to try to get the most points and win the game this way. Aside from the influences of "Mau Mau", "Klau Mau" got some game mechanics from the popular "Uno".

With "Klau Mau" Nürnberger Spielkarten Verlag GmbH put a newly card game onto the market, which combines two good knewn card games to create a new gaming experience.

The game is made for two up to eight players and suitable for players of age seven. One round runs about 20 minutes.

name: The Ultimate Card Game
description:
If you're into card games, ultimate, or yeti attacks this is the game for you. It's a perfect party game, 2 decks allow for 16 players.

Deal 5 cards to each player.
Flip over a goal card from the goal deck.
Players can choose from one of three card types:
Offence (O), Defence (D), and Game Changer (GC).
Having the highest O-Card on the board at the end of the round is the primary way to collect Goal cards.
D-cards allow players to steal O-cards of equal or lesser value.
GC-cards add some mayham to the round and include powerful effects.
The first player to reach 7 goals wins.
Once obtained, Goal cards are hidden in your hand so that opponents cannot easily sum up your total - trickery, deception, and subterfuge are encouraged.

Offense Cards : Dump, Scoober, Hammer Time, Pinpoint Huck, Jimmy Mickle, Brodie Smith

Defense Cards: Tall Grass, Tree-Fence, Hand-Block, Gale Force Winds, Jonathan Helton, Mark Lloyd

Game Changers : Wholesale, Bird Block, Mixed, Give and Go-al, Poach, Integrity Rule, Good Spirit, Empire Builder, Yeti Attack, Beau Kittredge (Dual Threat), Injury Sub, Timeout

Booster Cards: Buzzer Beater, Wiley Vet, Lockdown Defender, Callahan, Hospital Pass, Radicals Zone, Royal Crowd Surge, Double Team, Flow

name: 12 Realms: Bedtime Story Companions Pack
description:
Description from the publisher:

This is a set of new characters that can be added in any game of the 12 Realms Universe.
