With this pack you get 8 different heroes, with their minis and boards: Alice, Mad Hatter, Peter Pan, Tinkerbell, Sherlock Holmes, Dr. Watson, Dorothy and Toto.

You can also use these characters with the companions mechanic, described in 12 Realms: Ancestor's Legacy.

name: Supernatural Save Your Souls
description:
Fans of the TV hit Supernatural know that Sam and Dean abide by certain rules to keep themselves safe. One of said rules is keeping innocent people out of harm’s way—but rules were meant to be broken.

The Winchesters finally got a Supernatural card game, appropriately titled Save Your Souls. It breaks all the rules the brothers strictly obeyed…or so you thought!

Sam and Dean Winchester need your help. Join them on a card game journey to save innocent lives. Ok, well mostly, the goal is to save your own.

In this game of chance, you’re paired with one of the series’ iconic hunters, an angel, or even the King of Hell himself. Be careful! You must choose your cards wisely, or you could end up losing your soul.

—description from the publisher

name: SENTO: Ultimate Arcade Fighter
description:
Your challenger stands across from you as you enter the arena. Only one of you will walk away as champion. FIGHT!

Sentō: Ultimate Arcade Fighter is a fresh take on the classic arcade fighter! Sentō is the first tabletop game to capture the puzzle fighter experience, and bring it from the digital space to the analog.

Sentō is a fighting game with a vibrant cast of worldly characters. Each character brings their own asymmetric style and abilities to each match. Play as a chef with powers over ice and fire, a trickster magician with manipulative mind games, or a lively DJ dropping powerful beats!

On your turn, activating your attack is as simple as clearing a chain of same colored connected marbles from the dispenser. Your character's unique attack list will tell you what attack they perform based on the number and color of marbles cleared. Use your attacks wisely to hinder your opponent, accelerate your own unique systems, manipulate the board, and deal damage to your opponents' health gauge buttons! Each time you break a button, they must insert 1 of their 5 coins into the arcade cabinet (marble dispenser). When there are no more coins to insert, it's game over!

Each player has 3 buttons. These buttons act as health gauges, one for each color of ability and marble (Red, Yellow, and Blue.) When dealing damage, you decide which button to damage, and once a button is brought down to 0, you break it and disable your opponent's access to those attacks! However, broken buttons allow you to "Short-circuit" through marbles of that color (essentially making them linking marbles), allowing a weakened opponent to more easily activate their hardest hitting attacks in their remaining colors. Your buttons will recover as you "Short-circuit" through same colored marbles, and can be re-activated at the beginning of any turn. But do so too early and they could get broken again quickly, burning another coin!

A player is knocked out once they have no more coins to insert, but be careful. If a button is broken while having other buttons out of commission, you must insert a coin for each broken button! You'll need to carefully balance aggression and caution in this quick-action puzzle-driven fighting game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Take That, Tug of War

name: Betrayal: Deck of Lost Souls
description:
Many lost souls have been lured by the secrets hidden within the House on the Hill. Now an ancient relic—a cursed deck of cards—from the darkest reaches of the attic has entrapped you as well! In the Betrayal: Deck of Lost Souls standalone game, a player and their fellow explorers must race to defeat the many horrors lurking within the deck. Play Item cards to defeat Omens and Curses, but beware! There may be a traitor in the group, working against the others to unleash the one true Curse.

Take on Secret Roles
Everyone is assigned a secret role: play as one of several explorers working together to defeat Omens and Curses. But beware, someone might be the traitor trying to stop the others from defeating the true Curse.

Use Items to Defeat Omens and Curses
Each Omen and Curse requires different Item cards to defeat it, so explorers strategize to help each other get the Items they need.

How to Win
If the explorers have the Items needed to defeat the true Curse at the end of the game, they win! If they don’t, the traitor wins.

name: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark: Meeresabenteuer
description:
Mauseschlau and Bärenstark want to recover a treasure from a ship wreck deep in the ocean. But the diving is not without risks. There are aggressive sharks, and a mysterious creature guards the wreck. By he who can answer questions and perform tasks related to ships and oceans, and has a little luck with the dice, will be first to bring his treasure to safety.

It is a roll-and-move game where the players follow a track through the sea, from the ship to the diving bell, from there to the ship wreck, and upwards to the surface.

On many spaces, a question related to the sea will be asked; younger childs can select between three answers on the card, older ones have to find the answer without help. On other spaces, a small pantomime is requested. In both cases, oxygen tanks can be won. These are needed on the shark spaces. Without air, the player has to retreat to the diving bell.

When reaching or passing the wreck, the player gets a piece of the treasure.

On addition to sharks, the area between the ship wreck and the surface is guarded by a plastic Kraken. It is moved by a special die, and if it catches a diver with treasure, the treasure is lost, and the player is send back to the diving bell. When a player reaches the surface with a treasure, he wins the game.

Changes to the precursor (Mauseschlau & Bärenstark: Abenteuer unter Wasser) include: Less shark spaces, especially in the last part after the ship wreck; an additional die for the kraken, so the players can move the kraken in addition to their own playing piece; the treasure is easier to get, since the wreck no longer needs to be reached with the exact die roll; a variant is included to make it easier to leave the sea with the treasure. As a result, this revised game plays in half the time, and has less luck of the dice.

name: Crying With A Sad Clown
description:
When a clown cries we all cry. In this game of Crying With a Sad Clown you must try to cry the most by playing cards from your hand and gathering the tear tokens.

Game Contents:
60 Cards of Four Suits (Man, Woman, Child, Clown)
24 Tear Tokens

Game Setup:
Shuffle and deal all the cards to all the players. Every player should receive the same amount of cards.

Game Play:
The starting player chooses 1-3 cards from their hand and plays at least one face up in front of their play area. All other players in order play 1-3 cards either face up or face down in front of their play area. After all players have played a card,flip over any face down cards.

Score each “trick” as follows: The man (blue) and woman (yellow) act as a group. The baby (purple) and clown (red) are a group. The group with the least amount of cards wins the “trick” and takes a tear token of the same color as the card they played in player order. If the groups are equal in size, no player wins a token. After each trick, the starting player is the next player in order. The game ends when 3 of the 4 color tear tokens are depleted or when all of one player's cards have been played. The winner is the player with the most tokens within the widest variety of colors.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Gallina City
description:
Gallina City is an interactive and exciting family game. Become the boss of the farmyard by finding the identical images as fast as possible. Be precise with your descriptions and pay attention to the other players’ descriptions. Otherwise you might lose some feathers!

In Gallina City you try to get rid of your cards as fast as possible in three rounds (with progressively increasing hand size at the beginning of them). Cards are composed of four poultry scenes, with slight variations between the quite similar scenes found in different cards.

For achieving this goal every player describes the scenes in their cards at the same time as other players do. In this pandemonium of people talking about chickens, you try to discover who has in her card exactly the same scene as in one of yours. If you are right, each of you discard your card and are one step closer to victory. If the other players show you that the pictures are not *exactly* the same, both of you get penalized and take another card from the deck.

The round ends when one or more players have exactly two cards left in hand. The rest of the players earn as many negative points as their hand size at that spot. After three rounds the player with less negative points win.

Gallina City includes rules for a team version.

--description from the publisher:
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Speed Matching

name: Emoji
description: Emoji is a party game based on symbols.

name: Sixth Sense
description:
The game that challenges both your intelligence and power of deduction. It was created by "Marko" Meirovitz, the inventor of Master Mind(R).

Master Mind meets Battleship!

Each player inserts symbols and/or numbers into a plastic playing board using colored pegs. Then, in turn, each players asks the opponent(s) if a peg is in a desired section of their board. Each player keeps track of all guesses either on a separate board or in memory. The player whose symbols and letters have been discovered is out of the game. The player who outlasts and outwits the others wins.
publishers: Climax Corporation Sydney Australia, Educa Borras, Gemini Games (UK), Mind-Flex Games, Otto Maier Verlag, RR Fenton & Co Auckland New Zeland

name: Kesse Rüben
description: Kesse Rüben is a strategic gambling game. The cropland consists of 16 fields, were farmers can plant their own crops. However, before a crop can be planted, first another farmer should be challenged, and bet an unknown number of crops. The winner of the gambling duel can perform a number of actions, like moving to another field, planting an own crop, or removing the crop of another farmer. The farmer who ends up with the highest number of crops, wins the game.
publishers: Darmstadt spielt, Österreichisches Spiele Museum e.V.

name: Dunk Jam
description:
A 2 player basketball game. You choose three of the five available types of players to make up your team (each having a bonus for offensive movement, defensive movement, shooting, etc). You takes turns playing offense. The offensive player has 3 turns to play a card (1/turn) and get a shot off. The offensive player can move and pass the ball around, the defensive player move to block the offensive player, steal the ball, or block the shot. If the offensive player does not get a shot off by the end of the 3rd turn, its a turnover.

The closer you are to the basket, the easier the shot. There are two ways to resolve shots, either a simple roll of the twelve-sided die, with longer shots being tougher, or by a little dexterity shot where you flick a basketball up on a slightly angled board, and try to get it in the basket. The farther away you are on the main board, the further back you have to attempt the dexterity shot with.

The second in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label "Aeronaut". They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring-binder in bags and pouches.

name: Tolentino 1815
description:
When Napoleon escaped from Elba in 1815, his former cavalry commander Murat was still King of Naples. He had switched sides the year before in an attempt to retain his throne, but he soon found that neither Austria nor Britain were willing to keep their promises. When Napoleon marched on Paris, Murat attacked the Austrians in Central Italy. He was defeated in the battle of Tolentino on 2 May. He escaped to France, but Napoleon did not want his services. After Napoleon´s defeat at Waterloo, Murat returned to Italy, where he was executed in October 1815.

The not so well known battle of Tolentino is the subject of "Tolentino 1815" a Napoleonic wargame from Italian wargames magazine "Alea Iacta Est". It includes one unmounted 42 x 58 cm map and 216 thin cardboard counters, all in full colour. One game turn represents 2 hours of real time, and one hex is 250 meters.

The magazine is in Italian, but the rules in English are also included.

name: Punch Cards: Spy Game
description:
This is the second set of Punch Cards released by Cheapass. Punch Cards are just what they sound like; cards with holes punched in them.

On the front of each of this particular set of cards is art from "James Ernest's Totally Renamed Spy Game" (illustrated by Cheyenne Wright) and on the back are lots of numbers. Riddling the cards themselves are the aforementioned holes. (Just your standard office hole-punched style holes)

You and your opponent each pick a card (based solely on your like of the art work) and then a corner of the card. Place the two corners together so you can see the numbers through the holes.

Now both players call either "High," "Low," or "Both." If one player says "High" and the other player says "Low," play again. Otherwise, either the highest or the lowest number wins, depending on what was called. If either of you says "Both" the game is always on, but you must win both highest and lowest numbers to claim victory. Read out the highest/lowest numbers you can see through your holes and try to beat your opponent, that's it!

This particular set was released at summer conventions because "James Ernest's Totally Renamed Spy Game" (a re-working of the classic and trademark-infringing "Before I Kill You Mr Bond") wasn't quite ready yet.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Trouble School
description:
The theme is troubles that girl students may experience.The players try to avoid these troubles.
This is a Japanese card game,and English rule include .

name: Khitan
description:
In Khitan, each player wants to eliminate the opponent's pieces – but both players start with the same number of (nearly) identical pieces, so you'll need to play carefully in order not to get knocked down yourself.

To set up, each player takes a set of hexagonal pieces, which are double-sided and have the same six colors on their two faces, and places them in the starting locations on the board. On a turn, you flip one of your pieces to an adjacent space. If a colored edge on that piece is now in line with an identically colored edge on an opponent's piece, remove the opponent's piece from the board. More that one piece can be destroyed with the same move. Zap all the opponent's pieces, and you win!

Khitan includes two variants. In the first, each player has a reserve of three pieces, and the first three times that you eliminate an opponent's piece, you add a new piece to your side of the board. (NB: You can't make captures when placing a piece, only when flipping.) In the second variant, each player has a reserve of six pieces and this reserve is replenished by pieces removed from the board, so you'll need to set up multiple attacks to keep the opponent from playing tit-for-tat and staying alive forever.

name: Goodnight Goodnight, Construction Site: The Game
description:
Cooperative game based off the children's book by the same name.

Work together to put all the construction vehicles to bed before the sun sets.

Includes game board, 5 truck movers, dice tower with sun/moon dial, and game die.

Roll the die and move any construction vehicle the number of spaces on the die. If you reach a work space you must stop moving. If you roll the sun, move the sun dial forward one space. The game ends when every vehicle reaches their bed or the moon appears on the dial.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dig In
description:
Featuring a bowl filled with 128 beautifully modelled, colourful game pieces (32 different everyday items in 4 different colours each), a chunky timer and cards showing 6 items to be collected, Dig In! looks exceptionally simply, but is quite challenging. Players get just 15 seconds to dig through the bowl with both hands to try and get all the pieces they need to fill their card. If no-one manages to fill their card this way, all players then ‘dig in’ at the same time, using one hand only, until someone fills their card. Dig In! offers two levels of play – one where players must find six pieces in any colour and one where the pieces must be specific colours.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Bizak, Drumond Park Ltd., Enigma (Bergsala Enigma)

name: Doodad
description:
doodad is a captivating card game that requires strategy, creativity and a bit of malicious maneuvering. The object of the game is to spell ‘doodad’ with the Letter cards you collect – with the challenging twist that you can’t put one Letter card next to another unless the symbol and/or color on the cards match. The dastardly Strike card allows you to steal cards from your opponents and ruin their best-laid plans, but remember that turnabout is fair play! Play it safe with a quick easy score… or go all in with a more difficult scheme to get extra points! How will you doodad?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Eyetoons
description:
Put your musical knowledge to the test in this fun family board game. Go head to head in a variety of musical challenges. Can you identify the artist and song fromt he cartoon on the card? Can you hum the tune or draw your own 'toon'? It's a race to the finish in this action-packed musical medley.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Ginger Fox Games, Hacche Retail Ltd., Six Creative

name: Ocean Park
description:
In this game, each player will become the manager of an ocean park. Players shall invest on hundreds of kinds of oceanic fishes and advanced feeding facilities in order to build a unique and fantastic marine ecosystem, thus attracting more tourists than the opponents.
—description from the publisher

在遊戲中將扮演一位海洋公園的經理，通過引進多達上百種美麗的海水魚，和精心配置飼養設備，來建立一個奇幻的海底世界，從而吸引更多遊客前來參觀。
—description from the publisher (Chinese)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Irish Gauge: Hiawatha Gauge
description: Published exclusively in the Autumn 2021 edition of TraXX Mainline magazine, Hiawatha Gauge is a cube rails game set along the routes of the historic Milwaukee Road Hiawatha trains. Featuring the proven Irish Gauge game system, this is a "magazine game" variant on a small map with only three companies. You’ll need a copy of Irish Gauge to play this game.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hexagon Grid, Income, Investment, Network and Route Building, Random Production, Stock Holding, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Cluckle
description: Each round in Cluckle, someone squeezes the rubber chicken to pop out the "egg" die and determine the length of word that each player needs to create. Everyone then races to flip over their egg tiles to see which letters they have. Create a word of the proper length as quickly as you can, then grab the chicken to win the round.

name: Dylan Dog
description:
A game drawn from the character of the comic strips created from Italian author Tiziano Sclavi.

The players must succeed in finding the proper cards and then put them in correct order in order to complete a horror history story in which they are involved. The board can be changed by increasing the difficulty in order to accommodate players who have played before.

name: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
description: Be the first player with the most chips after ten rounds. Game is played based on musical chairs where players try to collect three matching character cards plus one Kevin card. The first player to collect them grabs a pawn from the center of the board.
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Breaker 19: The CB Trucker Game
description: Players move around the board delivering loads and trying to earn money to pay off their "rigs". The rules are printed on the inside of the box top, and the components are relatively light - two types of cards, player markers, and play money.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Nocturna
description:
A group of greedy brothers have inherited grandma Nocturna's old house. Although they have never heard about her, they will now... too many times...

The will asked for just one thing: to leave all the furniture just the same as when she passed away. For that purpose, the brothers count with few pictures the old Nocturna left. Whoever is the first in rearrange most rooms as the will demands, can claim the rest of the inheritance. The greedy brothers, although, didn't knew they were going to face Nocturna because she is haunting the house.
mechanics: Action Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: UNO Blast
description:
UNO Blast adds a new level of surprise and excitement to America’s #1 brand of card games! When you draw a card you can’t play, you have to put it in one of five slots in the card blaster. The cards stack up until someone randomly triggers the blast – when the blaster goes off, the player adds ALL of the blasted cards into their own hand.

Unique to this UNO deck are the Wild Blast cards. When you play a Wild Blast card, the next player has to take cards from the draw pile and put them into the card blaster until he or she triggers it. Will they end up with one extra card in their hand or five? You’ll have to play it to find out!

name: Normandy '44
description:
In Normandy '44 players relive the largest single amphibious invasion in military history. This game is a recreation of the forces, strengths and positions of the Allied and German forces on the morning of June 6th 1944

The playing board is a map of the five landing beaches and surrounding areas divided into 120 different sectors with a variety of different terrain types including water, beach, field, forest and towns.

The playing pieces are cardboard squares representing AA guns, Artillery, Bombers, coastal Guns, Fighters, Landing craft, Soldiers, Tanks, U-Boats and Warships.

Game play is turn based. The rulebook is short and sweet, at only eight pages in length. This does lead to some confusion, however, as some of the rules need clarifying.

This game was released in Canada.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Orgasmo
description:
The pleasure has only one rule ... Make it last!

Eliminate all your opponents during wild orgies, prompting them to climax before you!
Are you able to satisfy your partner longer than the others? Use embarrassing Chances against other players, offering them more and more obscene amorous positions to make them reach Orgasm and conclude their party!
Proclaim yourself master of pleasure in an erotic race to see who “comes” last!

In this irriverent game you have to make your opponent reach pleasure by using Performance card named from 1 to 10, (the 10th card is Orgasmo, that eliminates the player who receive it).

You can also use comic action cards to keep calm your pleasure pile and increase your opponents pleasure!
The game was released in Lucca Comics And Games, with Rocco Siffredi as testimonial of the game, and soon will be presented in Europe with new professional illustrations and a lot of various adds to the Game Sistem
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Christmas Stories
description:
Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.

Christmas Stories gives a holiday-themed version of this game.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game

name: Battleship: zAPPed Edition
description:
Each ship has its own super weapons!


Battleship
Aircraft Carrier
Destroyer


Battle aliens and protect the Earth!

Embark on epic missions around the globe ...

Hunt down alien targets ...

Destroy the enemy!

—description from the back of the box
categories: Modern Warfare, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical

name: Tripoley Dice
description:
Tripoley Dice is described on the front cover of the rulebook as a game for two or more, ages 8 and up. The game comes with 9 special dice, 1 dice cup, rules, and 1 pad of scoring sheets.

The object is to win the most total points in each game, or series of games. A game of Tripoley Dice consists of three known games, or sections: Hearts, Poker, and Michigan Rummy. Instead of using cards, players roll dice to determine their "hands." The nine dice contain all 52 cards and two jokers. At the end of all three sections, the player with the highest total is the winner of a Tripoley Dice game.

name: Mint Control: Swap Promo
description:
The Swap Promo allows you to replace another player's influence token with one of your own and to play the difference if it is a more expensive influence token.

This promo was released as a Kickstarter exclusive for Mint Control's first crowdfunding campaign.

name: AC/DC
description:
From the box:

The game contains 84 cards, each representing a part of an electric circuit. The first player to finish putting together his circuits - before his opponents shock or short him out, wins! It's an engaging way to learn about electric circuits and is suitable for experts too.

Directions and easy explanation of electric circuits are included.

name: Indiana Jones from Raiders of the Lost Ark
description: Another game centered around the 'Raiders of the Lost Ark' movie. Spin the spinner, move your piece, and do what the board says. To win, collect the four cards of the same color. The board looks good, but the mechanics are weak.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Paris-Dakar
description:
A race game about the (in)famous Paris-Dakar rally supported by the 'Thierry Sabine Organization'. You need to manage your fuel and overcome damage to your race car to reach Dakar.

See the pictures for the game components.
publishers: Falomir Juegos, MB Jeux, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Meltdown: The Nuclear Energy Conflict Game
description: "MELTDOWN is the nuclear energy conflict game based on one of today's most important issues - Nuclear Power. Each player or team is assigned six zones which they must make NUCLEAR FREE or NUCLEAR SAFE to win. Chance and strategy come into play as the gameboard and other players work to cause a NUCLEAR INCIDENT at the reactors in the zones. Real-life situations challenge players and add to the excitement, making MELTDOWN the most intriguing and important game of our time."

name: Affenbande
description:
Each player plays one race of apes, symbolized by a stack of ape cards. Apart from that each player gets 15 apes as henchmen.

The aim of the game is for each player to harvest as many different fruits as possible in four play rounds with his apes. At the beginning of a round everyone receives an ape map and the pertinent ape chips. The fruit markers with dark background are sorted and each player receives the five different fruit sorts. The fruit markers with the bright background are sorted and laid out in piles in the table center. A play round is divided into two phases. In the first phase the players put three apes to different harvest places. These apes are called apes scouts. In the second phase the remaining apes are secretly sent to the places, where already scouts of the own race are. In addition the players take the three different kinds of fruit, at which their apes wait and lay them out next to each other behind reproached hands. At the end, they place their remaining apes against each fruit, if they wish to do so. The next step is remove the hands at the same time and the players put their apes to the appropriate places. Only the player, who has the exclusive majority at a place, can harvest a fruit chip. All other players withdraw their entire apes again. The winner may only take half of the assigned apes to his stack, the others remain at the place. If there is a draw, nobody harvests the fruit. The entire apes move then again to the players back. After four rounds that player wins, who could harvest the most different fruit kinds. Players compare their fruits and the total number decides, who the winner is.

name: Hercules Save Mt. Olympus 3-D Game
description: Hades has taken over Mt. Olympus, and it's up to you to save the day. Make your way to the top of the mountain with the help of your trusted winged stallion, Pegasus. But be careful - a battle with a terrifying Titan or evil monster could send you down the mountain. Be the first to reach the summit and restore Zeus to power, and you win.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monkey Madness
description: Can you be the first to get your three monkeys to safety at the top of the banana tree? Spin the spinner. Your monkey might climb, or go to the top, or grab a ride on another monkey. But don't spin that gorilla, cuz that grabby guy is just waiting to climb and knock you off the tree. How high will he go? Will he miss you or send you flying? So start climbing but hang on tight, cuz this is Monkey Madness.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement
publishers: MB Spellen, Milton Bradley, Parker Brothers, Tactic

name: N Sync Backstage Pass Game
description:
This game is for Ages 8 and up. It is for 2-4 players. It is loaded with personal facts about the members that you won't find anywhere else. Answer multiple-choice questions about Justin, Lance, Joey, Chris, and JC as you make your way through the stadium toward the stage. If you match the secret password you get the backstage pass and you win!

Game contents: 1 backstage pass in a plastic cover, 59 cards, 1 stadium board game, 1 spinner with arrow, 20 band member stand ups, 4 band stands, 6 fans, 4 security guard stand ups, 4 secret password chips, 1 sheet of game rules, and 1 neckband .

name: Washing Machine Game
description: Players try to be the first to put their dirty washing in the machine and get a washing line full of clean clothes. But look out for the card that shrinks your washing! You try to get pairs of the same item, so that you can have one dirty and one clean - the clean one goes on your washing line and the dirty one in the washing machine. Cards are drawn from the stack and the discard pile to achieve this. You can also play shrink cards to hamper your opponents. It all makes for a simple strategy game for children Ages 4 - 8

name: At Whit's End
description: It's a fast-paced, room-to-room race that will test your knowledge of history, the Bible and, of course, Adventures in Odyssey. Draw a Charades card, and step onto the stage in the Little Theater to give the performance of a lifetime. Move to the Room of Consequence...but only if you’re prepared to reap what you sow. Pick a Draw card, grab a pencil and get creative. But make it fast--your next move will depend on it! Be the first to leave each room successfully and you win!
categories: Party Game, Religious, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Top Secret
description:
From the box :

"The most fascinating game you can play with friends. Take one card from each of the four categories: ethical, serious, surprising or intimidating disclosures. Are you willing to admit to your partners that the statement on one of your cards applies to you? If so, read the card out loud and win a token! Then for an additional token, try to guess who would be willing to admit what you just admitted. Nothing to confess? Take four new cards for your next turn. TOP SECRET - your guarantee of laughter, fun and excitement."

Consists in revealing shocking secrets about yourself and trying to find out who would also agree with you.

name: Monopoly: Toys 'R' Us Times Square
description:
Now the world most popular board game lets you relive the thrill of the 60ft. ferris wheel, and miles of fun-filled aisles at the Toys "R" Us: Times Square Store.
-Game board features departments from the Toys "R" Us store such as Game World and Wheel World.
-6 collectible pewter movers: Nerf football, Tonka truck, Hotwheels car, Mr. Potato Head, Mr. Monopoly, and Geoffrey
-Plus a Ferris Wheel and painted wooden hotels and houses.
All packed in a collectible tin, found only at the NY Time Square Toys "R" Us.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Speedybag
description:
Fast-paced and exciting action game for all ages! As a card is turned on the table, all players reach inside their bags and try to find the object pictured in the card, just by feeling with their fingers. If you are the first to find the correct object, you get the card. The winner is the player who has the most cards at the end of the game!

2006 Nominert til Årets Barnespill - Nominated for Children's Game of the Year, Norway

name: Sea Rover
description:
Three Nations fight in a Caribbean-like Sea against each other or vs. the evil Pirate Lord . You can find ghost ships,
castaways, treasures. Build ships, trade with cities or loot them. All what a Pirate movie needs ... Aye
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Space Merchants
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple, abstract game of spaceship commerce and conflict. Up to two players compete to amass 50 billion credits by the end of the game. The players move pirate, merchant, and bounty hunter ships through various sectors of space. A third player may control the police force ships, which attempt to destroy all pirates.
categories: Economic, Fighting, Pirates, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Adventures in Fairyland
description:
From the publisher:

In the mystical realm of Fairyland, adventure, magic and fun await discovery under every mushroom cap and flower petal as players travel across Fairyland to meet the fantastic creatures who live there – mermaids, unicorns, dragons, elves and many more! Be the first player to visit as many fairy creatures as you can and collect tokens of their friendship to win. Adventures in Fairyland includes 28 beautifully illustrated fairy tiles, 4 wooden fairy game pieces and comes in a delightfully illustrated wooden box.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Front Porch Classics, Sababa Toys, Inc., University Games

name: Barricade Disney
description:
This is a children's version of Malefiz aka Barricade. You only have 2 pawns instead of five. There are only 4 barricades instead of 11. And the board has fewer fields. If your pawn is taken by another and this happens on the top half of the board, you don't have to start all over again. In that case you may start again in the middle of the board. There are also secure places on the board. If you are on a blue field with a drawing of Pluto, you're safe from attacks of other players. Barricades can not be placed on the blue fields. There are even simpler rules (with one pawn) for children between four and six.

Though it is somewhat confusing, Ravensburger produced a Spongbob version of both Junior Malefiz and Barricade, the latter is a version of Malefiz. These two different items used the same cover artwork but differed on the board layout, rules, and numbers of figures.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: StarRunners
description:
You control a small fleet of spaceships, as does your opponent. Your task is simple: you must maneuver your fleet across the galaxy to your opponent's star system. Along the way, all of your ships must stop at a difficult-to-reach system called Backwater. It's a friendly race, so you can't actually attack the other player, but there are ways you can try to slow them down. Who will get there first?

Game System

Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 3rd Competition

name: Monopoly: Nijmegen
description: The classic real estate game set in the oldest city of The Netherlands. All the major streets are for sale, including the four trainstations. This game was published in a limited edition as part of the promotion of the 2000th anniversary of Nijmegen.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Imaginez
description:
In Imaginez (French for "Imagine"), players try to associate cards in their hands with one of the 12 cards on the board. Cards represent either objects, animals, places, country, well-known persons, etc. There must be a direct link between the two cards you are trying to associate. There is a score (from 1 to 3 ) on each card. Each time you successfully associate two cards, you score the total of the cards. First to 50 wins.

Example: "Napoleon" is on the board and you have the "Corsica" card. Since Napoleon was born there you could associate to these two cards. Later on, you could put "Island" card on Corsica (since it's an island), then maybe the "Treasure" ("Treasure Island"), etc.
publishers: Agence de publicité Bos., Éditions du Boréal

name: Monopoly: Rhode Island
description: Rhode Island Monopoly combines the classic game of Monopoly with a Rhode Island touch. Well-known Rhode Island based businesses replace the properties and even the community chests.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Star Trek All About Trivia
description: Attention Trekkies, the ultimate Star Trek trivia game is now available. Be the captain of your own starship where your knowledge of the Star Trek series influences your success. With 1000 questions every Trekkie with have to beam-up to the challenge. Contains trivia question cards, game board, playing pieces and dice.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: NBA Adrenalyn XL
description:
From Sports Collectors Daily:

"Adrenalyn is a new game designed for kids that includes a 450-card set of NBA trading cards. The interactive game is geared to children ages 6 to 11. Veteran stars Carmelo Anthony, Kobe Bryant, Lebron James, Dirk Nowitzki, Dwyane Wade and NBA rookies Tyreke Evans, Blake Griffin, and Brandon Jennings are among those included."

Adrenalyn is a collectable card game from Panini Games that aims to combine the aspects of collecting sports cards and collectable card games. The game is sold in packs of 6 cards, with starter sets sold with game mats and 25 cards. The cards have an offensive and defensive value, and they also have codes that let kids download their cards to an online collection and play online on Panini's website.

name: Die kleine Raupe Nimmersatt: Das Original-Spiel zum Buch
description:
[Translated and condensed from the Spiel des Jahres website, http://www.spiel-des-jahres.com/cms/front_content.php?idcata...;id=606]

Eric Carles' Very Hungry Caterpillar has an enormous appetite. Very close to the original book, the children embark on an adventure to change into a butterfly. On Monday it begins its journey. Before the caterpillar reaches the apple, it has to go on a sun box. Travel cards are revealed; Whoever finds the sun card earns a solar chip, and continues in search of the red apple. This memory game is easy to learn, so that even three year-old children can successfully complete the transformation into a butterfly.

name: Ärihai
description:
The goal is to rise your firms stock times 20 it was at the beginning of the game. The whole game is a cross-breed from Monopoly and Cashflow.

Each player gets one firm at the beginning of the game and starts to develop it step-by-step by moving from the developers track to the wall street track and from there to the win.

During the game you do a lot of selling and buying, going through business schools and paying fines to other companies.

You win the game when you have raised the stock value 20 times.

--description from publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Stock Holding, Track Movement

name: Le mot le plus long
description:
From the rules:
Famous game show, the board game formula has seen many versions for several decades. This is one of the first versions.

The board represents a path of squares alternately white and black. The game includes two sets of cards, vowels and consonants, and 6 special cards representing each side of a dice.
The goal is to complete 3 laps of the course by forming the longest words possible. The first player draws 7 letters by choosing the convenience vowels or consonants.

It has 1 minute 30 to form a word that has spread before him, if a player can form a longer word, it announces and shape. Whoever has the longest word advance his pawn on the course as many spaces as there are letters forming the word. Maps of the word are removed from the game The next player must keep the other letters and return to pick the missing cards to replenish his hand to 7 letters. If nobody finds a word, 7 letters are rejected and the tour resumed.

On the course, when a player lands on a black square, he rolls the dice, takes the letter corresponding to the figure obtained (this letter can be A, E, I, O, U or S) and must reform a word of the same number of letters in the word presentation of the current lap. If it fails, it returns to the box where it came from.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Lucky Dice
description:
Test Your Skill

The Lucky Dice game board is a single card that was included with the Carnival game. However, the game card is not really necessary to play.

The following items are needed:

3 dice (d6)
a piece of paper
a pen


Draw a grid on the paper that mimics the grid on the Lucky Dice game card. This will be used to score the rows, columns, and 2 diagonals. The scoring is as follows:

Doubles = 5 points
Triples = 10 points
Straight = 15 points


To play, roll the 3 dice. Assign the three values to any unused squares within the grid. Repeat 2 more times until the grid is full. Add up the scores for the rows, columns, and diagonals to get the total (final) score.

Alternatively, if you have 9 dice available, roll three at a time and just place the dice on the spots within the grid on the Lucky Dice game card. After all dice have been placed, sum the scores for the rows, columns, and diagonals to get the total (final) score.

name: Perilous Pyramids
description:
Perilous Pyramids is a competitive multiplayer card game in which players assume the roles of archeologists each racing to the center chamber of a pyramid.

Each player builds their own side of the pyramid using ten face-down chamber cards. Players clear chambers by playing resource cards from their hand that meet or exceed the difficulty of the chamber.

These same resource cards can be used to make the opponents' chambers even harder to overcome, swap revealed chamber cards, cancel a played card and more.

The first player to clear their pyramid completely and clear the final central chamber wins the game.

Game-play is fast and aggressive, as the game encourages players to sabotage the efforts of their opponents.

name: King of Clubs
description:
The air in the city is electric as the hottest nightclubs host evenings of intense dance competitions. You're the manager of the best new dancers on the scene, ready to show off your team's sweet-sweet moves. Winning at a nightclub will earn your team prestige for the night, and most prestige wins a point. Win five nights of dancing to be crowned the King of Clubs — but to earn your points, you have to dance!

King of Clubs is a fast-paced card game of sweet-sweet dance moves for 2 or 4 players. In the basic two-player game, each player has a team of dancers valued 1-5. In each round, four of the nine nightclubs (valued 2-7) are revealed, with nightclubs of the same value being paired for a couple's dance. Each player assigns one dancer to each nightclub (two dancers for a couple's dance), then players reveal the values of the dancers with the highest-valued dancer(s) winning the prestige value of the nightclub; the back-up dancer held in hand breaks ties. Whoever wins the most prestige in the round earns a point, and the first player to win five points wins the game. In the four-player team version, each teammate sends a dancer to each nightclub (without consulting one another about who's being sent where), and the highest low-valued dancer in each nightclub wins the prestige; if the lower-valued dancers are tied, then the higher-valued dancers are compared.

In the advanced game, each player also has a hand of five "move" cards. After revealing dancers in a nightclub, whoever has the lower-valued dancer can play one or more moves on the dancer, as long as he can chain the icons shown on the bottom of the dancer card and the bottom of the move cards. After determining who wins a nightclub, the player draws move cards equal to the "move" number shown on the back-up dancer still in hand, discarding down to five move cards, if needed. In the team version, the symbol on the first move card must be present on both of the team's dancers.
mechanics: Acting, Area Majority / Influence, Team-Based Game

name: Who is the Sunflower?
description:
It is said that angels poured courage into a seed, then planted it into the soil of the human world, and that is how sunflowers came to be.

And so it happens that on a beautiful island a student-led social movement breaks out. If only they can find the legendary sunflower that hides great power within him, the movement can prevail, and so the student leader will use any means necessary to find it; but the government is dispatching police to hinder him, spread disinformation and sow confusion. What kind of future will the island have?

Who is the Sunflower is a microgame in which two secret teams face off, trying to discover each other's identity. Each player gets an identity card. Some characters need to identify certain other character (e.g. Student wants to find Sunflower), while others need to be identified by certain character (Banana wants to be found by the Student). After some discussion, players that need to find another character can attempt to guess who that character is. If this fulfills any player's victory condition, the round ends, with those players scoring a point each.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: USA Bingo
description: Players try to make a bingo vertically, horizontally, or diagonally on 5x5 bingo cards depicting US States. One or more clues are read from a clue card to help identify each state.

name: Super Jogo da Vida
description:
In Super Jogo da Vida all transactions are made with credit and debit card reader machine. In addition, the boxes of the game, insurance and stock, are linked to actual products and services. The modern Super Jogo da Vida machine also has other functions: roulette, announces the winner and calculates the taxes automatically.

Similar to The Game of Life

name: Christmas Tale
description:
From the publisher´s website:

In a small town far-far away, everyone is excited for Christmas. There are holiday lights in all the windows, the houses await the holiday all groomed up.
The kids are walking home from Christmas celebration. The way is long and slippery. And you have to stop so many times, to look at shop windows, talk, pick up lost hats, scarves… but maybe they have time to help the angel, too… no?

Players roll die and move forward. If they reach "Ice"-space the slip another space. "Deep snow" make You move slower. If more than one player is one and the same place they chatting and only 5 or 6 allows You to move again. And many other things.

Player who reaches home first is the winner.

name: Turn A-Round
description: In Turn A-Round, players lay their cards simultaneously in such a way as to have more of their own colored cards showing than those of their neighbors. But watch out! You are not allowed to lay cards on your own colored cards!

name: Monopoly: Brisbane Edition
description:
Description from the publisher:

We’ve seen the cities of Sydney, Perth, Adelaide and Melbourne all immortalised with their own MONOPOLY City Edition, and this year sees the launch of Brisbane Monopoly!

With seven million visitors each year, Australia’s new World City has a reputation as a fantastic lifestyle city, which will be played out in the world’s favourite game.

The spirit and shape of this customised edition will remain the same as the traditional game, but now you will be able to buy and own your favourite Brisbane suburbs and landmarks! There will also be lots of twists and changes too, including Brisbane-themed Community Chest and Chance cards
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Harald: The Badger
description: Six new badger cards to replace one of each animal's card of the standard deck with a new power.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: With Your Mouth Open
description: Players split into two teams. Each round a player puts his device into his mouth and flips the sand timer. He draws a card and tries to say the word written on it as many times as he has to in order his team finds the word! When he is out of time he gathers the cards found by his team. The team with the most cards wins at the end of the game!

name: Die Fly!
description:
Die Fly! is a 2-6 player card game where each player will take their turn by playing a card onto one of two discard piles. Most of the cards in the deck are flies. When a discard pile has some flies in it any player out of turn can play a fly swatter card. When playing a fly swatter card on one of the discard piles that player then collects all of the cards in that piles. The more flies you kill the more points you are awarded at the end. There are other cards that allow you to steal from another player hand or from another players kill pile (the bug zapper, and frog cards). The spider allows you to kill two flies directly out of your hand. The food cards allows you to name a type of fly and any player that has that type in their hand must give you all of those flies. You can't forget the poop card when played forces the opponents to place a fly directly on it, but also when someone uses a fly swatter card on a pile that has a poop card that player must complete a penalty to continue on the game.

The theme is based off of flies, butterflies, and dragonflies. The art is goofy but totally fits with the style of play. It is a fun family friendly game that only takes about 15 minutes to play.

—description from the publisher

name: Yahtzee: Disney's Pirate of the Caribbean
description:
This game combines Yahtzee and Battle Yahtzee under the movie theme of Disney's Pirate of the Caribbean. In Battle Yahtzee version, each player starts as one of the captain from the franchise. They receive a card that illustrates the captain and provides a special power (each captain has a different one) to be used during the game.

From the publisher's website:
Play the classic shake, score & shout dice game or battle it out on the seven seas in this special edition of The Pirates of the Caribbean Yahtzee. Custom playing pieces including dice, game board and ship tokens add a unique twist full of pirate adventure as you roll high scoring dice combinations on the high seas!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Gut getippt!
description:
Gut getippt! is a party guessing game. Your goal is to estimate the correct answer as accurately as possible. The content: 275 useless facts.

—description from the publisher

name: Shitty Questions
description:
Each round in Shitty Questions, the active player asks the other players a question. After each reply, secretly drop the player's heart in one of two tubes: Smart or Shitty! The last responder chooses the winning tube. The players in the chosen tube move up the freedom board!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Blue Orange (EU), Hobby World, Magellan, Rebel Sp. z o.o.

name: Flucht aus dem Alltag
description:
Driving to work, ironing, cooking - who does not know the feeling that everyday life is really absorbed and captured. In this unique escape game that is actually the case!

The exciting story takes the fellow players on a mysterious adventure full of tricky puzzles and encrypted codes. Only those who manage to solve all the tasks in the given time will ultimately be able to escape everyday life. But be careful: If you don't want to be misled here, you need ingenuity, creativity and the ability to work in a team.

The ultimate game for all puzzle lovers and escape fans.

name: Geek Out! The 00s Edition
description:
Geek Out! is the game of mind-challenging fun that finds out once and for all which player is the reigning geek authority on your favorite geeky pop culture subjects!

In the game, you will draw cards asking you to list things which fall under a certain category. Before you begin, however, the other players may try to steal your points (and bragging rights!), by bidding to list even more than the card requires. The bidding continues until one player is ready to “out-geek” their friends and family.

Geek Out! the 00’s Edition will have you and your friends geeking out and feeling nostalgic about your favorite decade! Are you ready for this dope new edition? Woot woot!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Sans Pitié
description:
A game in the tradition of Cards Against Humanity.
One player is the master of the round and reads out the text of a red card. All other players now each secretly select a black card. Those black cards are shuffled and read out as responses to the red card. The master of the round decides which response is funniest and the player who chose that card receives a point.

—user summary
publishers: ATM Gaming, Blackrock Games, JU2COCO, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd

name: Grocery Go Karts
description:
Shop, stack, and race to the finish! The Grocery Go Karts game is the build-and-stack game of supermarket mayhem! In this preschool game, it’s time to go fast and stack high as shoppers zoom around the gameboard’s grocery store racetrack. After rolling the die, each shopper moves their wobbly kart to the next space that matches the color they rolled. Then they can add a grocery item to their kart that matches the color they landed on. Tower, tilt, and try not to topple the groceries in this stack-as-you-go sprint to get everything on the grocery list. The first shopper to get all of the items on their list and reach Checkout wins. The best part? To celebrate, they can launch the groceries from their kart with a press of its lever!

32 CONNECTABLE, COLLECTIBLE GROCERIES: As shoppers zoom around the board, they stack and connect their shopping list’s mini groceries in their kart. The first to hit Checkout with all their items wins

4 WOBBLY KART MOVERS (AND LAUNCHERS!): Feel a need for speed? Choose from 4 wobbly, wheeled kart movers. At the end of the game, celebrate by pressing the kart’s lever and launching its groceries

GET DEALS WITH COUPON CARDS: Land on a Coupon card space and draw a deal, such as “Pit stop for a price drop! Add 3 items of any color.” These cards can help players add more items to their kart

Contents:
Gameboard
4 karts
32 plastic grocery items
4 grocery lists
12 coupon cards
1 die
game rules

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stacking and Balancing

name: Dragons: Wettflug zur Dracheninsel
description:
Dragons: Wettflug zur Dracheninsel ("Dragons: Race to Dragon i=Isle") is a game based on Dreamworks' How to Train Your Dragon 2. In the game, the dragon riders attempt to reach the Dragon Isle, while the dragon Screaming Death tries to prevent them from doing so.

At the beginning of each game, the board is created by lining up island tiles, starting with Viking Island (start) and ending with Dragon Isle (finish). The islands between start and finish come in four different colors.

The game is played in rounds. Each round, one player plays Screaming Death, while the others play a dragon rider. Each dragon rider has a hand with colored island cards. Each turn, each dragon rider selects one of these cards. At the same time, Screaming Death selects one color of islands to attack. Then, everybody reveals their cards. Each dragon rider that has selected the color that is being attacked by Screaming Death cannot move; the others move to the next island of their chosen color.

The round ends when two dragon riders have reached Dragon Isle, or when the dragon riders can no longer move because the deck of island cards has run out. The first dragon rider to reach Dragon Isle gains two coins; the second rider gains one coin. If no dragon rider reaches Dragon Isle, Screaming Death gains three coins. If only one rider reaches Dragon Isle, Screaming Death gains one coin.

The game continues with a new round, until each player has played Screaming Death once. Then, the player who has collected the most coins wins.

Spooky, an earlier version of this game, had the players as ghosts moving through a castle, with each player taking a turn as Merlin to try to stop the ghosts.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Viaje por Europa
description:
Description from the box:

"Prepare your luggage and make your trip plan, because you are going to know Europe from one end to the other.

Maybe you'll have to get the Transiberian or sail the Black Sea, but don't lose to much time: your partners are at your tail!"
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Roll&Ghosts
description:
Roll&Ghosts is a fun and fast Roll&Write/Print n' Play game for 1 to 10+ players, for ages 9 and up, featuring art inspired by vintage cartoons from the 1920s and 1930s.
For 10-15 minutes per game, players will use their dice to explore a haunted house, loot treasures and catch spooky ghosts before fear takes over and forces them to flee with whatever they have collected.

During your turn, you will roll 7 dice and use 1 of the movement dice to enter a room in the house, then use the rest of the results to find and collect treasures, or to create a portal to trap ghosts with. Every treasure and ghost is worth points.

By spending some of the collected resources, you will be able to perform special actions, such as re-rolling the dice or changing the value of a die.

You will also have a dice reserve where you can store up to 3 results that you can spend and use at any time during the gameplay.

The game ends when the Scare-o-meter counter reaches the end.

The player with the most scored points wins the game.

You can also play using the mission cards, which will demand you to collect specific resources before the game ends.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Healing Blade: Infectious Disease Card Battle
description:
Note: This is a different game than Healing Blade: Defenders of Soma

Publisher Blurb
Which are you? - An Apothecary Healer or a Lord of Pestilence? Choose your destiny and determine the course of events in the ground-breaking new game from NerdcoreLearning. Developed by two physician/gamers, Francis Kong and Arun Mathews, The Healing Blade plunges the player into a world of sorcery and creatures, where real world knowledge of infectious diseases and therapeutics play a pivotal role in the winning strategy.

Choose one of two sides:

The Apothecaries, Champions of the Healing Blade whose namesakes hearken from real world antibiotics
The Lords of Pestilence, Creatures of Disease and manifestations of actual bacterial agents.


As you and your opponent seek domination through corruption and conquest, you must vie not only with brute force, but also with planning, strategy, and most importantly, an astute understanding of microbiology and medical therapeutics. Healing Blade gives you the unparalleled opportunity to enter a fantasy realm where the rules of combat deeply and accurately reflect the real world's battles against infectious disease. Reshape the Battlefield Zone to your advantage. At every turn you control the forces and special conditions that can influence the outcome of each encounter. Each Champion has a unique set of gifts and abilities, and can be upgraded to powerful adversaries by way of real-world phenomena such as resistance and synergy. Summon forth living manifestations of diseases, or counter-attack with antibiotics in the form of powerful warriors.

Includes:

1 Instruction Guide
2 Playmats
90 High-quality, Fully-detailed Playing Cards
20 ATP Markers


NOTE: Please see the updated rules at http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/915465/new-v2-0-rules-fo...

ALSO NOTE: As of May 2015, NerdcoreMedical has Kickstarted a re-worked stand alone sequel of this game called Healing Blade: Defenders of Soma https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/nerdcoremedical/healing... . The new game uses the same characters but the gameplay is now asymmetrical, attackers can gain resistance or unlock powerful mutants, and in general the game plays very differently.

name: Backpacker
description:
This boardgame is based on the PC-game Backpacker.
For 2-4 players or you can play in teams.

The players are going to visit cities around the world, and they decide how many before the game starts. (for a beginner it's best to start with 3 cities)
Every city has its own board. The players arrive in the city and they try to earn some money by answering questions about different occupations. They also get money if they can answer questions related to the city. These may be about history, politics, geography etc.

Knowledge is money. And the player/team with the most money after a city is finished gets a postcard from that city. The first player/team to get 3 postcards wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rooster Run
description:
Description from the publisher:

Get ready to hunt for love as you dig up worthy worms to woo the hearts of the hens on the farm! Rooster Run is a twist of a memory game in which you are a strapping young rooster ready to peck your way to that dear hen's prize worm and win her heart. Flip over earth tiles to find the perfect dinner. After you find two worthy worms, end the round by calling out "Cock-a-doodle-doo!!" and score points for correct matches — but don't be too hasty! If you call out too soon without your prize worm, prepare for heartbreak and lose your dinner!
publishers: Asmodee, Blue Orange (EU), Blue Orange Games, Lúdilo

name: BASH!
description:
Contents:

The base
6 each of red and yellow pieces (round and square)
Hammer
"Oh Fooey" card.


Opponents strike colored pieces from the stack, without toppling the stack. The winner is the owner of the last remaining piece(s).
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Counter Intelligence
description:
You are the Spymaster of a team of agents -- Your Mission is to penetrate the Control Centre and seize the Master Modules hidden there. BUT... Counter intelligence sources have discovered that a rival power has despatched a team of ruthless Agents to oppose you.
You must direct your team to the control Centre via an international network of safe houses. En route, you must eliminate the opposition whilst avoiding their murderous attempts on your agents.

Essentially a game where you plot movement on your board and try to work out where the enemy is on his board. Lots of guessing and bluffing needed. The winner is the first player to capture any one piece of the five Master Module pieces. You can also win if you are the lone survivor.

A triumph of design, nothing is wasted. The game comes in a leatherette wallet, the pieces are magnetic and stick to the player boards and the rules are on the back of these boards. The boards and components are suitably dark and sinister for a game about espionage.

Contents
2 Dossiers
36 Spy Counters
6 Target Counters
5 Master Modules
mechanics: Area Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Rock, Paper, Scissors, Inc.
description: No longer satisfied with being a child's pasttime, Rock, Paper and Scissors have all gone into business against each other: Rocks Inc., Paper Inc., and Scissors Inc. Your job is to invest in these rising new companies and make more money than your opponent. How? Well, by playing Rock, Paper, Scissors of course! This game was a finalist in the 2003 Simultaneous Movement Board Game Design Competition sponsored by About.com Board Games and Abstract Games Magazine.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Stock Holding

name: Cherry Ames' Nursing Game
description:
Object of the game
Two to six players travel around the game board, which represents various phases of nurses' training, obtain six rings of six different colors, and strive be the first to "graduate" successfully from nursing school.

Game equipment
Playing board, six playing pieces, thirty-six colored rings, a spinner, and twenty Cherry Ames cards.

name: Valor and Vengeance: The Battle of the Ulus-Kert, March 2000
description:
A desperate battle of national pride. Neither side would back down and the bloody battle for Hill 776 ensued. Lasting four days, the Russian paratroopers would fight against overwhelming odds. Supported by artillery, gunships and aircraft, the Russians battled the Chechen foe, some 1500 of them . Opposing them and their escape was the 6th Company, some 90 men.

The town of Ulus-Kert is surrounded by steep, wooded terrain. About 6 km of the town are the Dargenduk mountains. About 2 km south of the town is Hill 705 and another 2km the opening of a narrow gorge begins.

About 4km SE of the town is Hill 776, on the gorge's east side. Hill 787 is 1 km south of this hill. Between them is a saddle and a mountain path that the Chechens had hoped to escaped through. Company 6 had the mission to prevent this.

A squad/platoon quasi-tactical game, over 160 counters, one 11x17" color map.

As a Russian player, will you also call artillery fire upon your own position? Will you survive?
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: W Cieniu Saturna
description:
In 2093 the Marsian revolt de-organised the economic structure of the Solar System. While the United Sates and Japan put on on the program of colonization, the European Economic Community and Hegemony Of East Asia were exploring the outer planets of the System. The main new colony became Titan - the biggest of Saturn's Moons. The first period of colonization was going in cooperation but in 2117 economical and territorial quarrels let to the outbreak of war.

First game in Sfera's Seria Miniatur.

It was an unlicensed copy of SPI's Titan Strike! Battle for the Moon of Saturn.

name: Stratagame
description:
From Website:

http://www.stratagame.org
The fate of the world is at stake !

Six major powers compete for control over world resources as alliances rise and fall, and armies sweep over the continent. Stratagame is as much about skillful diplomacy as is it about chess-like strategic know-how. The player who in the end owns most of the continent’s resources wins this game of epic adventure.

Stratagame is a strategy game in which 2 to 6 players try to capture the continent’s resources. Stratagame is played on a chessboard roughly representing Europe. There are no countries or clearly defined territories in Stratagame. Stratagame has no preset historic framework and no realistic pretensions, therefore Stratagame is not a wargame or a simulation game. Stratagame combines the mechanics of games like chess with modern strategy principles. Compared to other games in its category , Stratagame has been designed to be simple and easily understood. There are no overly complex or difficult rules in Stratagame and the manual has only 6 pages of rules. However, as like chess, the simplicity of the rules does not guarantee an easy mastery of the game. Stratagame is generally played in 2 to 4 hours, depending on the number of players and strategies involved.

Stratagame contains 6 armies of different colors each composed of 52 playing pieces. As like chess, when a playing piece tries to enter a square already occupied by an enemy piece, a combat occurs. Each playing piece has a Strength of 1 to 5. A playing piece’s Strength determines the number of dice it rolls during combat. The piece obtaining the highest result on the dice wins the combat. As per other chess-like games, Stratagame can also be played without dice.

Contains:

1 chessboard (21” x 33”)
1 rulebook
6 reference sheets
60 playing cards
24 resource tokens
12 dice

6x 21 infantries
6x 11 bases
6x 3 artilleries
6x 6 mechanized
6x 4 armors
6x 5 fleets
6x 1 heavy armor
6x 1 QG

name: Salomo 3000
description:
Salomo 3000 is a Bible trivia game. The name refers not only to the 3000 questions included but also the 3000 proverbs that are said to have come from King Solomon.

The questions are divided in seven categories. The players are first dealt random category cards. They may keep a part of the cards and exchange the rest with other players. The cards then determine the asked questions.

Players collect pearls into their crowns. Two correct answers in a row gives a pearl. However, in the crown category single correct answer is worth a pearl. First one to collect seven pearls wins the game.

Expanded by:

Salomo Junior

name: Tavern Battle
description:
This game begins when most of the role playing game ends.
The heroes are coming back from their adventures fighting monsters and gathering treasures. But still, the dwarf is missing his axe, the magician is looking for his book with new spells, the Elf wants his enchanted lantern back. So every character is looking for something important to him.
In the first phase of the game each player tries to get the item he wants back by negotiation. If that fails, well, then we will have a hefty battle in that tavern and one sure thing we know is that there will be not a single chair left intact after that fight.

This game consists of 110 cards (12 different characters like Trolls, Goblins, Paladin, Orc etc. and lots of items), dice and a rule book.

name: Sternsammler
description: Help a poor, little girl collect "pennies from heaven." Roll the dice and move the girl around the board. If she stops under a star gate drop a penny and pick it up. Whoever has the most pennies at the end of the game wins.

name: Würfel Joker
description:
Content:
3 dice, a tableau with slide fields from 1-6 and 3 jokers

Each of the players try to achieve dice combinations as printed in the booklet. The fulfilled combination is marked by sliding the number aside. Three dice are used.
The aim is to get the highest score after 10 rounds.

There is also a version No. 2

It is a game of the legendary Krone-game-series for adults.

name: Defenders of ClayArt
description:
Defenders of ClayArt is a game designed and published by B2FGames in Tachikawa, Japan. This game is currently sold by retailers in Japan only but whole components and the rulebook are written in English planned for worldwide publishing, though not yet achieved as of Aug. 2008.

Introductory text from the rulebook:

At a gallery in the city, or a studio in the countryside, snobbish artists, each thinking of him/herself as a defender of art, bicker with each other over works of "art". Much ado about nothing.(Welcome to the world of art critics. No talent necessary!)
You, as one of these artists, criticize the works. If your critique is pointed, you win the honor of being the true defender of art.
In this game, the players make clay sculptures with a certain theme, and criticize (rather than review) them. You can earn points when your critique matches the others'. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Master: Um teste à sua inteligência
description:
Throwing the dices will show you the letters you'll use to write words. Starts a competition in which the player's intelligence and discernment is tested, but... attention: the sand clock is running against the players!

Com o lançamento de dados que ditarão as letras a utilizar na formação de palavras, tem início uma competição na qual se põem à prova a inteligência e a perspicácia dos jogadores mas... atenção: o relógio de areia está contra os jogadores!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Minutspelet
description:
This is a game about mathematics. Each round the active players throws 14 6-sides dice marked with numbers between 1 and 15. The goal is then to use these numbers in 4 mathematical calculations using addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. A timer is used to determine time allowed. All numbers in the used dice will added together and all unused dice is then subtracted to produce the score. Each players plays a number of rounds, but the actual winning conditions isn't specified in the rules, this must be agreed upon in advance.

You need to be fairly good at counting to be successful in this game. For that reason it usually isn't fun for kids under 10 or so, even if the rules are very simple.

Similar to Laskutaituri which is for 1 to 8 players

name: Les Z'Amours
description:
The object of the game is to give same answer as partners to questions in order to score the most points. The couple with the lowest score after the final wins.

The game takes place in three phases:
1. Phase "Men": men and women will answer questions about six men. Each woman draws 1 card issue where the answer is man.
Each correct answer will score 5 or 10 points
2. Phase "Women": Women and men will respond to six questions concerning women. Same principle as for the questions men with the addition of the bonus issue which is worth 15 points.
3. The final phase: to win, the pair will give the maximum correct answers to 10 questions in the final.
The system is somewhat different since a member of the couple will meet secretly to 10 questions. Then, a facilitator will ask the questions and the member of the couple will say Yes or No:
1. if he says yes, his companion can attempt an answer.
2. if he says no, proceed to the next question.
The couple must try to get at least 5 hearts (correct) and 2 points for each correct answer.

At the end of three phases, the couple with the highest number of points wins the game.

name: Qube: Perhepeli
description:
What is the smallest mammal in the world? How much did the first mobile phones weigh?

A fun and quickly played trivia game for the whole family. 500 questions in five different categories, including: sports, entertainment, travel, technology, animals and nature. The game also comes with 49 special cards.

name: Drink & Beat
description:
The game crafting beermats for lovers of good beer. In the game teams compete magical characters who are strong, but not on the battlefield, and in the tavern for a drink.

The goal - to collect more mugs of beer than your opponent. Beermat has two sides, on which the images are identical, except background (swords or axes). Before the game, the opponents choose background team for which to play. Players take turns beermat spread on the table, trying to flip the enemy's beermat. On each of the four edges of the beermats have a figure, it shows the power of character to this edge. When a player puts a character next to another, it compares the figures for the contiguous edges. If the power is laid out the character more the enemy, character is flip into a our team player. The player always puts his background beermats up. If at the end of the course one of the players from the field lined beermats 3x3, the game ends. Players count the points and determine the winner. Each character have the icon beer mugs in the lower left corner . For every mug of beer at the bottom left icon on beermat in his team, the player gets points. Mugs of it image is a points will the character of his team, on whose side he would. Different mug can bring a different number of points.

name: The Noodle Game
description:
The aim of The Noodle Game is to score the most points by picking up various value noodles from the box and placing them on your place without dropping them on the table.

At the start of the game, all players pick up their chopsticks, with the tips remaining in contact with their plates (the starting position). The youngest player starts and play continues clockwise. Each player, in turn, uses their chopsticks to try to pick up ONE noodle from the box and place in on their plate. Once the bottom end of the noodle leaves the box, the other players can lift their chopsticks from their plates and attempt to steal the noodle and place it on their own plate. Once any part of a noodle touches a plate, it is considered safe and cannot be stolen.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Monopoly: NASCAR 50th Anniversary
description: Racing enthusiasts can now enjoy two classic American pastimes - Monopoly and NASCAR - in a limited, individually numbered collector's game. Climb into the driver's seat and speed around the customized game board showcasing NASCAR's 22 racing legends and reigning champions. Advance to GO and salute NASCAR's 50th anniversary with this deluxe edition of the world famous Monopoly game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ogres & Elves
description:
The royal elf family is coming to visit their mountain kingdom. They want us elves to fill their treasure chests with the different gems we mine. However, ogres have heard about the visit and plan to grab all the valuables for themselves. We must do our best to get royals and ogres alike to share the goodies. Easy to say. This requires lots of tricky teamwork with each game increasing in difficulty. Strap on your invisible shields, dear elves and head for the mines. The royals are coming.
Ages 5 and up.

name: UNO: Care Bears
description:
Basic Uno Themed card game.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Care A Lot" card. This card works like a wild card and basically spreads the love around the table. Everyone is allowed play any card they want to regardless of color. Any action card is basicaly dead for this round of play.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Geoprimo
description: Educational geographical game. The player who knows his way around the world gets to see more.
