The Colosseum, the statue of liberty, the pyramids - just 3 from 42 famous sights waiting to be discovered by the players on the puzzle map of the world. The person with the right answers, grabs the continent piece and receivers a chip in return. Speed and a comprehensive knowledge of the world decide who will be the winner. The player with chips on all 6 continents can call himself King Traveler of the world.

name: Five-State Rummy
description: Five-State Rummy can make learning facts about the United States fun. The object of the game is to collect five cards of states that have touching (contiguous) borders. Each state card has an illustration of the state bird and flower as well as the name of the state capitol.

name: Happy Holidays! The Christmas Carols & Songs Game
description: Players or teams answer questions on Christmas carols and songs. They move along the board by rolling a die and answering a question in a category determined by the space they land on. Each card has a question in each of five categories: Name the Song, Multiple Choice, Sing the Next Line, Keywords in the Song, or Fill in the Blank(s). There are also spaces that allow player's choice. The first player/team to make it to the finish space wins.

name: Know Your Partner
description:
In this humorous team game for two or more couples, you face a host of revealing questions to do with your love live, your tastes and your personal habits.
You have to guess exactly how your partner will answer while they must guess the same about you!
Do you tell the truth or bluff... If you bluff, can you be sure that your partner won't reveal the truth?
Only by playing this game will you find the answers!

name: 4-Way Spelldown!
description:
From the Publisher's website:

Put your spelling skills to the test! Roll the two letter dice and use the letters on the dice and your letter keys to make a word. Flip over any keys used, the first player to flip over all 10 letter keys wins the game.

For Example:
If you roll the letter R and the letter A. Flip up your G key to make RAG. If you're really sharp, flip up both your G and B key to make GRAB! Sounds easy, right? Roll two RED letters and make any one of your opponents flip their keys down and start over.
Contents:
Wooden Board Game
Sliding cover for easy storage
2 letter dice
Instructions

name: Les Ribauds
description:
Goal of this game is to become the richest and the Ribaud with most influence in the city. "Ribaud" is an ancient French word which describes a person who likes luxury and extravagance.
You lead a team of crooks which you assign missions to. Each round consists of about 10 phases:
- Draw of a Season Card
- Liberation or execution of arrested team members
- Purchase of Event cards
- Announcement of a "big coup" and negotiation between players
- Secret placement of playing pieces
- Intervention of the police
- Taking back of playing pieces
- Solution of the "big coups"
- Income of players
- Occupation of streets (and new turn)

After 8 rounds the grand winner is determined.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Ifs & Butts
description:
This party game is played over an agreed-upon number of rounds. During each round, an "If" scenario is read aloud; for example, "If you needed to break the ice on a date, what would you say?" Every player except the reader writes a response and gives it to the reader, who chooses one to read to the group. Each player besides the reader then writes down who he thinks wrote that response. The correct guessers get points, and the process is repeated for each response.

Meanwhile, at the beginning of each round, "Butts" are assigned to certain players, who will receive points if they perform those "Butts" correctly throughout the round. An example would be, "Raise your arms in the air whenever you speak."

name: Magikaboom
description: Magikaboom is a dice game of sorcery and potions. Dice represent ingredients; players can add ingredients, activating their effects and rolling the dice to score points. But potions can be...explosive! One ingredient too much can blow the whole cauldron! Would you take the risk and become the most famous magician of the realm?

name: Sorry! Not Sorry!
description:
Secret confessions, no regrets go right along with this adult party version of the classic Sorry! board game. In the Sorry! Not Sorry! game, you'll move your pawn around the gameboard aiming to be the first player to get 3 pawns on the Home space. But there's a catch! In this race around the board you can sabotage your friends, steal their pawns, and use the Not Sorry! cards to expose their wild "have you ever" secrets. Liven up your next adult party and change things up on game night with the Sorry! Not Sorry! board game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Adventure Time Everything Burrito Game
description:
Can you get 10 ingredients into your burrito to win? Comes with optional play food and tortilla. Who doesn't remember this epic show? Now you can build your own everything burrito with things you've scavenged from all over. Combine these with the food that comes with the game and you have your very own unique classic. First player to wrap it all up wins! Awesome!

On a player's turn, they will roll the action die and either swap items form their set with another player, take an ingredient from the pile in the center, swipe an item from another player to add to their set, or draw a card. Each card contains a description of an item the player must find around their home to add to their burrito (something red, something smooth, something shiny, etc.) Once a player turns over a card an hourglass is flipped giving the player 2 minutes to find the necessary item and add it to their pile. After the 10th item is placed in the pile the player must be able to fold their tortilla and make two opposing edges touch in order to become the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Rally Round the Flag: Corps Command
description:
Rally Round the Flag is an operational and tactical game system set in the American Civil War and focuses on both the historical battle of Gettysburg and other What If scenarios around the Gettysburg battle site.

Rally Round the Flag can be played at three levels. The Corps Command game is played with each unit representing a division. The Division Command game is played with each unit representing a brigade. And the Brigade Command game is played with each unit representing a regiment.

To win Rally Round the Flag, a player must force their opponent to retreat from the battlefield or control more Victory Points at the end of the game. The system is designed to focus on the mechanics of holding key pieces of terrain and using the battle system of card play to simulate the tactics and training of each unit.

-description from publisher
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: War of Wizards
description:
Players are wizards battling in an arena. They begin at opposite sides of the arena, which is 20 spaces long. They alternate throwing spells at each other chosen from a vast array, 71 in all. Spells might be visible or invisible, and are represented by cardboard chits, face up or face down. Spells advance toward the opponent each turn, some fighting spells they encounter on the way, others not.

The rule book is 39 pages long, 20 of which are a list of spells and effects. There is a good deal of record keeping - since players must track information on all their spells and wizard.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment
publishers: Tactical Studies Rules (TSR), Tita's House of Games

name: Destination Mars
description:
From the box:
"Will you be the first to Mars?
Only if you play your cards right. Move you spaceship closer to Mars by matching your cards for points. But watch out for asteroids, comets and space junk!"

name: Going Nutz
description:
[from the box]
GOING NUTZ is the wild new game that pits your knowledge of the categorically trivial against your fellow players'. Game play combines luck, strategy, and the ability to think fast!
Amaze and amuse yourself with all the ingenious answers you and your friends can spout and spew.
But BEWARE: Players may temporarily go nuts while trying to dredge up unique answers to the 250 wacky categories supplied. So keep a tight grip on your gray matter and get ready for GOING NUTZ!

name: Lilly's 3 For All
description:
Three Really, Really, Really Fun Card Games
Ages 4 and up

Lilly had three shiny new card games that she couldn't wait to show everyone. One for creative days, one for especially difficult days, another for days when she felt sharp as a tack. For a game where you match by picture, play Picture This Please. To match by picture and color suit, try Mr. Slinger's Dress-up Suit. Or play The Mouse Connection to match by picture and connect the cards.

name: Europolis
description: A variation of Monopoly. The game enables you to make real estate transactions: buy land,villas and hotels that bring rent income or you can own airlines and utilities (water and electricity), also reliable fund resources.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hungry Higgs
description:
Hungry Higgs is played with two dice with sides 1, 2 and 3, and pieces on a balancing board. Every one of the play pieces has got a certain weight that can have decisive influence on the game.

The main strategy is to balance between caution (don’t be knocked out by your opponents game piece) and greed (capture as much prey as possible).

Figure it out:

Hungry Higgs is played on a sort of tilt. This means that weight close to the middle of the board will appear to weigh less than weight situated longer away from the middle. If you capture prey on your opponents half of the board it will appear heavier than if you had captured it from your own half of the board.

It is also a good idea to figure out the probability for being knocked home by your opponent.

Steal space:

If you can place your game piece in the middle of the board – but in safe distance from your opponent – do it. Thus your opponent will have trouble to make a safe move when it is his turn.

Find out what kind of risk you want to take to find the balance between capturing prey, stealing space or being knocked home.

Tricks:

Keeping up appearances:

Perhaps your opponent is able to knock you home – but he might be more interested in capturing preys. Don’t let him discover that he can knock you home.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Goat Slingers
description: Your goal is simple: launch your goat, land it on the cliffs and try to be the last one standing. Ready, set, GOAT! Grab the Goat-a-pult, pull down on the launcher and fling your goat onto the cliffs. If your goat sticks the landing, collect your token(s) and leave your goat in place until your next turn to create an obstacle for your opponents!

name: Goldgräber
description:
Not to be confused with the 1988 Ravensburger game of the same title by Edith Grein-Böttcher (German: Goldgräber, English: Eureka).

This older game is kind of a monopoly variant, but with less (if not to say: no) interaction between the players.

Original text from the box:
A dice-game for 2-8 players of 8 years or more.
Ravensburg Games No. 11.418
Contents: 1 board, 1 die, 8 men, 48 claims, 48 claim cards (8clours with 6 cards per color), 24 saloon cards, 24 store cards, 24 surprise cards, money.
Somewhere in the "far west" all players dig for gold. Each gold-digger tries to get possession of the sector with 6 claims which in colour correspond to his man. The way there takes him through saloons, stores, banks, and also to the doctor and the sheriff, where pleasant and unpleasant surprises await him. The winner is the player who has amassed the largest fortune. The claims and cash are added.

name: Battlelords CCG
description:
This is the CCG version of SSDC's Battlelords of the 23rd century RPG.

The Battlelords Card Game pits mercenary against mercenary in a struggle for fame and fortune. The time is the late 23rd century. The field of battle is the frontier of the Fornax Galaxy. Crime. Intrigue, and warfare run rampant. You command an elite mercenary corps, ready to engage anyone or anything ... for a price. Plan carefully, act boldly, and carry a large weapon. On the frontier, we are all living on borrowed time!

Each player (Commander) attempts to solidify the reputation of his or her mercenary company. Reputation is measured by completed missions and fame. By playing cards out on the table in a Command Display, Commanders set up shop on planets, enhance their holdings with special operations, recruit and equip mercs, send squads on missions, and bring the battle to the enemy (the other players). Successful completion of missions increases the Commander’s Fame and improves a Battlelord’s abilities. The Commander with the greatest Reputation over a pre-set amount at the end of any given round is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction

name: Spring ins Feld!
description: Spring ins Feld! is a flower picking game with a "dice pawn". The gardener pawn is made of wood, with a transparent hat that has a flower die inside of it. Whenever the gardener jumps from one flower bed to another, the die will automatically spin. The player who moved him gets to pick all matching flowers. The first full flower basket ends the game.

name: Mondreise
description:
Childrens' game about little sandmen who are searching to find the other half of the moon.

There are three rule variants which can be played. The first involves matching face down pieces of the moon to complete the seven different ones. In the second variant the sandmen race to the moon along a track of halves. They are only allowed to move to a new space if they can find the other half between the face down pieces. The third involves all players searching for a matching piece at the same time.

The game aims at the very young (3 to 5).
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cake Off!
description:
As in Spoons, players in Cake Off! want to collect all the cards of one type in their hand.

To start the game, take all the cards for one type of pastry for each player in the game, shuffle them, then deal a hand of five cards to each player. On a turn, all players simultaneously pass a card to their left-hand neighbor, and they continue this process until one player has all five cards of the same type in her hand. She then slaps the pie plate in the center of the table, after which all of the other players do so. Whoever slaps last gets a cake stamped on her hand, then players shuffle the cards for another round.

As soon as one player has five stamps on her hand, the game ends and whoever has the fewest stamps wins.

name: G.F.Y.
description:
GFY is an easy-to-learn, fast-paced card game in the spirit of Mario Kart. The rules are simple, but winning is never easy, especially at a table with experienced players. GFY makes a perfect gift for anyone in college or the military.

Each player start with 7 cards and your goal is to be the first to get rid of your cards, that is how the game ends.

On your turn draw 1 card and play 1 card, doing exactly what the card's rules say to do. Typically, this will be to discard more cards, draw more cards, or give or take cards from another player. If you can't do it exactly, you can not play it. If you can't play anything, draw a 2nd card and end your turn.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Scrabble Alphabet Scoop
description:
From manufacturer: Scoop, match, slam and score. Stir up your pot of letters and then take a card. Choose a word and start scooping tiles. If you’re the first to match your letters, slam on the pot’s lid to score.

Gameplay summary: Each player gets a card of 5 words with a range of difficulty from 1 to 5. Players announce the word they will try to spell. The pot is opened and everyone scoops tiles out of the pot at the same time. The pot contains letter and blank tiles, plus 2 "fly in the soup" tiles. If a player gets one of these tiles, they must take all tiles they scooped, plus any matched, and put them back in the pot. The fly in the soup tile is then out of play. Letter or blank tiles are either matched to the word or put back into the pot. The players keep scooping and replacing tiles until one player calls out "Yummy!" when they believe they have spelled the word. If the word is spelled correctly, they win the card, and all of the other cards are discarded and the tiles put back into the pot. If not, the round continues. First player to get four cards wins.

name: Evolutions
description:
From the rules:

The object of the game is to be the first player or team to complete the entire circle of the playing board from "START" to "FINISH" by correctly identifying the EVOLUTIONS Scenarios.

Basically, you answer trivia questions about the origins of common words and phrases, such as:

Q: The custom of dropping a piece of spiced, burnt bread into a glass of wine originated in Rome. The charcoal from the burnt bread helped to reduce the wine's acidity. This word is now a modern day proposal of good health.

A: Toast.

If you get it right and were the first player with the option to answer you move 2 spaces, otherwise you move 1. Each question has a category and if your piece is on that category when you get the answer right, you double your move - 4 or 2 spaces. Twenty-six spaces means twenty-six correct answers - or possibly as few as 8 - will win the game.

name: Aqua Park
description:
In 2055, with the land having been developed and polluted rapidly due to the explosive growth of population, all eyes are turning to the ocean as our source for survival — but roughly one thousand species go extinct each day from among the six million forms of marine life, the destruction taking place faster than the revitalization that must happen.

Now the Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission (IOC) within the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) has been given a huge budget from the world powers to invest in marine life and acquire the resources needed to survive, to create an "Aqua Park" akin to Noah's Ark from legends that will protect marine life and allow for research into the nature of the ocean and coastal areas.

In Aqua Park, players each endeavor to create their own aqua park based on the four mission cards that they hold in hand and the $10 million in their starting pool. Each player uses one of four dice (4-sided, 6-sided, 8-sided, 12-sided) during the game to try to acquire marine life cards from the five ocean zones.

On a turn, a player rolls their die, pays to reroll (if desired), asks for die help from others (paying if their dice are used), then collects all the fish in one ocean zone that correspond to the die total. If the player collects marine life needed to complete a mission card, the player can discard one life card to score those points. They can buy new mission cards for $3, with a maximum of four cards in hand. (If a player acquires marine life they don't want, they can sell it for $3 million; penguins bring in $5 million.)

Every $5 million in hand is worth 1 point, and players race to collect 15 points first. Whoever does so wins!

name: Pirate Coins
description:
Pirate Coins is a pocket-sized game played with 75 coins – 25 each of gold, silver, and copper, worth 3, 2 and 1 – and a pouch. Over the course of five rounds, you'll decide when to keep searching for more treasure and when to snatch any loot you can and run away.

Each player starts with one gold as booty. Each round lasts multiple turns, and at the start of each turn the active player draws a coin from the bag to determine how the current pile of loot would be split should players make a grab for it, e.g., if this fortune coin is gold, a player can take the loot if he's the only one to grab for it. Players then use a coin in their stash to secretly decide whether to grab for loot or stay the course and hope for more treasure in later rounds. After players (potentially) plunder the loot, the active player flips the fortune coin, adding it to the loot if the skull side lands up or placing it aside in the monster pile if the monster appears; when three monsters of the same type have shown up, the round ends and all remaining loot returns to the bag.

If a player holds booty worth 25 or more during the game, he wins immediately. Otherwise the player with the most booty after five rounds wins.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Digimon Collectible Card Game
description: The Digimon Collectible Card Game allows players to collect and battle with Digimon. There are 4 Card types, Digimon, Digivolve, Digi-modify, and Digi-Destined. There are also 4 subtypes of Digimon, Rookie,Ultimate,Champion, & Mega. The Goal of the game is to defeat the oponent's digimon, and gain Data Points.

name: UNO: Cars 2
description:
A new spin on an old game!

From Mattel comes this fast paced Uno Card Game celebrating the 40th Anniversary Year of UNO!!

Join Lightning McQueen and all your CARS 2 friends for an UNO race to the finish! Get a secret peek at everybody else's hand with the Special Agent Mater card and rule! And don't forget to yell UNO! before you cross the finish line!

112 Cards included plus Instructions
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Smuggle
description:
According to the Designer/Publisher:

SMUGGLE is a family action adventure board game that allows individual or team play. The winner is the first player to complete a major, minor, and short treasure route. Treasure Routes are diamonds, rubies, Inca Gold, Art Treasures, Mexican Silver, and money. Play is accomplished on a dual-action board game, with movement of Jetliners on the peripheral Treasure Runway, which dictate the movement of Treasure Seekers and Treasure Couriers along the Treasure Routes on the world map in the center of the board. When a Seeker reaches a Destination Foreign City (New York to Johannesburg for Diamonds), a suitcase which is color coded to the Treasure Route (Orange for Major Routes, Gold for Minor Routes, and Grape for Short Routes) is attached to the base of the Seeker, which becomes a Treasure Courier. The Courier then returns the Treasure (in the suitcase!) to the U.S. City of Embarkation. When the Courier reaches the Customs 12 Mile Limit it can't move without declaring the treasure or making a smuggle attempt. SMUGGLE cards are collected to facilitate the smuggle attempts. Yin Yang Cards bring good fortune or bad fortune along the way. Each game has different dynamics. Gals can square off against the guys and youngsters like to beat up on the adults! There is interaction of players all along the Treasure Routes. All players are in the game until it is over. The play builds in excitement until the game-winning treasure is smuggled. Smuggle Masters can team up against Treasure Czars for two teams of three players. Three teams of two players include Border Jumpers, Port Runners, and Bootleggers. Or it can be everybody for themselves. Everything is color coded for quick visual reference as to players and pieces. Quick Start Rules supplement the Rules of Play to allow immediate play to begin.

name: Banking
description:
Contents
Game board
220 cards
32 precious metal tiles
6 pawns in different colors
1 stock price board
5 red marking stones for the stock price board
2 dice
Play money

Aim of the game
Each player invests his capital in many possible ways, in an attempt to earn money. The first player to earn 500,000 Euros or another appointed sum wins.

Only cash counts toward winning the game. It is therefore necessary to part with investments again and again. Possible credits, of course, count against you.

Play
1st action
On your turn, roll one die and move. Move your pawn on
the inner track in the direction of the arrows, as many spaces as you rolled.

2nd action
Follow the directions for the space you land on.

Most of the spaces on the inner track are connected to outer fields. The outer field decides what options a player has in each case. So, you can - according to the outer field - buy or sell stock, save money or withdraw it, buy or sell real estate, buy or sell a life insurance policy, buy or sell a treasury note, or buy or sell precious
metals. Or you may land on a wage or salary space, which always brings profit.

What you buy you can also sell, depending which space you are on. When you are on a stock space, for example, you can only buy or sell shares. When you are on one of the two savings spaces, you can only buy or sell savings cards, etc.

3rd action
You must draw a Banking card and either play it now or keep it in your hand. You can also draw and play a precious metal card to replace the card already lying in the middle of the game board.

Precious metal cards are an optional draw. A Banking card must be drawn along with the precious metal card so the price of the precious metals and shares of stock change again and again.

name: Medical Monopoly
description:
In Medical Monopoly, each player is a doctor with a hospital to run. If you are successful in having the right supplies (medicines, organs, etc.) on hand and in diagnosing illnesses, your hospital fills up --the first player to fill his hospital with patients wins.

Oddly enough, this victory condition isn't clearly stated in the rules. The game has elements of a Trivia game to it, as you must often recognize an illness from a list of symptoms and remember the appropriate cure (if any). This lowers the replay value somewhat, but the game does have an educational vocation, so this is excusable.

name: Rauchzeichen
description:
Reichzeichen (Smoke Signals) is a set collecting memory game. There are two types of square cards - "narrow smoke" and "wide smoke". On the reverse side of the wide smoke cards are various landscapes. The narrow smoke cards contain horizons (end caps, think El Caballero)and clouds. A stream of nine cards is placed rising up from a fire; the narrow smoke cards are always face down, the wide smoke cards are first shown to everyone and then placed face down.

On your turn, you point to one of the wide smoke cards from spaces 4-9 (not the first three next to the fire) and claim what it is. If correct, you take it and keep going until you miss. The smoke raisings (?? don't know what this means!) the smoke raisings????....) with each card taken and new cards are added to the bottom. Alternatively you can take a narrow card. If it is a horizon, you take it and your turn ends. If a cloud, the rain gets closer and this paces the game. You need horizons to score so you will take this action often.

You score by creating complete landscapes. Each wide smoke card gets 5 points, narrow smoke cards get 1, and there are bonuses for special collections of landscape cards. The game uses money simply, making you pay the previous player if you take the card they incorrectly identified. In close games the money at the end can be influential.

name: Factories
description:
In Factories the object is to collect at least one of each of the ten resources. This is done by creating factories with the cards drawn. A factory consists of one output card, and any number of equation cards. By paying the costs in the equation cards, in order, you produce whatever the output card indicates.

This alone would be a little like solitaire, so enter the challenge you can make once per turn. Challenge anyone for up to three resources, and then each bid a secret amount more. Whoever has more wins everything, unless they overbid by more than three in which case the lower bid wins! This allows for player interaction, although not a high degree of such.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Desperado
description: Sort of the Clue of the old west. At the start of the game, one player secretly becomes the Desperado. He must make his way to the city where his money is stashed and head across the Mexican border to safety. The other players use deduction to determine who the Desperado is and try to land on his location and capture him before he crosses the border. A good game that involves bluffing and deception.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Deduction, Memory, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Barney Miller
description:
From the 1977 Parker Brothers catalog:

"Assume the identity of one of Barney Miller's detectives. Use a deck of evidence cards and arrest warrants to be the first to book all four suspects that appear on your wanted poster."

Contents: Playing Board; 1 Die; 1 Playing Piece; a Supply of Chips; 1 Deck of 56 Cards

name: Lizzie McGuire: What Would Lizzie Do
description:
Can you get inside Lizzie's head and predict what she would do? Share secrets and stories with your best friends.

For Ages 8 and up.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pickin' Chickens
description:
In Pickin' Chickens players try to be the first to get their trolley to the chicken as it lays an egg and then return the egg to their frying pan.

The game features a chicken that squawks and moves. When the chicken stands players can roll their trolleys down a rail (by pushing forwards their frying pans which are attached to the rail, thus lifting it up). The first trolley to the chicken while it is still standing will get an egg ( a plastic ball) and will then need to be rolled back to the frying pan (by moving the frying pan back).
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Farming, Humor, Real-time

name: Junior Dingbats
description: Junior Dingbats incorporates all of the elements of the traditional board game which has had a make over to appeal to older children. Each Dingbat is a familiar phrase or saying that is turned around, upside down, inside out or jumbled up. Each player must work out the hidden message to win the race to the finish.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Flashback
description:
Flashback is a trivia game centered around television programs. The format is very straight forward - the active player or team is told which show the question is about. A level of difficulty is then selected by the answering team. The harder the question, the more spaces that will be advanced on a correct answer or backwards on an incorrect answer. First player to the finish line (twenty spaces away) is the winner.

Programs include:
A Different World, Facts of Life, Growing Pains, Happy Days, Simpsons, Seinfeld, and many other Sitcoms.

name: Kapu
description:
"KAPU is the story of Hawaii fashioned into pictures -- turned into a game for your pleasure. For many who have been to the isles, nostalgic memories will come; for many more, an entry will be made to the Paradise of the Pacific."

Kapu has a deck of 48 cards and score sheets provided in a simple black box. I am assuming that "F. D. Lang" is the designer, since that is the name on the copyright.

The game is called "A Picture Story of Hawaii," and it is a matching game of making sets of cards. The cards are printed in full color, and they are all different. Many have point values of II, V, X, and XX (Roman numerals), but those are the only letters on the cards.

Kapu (kah-poo) means "take" or "possess," and players try to "kapu" cards to make sets of the 12 "hales" (suits) or the 8 "huis" (clubs, as in groups).

The game is quite simple and somehow elegantly attractive. Play requires reference to the chart of matching cards provided, in a fashion something like Mah Jongg.

name: Franklin Goes to School: The Game
description: Franklin Goes To School The Game is a delightful journey with Franklin and his friends that makes learning fun. Spin the spinner and race along Franklin's footprints through Mr. Owl's classroom. Land on a report card and either leap ahead or go back. The game affirms basic values and helps children learn to solve a variety of challenging school-related questions.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Don't Monkey Around
description:
User Summary

Don't Monkey Around is a tactile children's game involving the balancing of coloured monkeys onto a small tree which stands in the midst of the players. It is suitable for simple and repetitive play, so consecutive plays are encouraged by design. Players take turns hooking their own colour of monkeys onto the tree or onto the already placed monkeys, taking care not to disrupt the tree so far as to spill one's own monkeys back onto the table. The player who can successfully balance all of his or her own colour of monkeys on the tree first is declared the winner!
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Ali Baba
description: An obvious precursor to Alex Randolph's later Ciao Ciao, this game sees players moving figures back and forth over a bridge. Each player has 3 wood figures in different sizes, an officer, a lady and a robber, and there's a special die numbered 0-3. Roll the die, move a figure forward, and if it meets another on the bridge, the robber holds up the lady, the lady slaps the officer and the officer nabs the robber, sending them back to the start. Figures can only make the other side with an exact roll.

name: Tintin et Milou dans le Monde
description:
Tintin e a volta ao mundo (Tintin around the world)

The objective of the game is to cover the circuit between Europe, Oceania and back, bringing back the Treasure of Rackham. The fastest player wins.

By drawing random cards from the deck each player can choose to move his pawn (Tintin), place an obstacle (a bone or a bottle of old rum) or retrieve an obstacle from his way. If the old rum obstacle his placed the player who has it in his lane can only move back to the nearest continent, where he can choose another circuit lane.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Círculo de Leitores, Les Jeux Noël Montbrison, Publica/Hergé

name: Pro Football
description: Simple American Football game using spinners to determine the types of plays and reactions. Very random game-play with little strategy. Not to be confused with 3M's 1966 game of the same title or the 1969 Chapman Pro Football.

name: Death to the Soviet!: The First Battle for Panjshir Valley, August 1981
description:
Covers the first of seven battles between Soviet troops and guerrilla fighters in this part of Afghanistan.

Contains one 11"x17" color map and over 160 counters.

name: Delta
description: Each player gets 8 'deltas'. Object of the game is to place two of your deltas in the opponent's colored base square. Pieces move along their longest side without jumping, or can flip on any edge or the corner opposite the longest side. Capturing occurs when one piece forms a square with the opposing color.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: The Partridge Family
description: This is a simple childrens track game based on the 1970's TV show. The track spirals around the board and ends at the Partridge Family bus. Players roll dice for movement. If a player lands on a space with a partridge picture he/she draws a card and follows the instructions (go ahead 6, go back 3, lose turn etc.) The first player to reach the bus wins.

name: Stoppa pressarna!
description:
In Stoppa pressarna! you create newspaper headlines and then vote for the best one each turn (without knowing who wrote what).

The headlines to write are restricted by two decks of cards. One card from the first deck determines how many words should be in the headline and what the general subject should be (politics, celebrity gossip, scoop, sports, international, etc). The second deck determines what letters should be used.

name: Wings: The Air Mail Game
description:
This old game from Parker Brothers has mechanics similar to Touring, which is about 25 years older. Lindy, the New Flying Game was a straightforward re-theme of Touring to airplanes delivering airmail. Wings is more of a twist since it has 2 decks of cards--a red deck of Mail Cards, and a blue deck of Delay/Release cards. The Mail cards each depict a city on the players routes. These cities are all numbered and must be played in the correct sequence. For example, #1 Boston must be played before #2 New York, which must be played before #3 Philadelphia and so on until reaching #12 San Francisco. Delay/Release cards either help or hinder the player, or his opponents.

Players are dealt 5 Mail Cards. A player starts his turn by drawing a Mail Card and playing as many cities in sequence as possible. He then draws cards to refill his hand and may play new cards drawn if they continue his city sequence. When he can no longer play red cards he draws 1 card from the blue deck and follows its instructions. These range from High Speed Cards which allow him an extra turn, to Delay Cards which he plays on an opponent; the opponent must play a Release Card before he can add to his city sequence.

The first player to deliver the mail to San Francisco finishes his route and wins.

The plane with registration number N-X-211 pictured on the cards was Charles Lindberg's plane The Spirit of St. Louis. Linderberg did fly for the air mail Service, but not in the The Spirit of St. Louis. The plane was also never marked with "Air Mail" on the tail.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Racing, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Wrath of the Ancients
description:
from the designer's web page (this is a free download)

"Modernia" The greatest civilization this world has ever known, and they owe it all to you! You are one of the ancient (and Petty) gods who first brought gifts to the mortals. But the people of Modernia turned their backs on you. They don't believe in you any more ... They don't worship you anymore ... THEY DON'T PLEASE YOU ANYMORE! Use all of your divine powers, the proper timing, and a little luck from the Fates to forever DOOM this civilization ... just as you have so many ungrateful civilizations before it!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Schnitzeljagd
description:
From the game rules:

"Today a treasure hunt is taking place at the camp. Of course all of the groups want to cross the finishing line first. So they need to split up in order to be quicker. Sometimes they even have to help others to move faster, although they might not want to."

Listed on the box for ages 10+, this is a no-luck race game, where your movement is based on it's position in the race.

Shorter faster version of Das glorreiche Manöver

name: Laoupala
description:
Everyone plays simultaneously. To start a round, 6 cards are drawn and placed in the middle of the table. Each card describes a precise characteristic ("palatable", "weighs more than 10 kilos", "can be reached by throwing this card", "floats"...).
The goal is to find as quickly as possible an object or a living organism corresponding to these characteristics that is visible to all people without leaving the chair.

name: Cat in the Hat-opoly
description:
Another monopoly-inspired game. Colorful, fun-looking board with game pieces depicting the Cat in the Hat, Sallie, Nevins, the Fish, Conrad, Thing 1&2.

"Fun in a box" and "Cat's Hat" replace houses and hotels. Start on "All the fun you want" (ie. this version's "GO").

Again, this is a very nice looking board, and those who have a fondness for Seuss' characters (or kids' storybook characters in general) will probably really enjoy this game.

Game makes references to movie tie-in.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Fische füttern
description:
A light-hearted wooden set collection game for the younger set.

Four colourful fish wait happily in their aquarium tank to be fed. To get lots of food for their own fish, the players carefully shake the food can and arrange the coloured food pieces according to the right cards. A light-hearted set collection game for the very young, who can learn fine motor skills as well as colours. Wooden playing pieces!

name: NBA Interactive TV Card Game
description: This card game is intended to be played while watching a televised basketball contest. Each player is dealt a hand of seven cards, each with a basketball "event" such as slam dunk, blocked shot, free throw, and rebound. When a player has a card that matches the event that just occurred on the televised game, they must be the first to play it, thereby scoring the points on the card for that event (the rarer the event the more points). When a player plays all seven of their cards, he gets a seven point bonus, everyone tallies their scores and a new hand is dealt. Play continues until the end of the game and the player with the most points from completed rounds is the winner.

name: Maisy Game
description: Players spin to claim the objects that match their playing board. The first to get all 7 is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Saga
description:
From the box:

"Stimulating and absorbing, SAGA is an exciting chase through our Island's wonderful story and its fascinating legends".

The "islands" in this case being the British Isles.

The game comprises:

A board consisting of an outer circle and an inner spiral.
6 Playing Pieces
Pack of 36 SAGA cards (6 sets of 6 cards - each showing the date and details of a significant event in British history)
Pack of 16 BLACK SPOT cards (also showing other events in British history)
Dice
SAGA Bonds (money)

Traveling around the outside circle of the board each player has to try and collect five SAGA cards, each of a different color. As each card is collected the player claims its cash value from the Exchequer (Bank).

When the cash and five cards have been amassed, the player then moves to the center spiral and races towards the finish. Each time a player lands on a Black Spot he must pay the penalty as shown on a BLACK SPOT card.

The winner is the first player to reach the finish without going bankrupt. Bankrupt players still have a chance to win - by going back to the start and beginning the journey through history again.

name: Economy Class
description:
From the Invisible City Productions website:

An air travel-themed game of strategy and luck for 2-3 players

Object: To successfully Board your connecting flight before your opponents can board theirs.

Using coins for movement, each player tries to complete all the Goals on his List and then to get to his Departure Gate. However, Transferable and Non-Transferable Events may get in your way...

The first player to move onto their Departure Gate Square with no Goals remaining on their List successfully Boards, and wins the game.

Download here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/105/economy-class

name: Discovery of India
description:
DISCOVERY OF INDIA, is a, presumably Indian, educational boardgame based for 2 to 4 players Ages 8 and up. It is published in English.

Players move their playing pieces around the board which is a pictorial representation of the country of India. The country is divided into 25 states, each further divided into a number of territories. Pieces are able to move move from territory to any adjacent territory, whether belonging to the same state or not.

As soon as a player visits a state for the first time he/she collects a token card for that state - the ultimate aim of the game being to visit all 25 states. There is no requirement to go to more than one territory in each state though the geography of the board (and the country for that matter) will require players to pass through a large number of territories in order to visit all 25 states.

Each state has a set of quiz cards associated with it. When a player moves into a new territory he/she is asked a question pertaining to the state in which the territory is located. If the question is answered correctly the territory is "conquered" and a marker placed on the board to denote which player "owns" that territory. Ownership of a territory means that other players that wish to pass through it must successfully answer a quiz card question in order to progress further. This forces players to plan their routes carefully in order to work their way around territories owned by the other players, or gamble on whether they might know the answer to a question they may be asked.

The player that is the first to visit all 25 states, thereby collecting 25 token cards, is the winner.
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Leaping Lilypads
description:
From the manufacturer:

Watch out for Sammy Snake as players hop their way across
Lily Lake. Colorful frog playing pieces add to the frenzy of this game, along with fun frog facts in the game guide. Strategy and counting skills are key with an element of risk for older players.

Parents' Choice Award Winner 2000

name: Thingamajig
description:
From the box:

THINGAMAJIG is the ... ooh ... err ... umm ... the game of wots-it-calleds!

It's a bit like "Snap" but lots more fun!

For every matching pair you race to call out something to do with your opponents ... before they beat you to it!

Watch out! You'll need the reactions of a thingy ... the speed of a wotsit ... the memory of an oojama?!

Just when you think you know who's who ... everyone changes roles and you're flummoxed again"

THINGAMAJIG is a fast moving memory game for 3 or more players. It is a race to win cards by naming something from your opponent's "category" before they can call out something from yours. Categories are decided by the players by selecting from a list comprising the following themes "Things found in..., Things made of ... , Things sold in a ... , Things that have ... ".

The winner is the player with the most cards in his hand when the first player loses all of their cards.

name: Caesars Palace Casino
description: Caesars Palace Casino whisks you through a casino whirlwind. A game of games that will test your skills and luck with 5 card-poker, blackjack, slots, roulette and dice. The game features a gameboard with different gambling games at different spots on the board. When someone lands on a particular spot, say Blackjack, then everyone must stop moving and play a round of Blackjack. Likewise land on Craps and everyone must drop everything and play dice. The game features a Gameboard, 6 pawns, 2 playing dice, 3 special slot dice, 49 custom chips, an official deck of cards, a roulette spinner, two score pads and the game rules.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dragon Booster Trading Card Game
description:
A CCG based on racing and fighting dragons.

From the website:

Dragon City is a place where the different colors of dragon are bred for sport, profit and industrial use. Different colors of draconium are purified and machined into various forms of gear and accessories designed to enhance dragon power. Dragon City is the place where the power struggles of the planet are played out on the vast Elite Class racing tracks. Here, mighty racers like modern day gladiators battle in 200 mile-per-hour competitions using glowing draconium gear and dragon energy in fierce hand to hand and dragon versus dragon struggles. In the deeper parts of the city, teens race and battle on the All City Racing Circuit hoping for a shot at the big time. Below in the depths, in a place called Squire’s End, dangerous Down City Crews wait, like street gangs, trying to fight their way up, not realizing that they are the remnants of the original empires that caused the first dragon-human war.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Kubla's Gambol
description:
In Kubla's Gambol, both players start with one set of KublaCards and play them alternately next to one of the KublaCoins. When all cards have been played, the player with the higher total power next to it controls the coin. The player with the higher total value of controlled coins wins the game.

This was given to attendees of KublaCon 2005.

name: Where Art Thou?
description:
An artistic twist on four classic games: use these full-color cards depicting details of thirty-six paintings from eleven American museums, along with the accompanying fold-out game sheet 10"x25" printed with full black and white painting of each detail shown in the 36 pairs of cards, to play concentration, bingo, trivia, mix-and-match/parent and child, and other variations.

For two or more players; Ages 3 and up.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Trivia

name: Ice Market
description:
A real-time trading game for three or more players and an Icehouse set.

"Deep under the frigid crust of the ice-moon Europa, a new fad has emerged. All of the truly fashionable Jovain dolphins are wearing exotic crystals from the underside of the frozen crust of the outer oceans.

"Equipped with the latest tips and rumors about what's cool and what's not, you've brought your refrigerated collection of ice crystals to the EIEIO (Eurpoa Ice Exchange Independent Organization). You've managed to finagle your way into a five-minute trade session with a few other hobbyist traders. Competition is fierce, and there's a lot about the market that you're not sure of, but with your bartering skills and Luck willing, you hope to come out on top."

Object: To end the game with the most valuable collection of ice crystals.

You Need:

* A poker deck
* An Icehouse set
* Paper and pencil for each player, or an Ice Market trader's tally sheet
* A 5-minute timer

Players in Ice Market do not take turns. Once the 5-minute timer starts, swap and trade for all you're worth until the timer stops. You may swap anything that you possess: cards, pieces, information, etc. Your goal is to end the game with the pieces worth the most points.

The player with the most points wins. If there is a tie for points, the player with the most pieces wins. Further ties are shared victories.

Download the rules here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/95/ice-market

name: Sibling Rivalry
description:
Sibling Rivalry is a commissioned game from Richard Garfield for the game design textbook "Rules of Play", by Katie Salen and Eric Zimmerman.

Players are siblings trying to annoy each other. The game is played on two boards: the challenge board and the score track. By advancing a marker on the challenge board, you can score points on the score track. The first player to reach the end of the score track wins.

The heart of the game is a "push your luck" dice mechanism to advance on the challenge board. A player begins by rolling five dice, setting aside ones. Other numbers can be used to advance a pawn along one of five columns, representing Looks, Faces, Tickles, Ouchies, and Teases. After each roll, you can either stop or keep rolling. If you stop and your pawn is the most advanced pawn in that column, then you remove any pawn it passed. If it is not the most advanced, then you remove your pawn from the challenge board. If your pawn has not been removed from the board by your next turn, then you score points for it on the score track.

You can keep rolling dice to advance your pawn farther up the challenge board, but when you accumulate three or more ones, your parents have caught you picking on your sibling. Your turn ends and you lose points.

name: Grasshoppers
description:
Similar to the tiddledy-winks styled Frog Game [19456], Grasshoppers is a light dexterity game produced by Early Learning Centre for young children age 3 and up.

The game is played with small brightly coloured plastic grasshoppers, which are flipped vertically with your index finger into a circular scoring container. The object of the game is to flip your grasshoppers into the container, gaining bonus points if the grasshopper lands in the small circular compartment in the middle of the container. There are four colours of grasshoppers: red, yellow, green, and blue.

name: Eco-Force: Guardians of Earth – Birds of North America
description:
Eco-Force: Guardians of Earth (tm) card games allow 2-4 players to manage their eco-system by adding habitats and animals worth points during their turn.

Impact cards in the deck may allow other players to cause reduction in another players eco-system during play and thus reduce their total points. Defense cards are also in play and can reduce or block other players from harming your eco-system.

At the end of the pre-determined number of rounds, the player with the most points wins the game. And keep an eye out for that Special Migration....

name: Shareword: The Bible Society Game
description:
Shareword is an Exciting game Based on the worldwide work of the United Bible Societies.
The aim of the game is to do what the Bible Societies do - translate, produce and distribute Scriptures in many of the world's languages.
The Winner of the game is the first player to supply the 'Scriptures' to the people in their own languages, by completing all of His/Hers Projects
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Foto Yu
description: A game in which you travel across the republics of former Yugoslavia and take photographs of beautiful landscapes and historical monuments. Player who takes the most photos is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der verrückte Räuber
description:
Description from publisher's site translated by Babelfish (with some editing):

"A crazy robber was seen fleeing into the woods. The players must find him and return the loot he stole. But this is not so easy, because the robber is difficult to locate in the woods. The player, who sights the crazy robber most frequently and recovers the most loot wins."

name: Dudeln
description:
A spin on the lexicon-game: The game has cards with a word on it as well as three possible meanings (one is real). The player in charge reads the word, the meanings and makes up one more meaning. The other players are guessing the right meaning. If they guess right, they get a point. If not, then not. If they guess the made-up the reader get one point.

Came in the short-lived "Travel Fun-Boxes"-Series

Online Play


BrettspielWelt (real-time)
categories: Bluffing, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Steamy Scenarios
description: The ultimate game of "What If?" Includes game board, 104 game cards, 8 game pieces, answer pad, 8 pencils and rule sheet. For 4 or more players.

name: Trendsetters
description:
Can You Predict the Trends of Your Friends?

Here’s a party game that tests your ability to stay with The Mainstream. Players use their voting wheels to register secret votes on poll questions. The object is to select the most popular choice and stay in The Mainstream. After revealing their answers, players who are not in The Mainstream get a strike. First player to register 5 strikes on his or her scoring wheel pays a penalty for being Passé. The group chooses a penalty before play begins, such as clucking like a chicken or singing “I Write the Songs” by Barry Manilow.)

name: Alpha Strike
description:
Incoming Fire... Evasive Action!

Divert Power to shields and Launch Fighters!

Alpha Strike is a fast paced card game of tactical combat in deep space. Players take on the role of starship captains, managing power levels to keep their ship combat ready while utilizing their ships capabilities to defend themselves and unleash devastating attacks upon their opponents.

Alpha Strike comes complete with everything needed to play including starship control panels, a Combat Deck, Markers, and rules for two player duels and multi-player battles.

name: Sentence Says Dice Edition
description:
From the publisher's website:

Sentence Says Dice Edition is hilarious fun for the entire family to play at home or on the road! Draw an action card and read the sentence instruction. Now roll the letter dice to see what letters you will get to create your sentence. Hurry, the timer's running out! What will your sentence say? For the letters: F, L, S, I and P, how about "Frogs Like Singing In Ponds-" Opponents judge a winning sentence and can steal it if you're not careful! Educational benefits include: sentence structure, critical thinking, oral communication and quick-thinking exercises. For 2-4 players.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Pokkit Socca
description:
This game simulates a soccer game. It contains a soccer field of 21x23 space, 2 balls and 2 longish dice, the kicker die (labeled 2,4,5,6,8,LP) and the direction die (labeled with 4 directions & FOUL, TACKLE).

On a player's turn, the kicking die is thrown first. If it shows a number, the ball can be moved that many spaces. The direction is decided with the throw of the second die - if not a "Foul" or "Tackle" is thrown.

There are also some other ideas from real soccer present in Pokkit Socca: there are corners, throw ins and penalties.

Object of the game is to kick more goals than your opponent after a limited time, which must be fixed before the start.

name: Wiener Sammelsurium
description:
Description of the game from the Spielbox:

Wiener Sammelsurium is a humorous quiz game by Harald Havas and Ronald Hofstatter. Have you ever wanted to know how many kilograms of horse manure are dropped daily on the streets of Vienna, or how many pieces of mail are sent daily to the Alterlaa buildings, or how many children Maria Theresia had? Answers to these and many more everyday and historical questions about Vienna are offered by this board game. Lost of questions and answers to the interesting and strange, curious and macabre about Vienna were turned into a humorous board game by the authors.

name: The Horse Racing Game
description: Players spin a spinner to move their horses as they race to finish line.

name: Rescue From Planet Zero
description: Players move marbles around a three-dimensional board in an attempt to recollect the scattered pieces of a friendly alien's spaceship. The first player to collect all four spaceship parts and return to the cockpit is the winner. Along the way, players will show off their skills at basic math while searching such locations as a volcano, a ziggurat, and a gigantic skeleton.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Science Fiction
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Hostage: The Board Game
description:
THE CRISIS:
A world famous physicist, noted for discovering a new fuel source, has been kidnapped and is being held hostage in a remote jungle fortress somewhere near the equator. Intelligence sources believe the physicist will reveal the new fuel source to whomever liberates him.

THE MISSION:
As Chief of Intelligence for a world superpower, you control the movements of a special secret agent/army commando rescue team in a daring plot to liberate the physicist and return him to your home embassy. You must outwit and outmaneuver each of your opponents if your mission is to succeed. Careful planning is crucial to avoid setbacks along the way. A word of advice: keep your team together and above all, watch your back!
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Game of State Capitals
description:
Discs, each of which names one of the forty-eight state capitals, are dealt to the players. In turn, a spinner which indicates two of the states by number (the order in which they were added to the union, really) is spun. If the player has the state capital discs matching those states, the player must declare that fact to surrender the discs. Sometimes the spinner allows a player to surrender two discs.

Alaska and Hawaii were added to the game when those states entered the union.

The first player to place all one's state capitals in their proper places on the gameboard wins.

name: Monopoly: My American Idol Edition
description:
From the Publisher's website:

"America has voted...but you get to decide!"

American Idol fans can now set up the classic MONOPOLY game their way . Fans get to pick their favorite 22 Idols from the top contestants over the last 5 seasons and arrange them the way they want to on the MONOPOLY game board. Which Idol contestant will be on Boardwalk? Who will wind up on Marvin Gardens? Players get to pick and choose from over 50 talented Idol finalists. Idols appear in full, four color photography on removable and reusable static cling labels so, if fans choose, they play a different game every time! Includes six collectible tokens: Microphone, American Idol Contestant, American Idol Logo, TV, Cell Phone and American Idol Star

Let's hear it Dawg Pound!

Create it…Play it…
Own it All…YOUR way!
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: FedEx
description: Collect FedEx offices around the world and improve them with Drop Boxes and Service Centers in this FedEx themed Monopoly. Comes with 6 tokens: FedEx Trade Networks Ocean Liner, FedEx Express Airplane, FedEx Custom Critical Truck, FedEx Home Delivery Dog, FedEx Freight Truck, and FedEx Ground Van.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Burgfried
description:
Burgfried (Keep) puts one player in the role of defending a castle. The other one has to lay siege on it and capture the castle's keep. The game is mainly card based which mostly depict soldiers, siege machines and counter-measures for them. Soldiers can be used by both sides, while siege machines and counter-measures are obviously only useful for the attacker and defender respectively.
Gameplay is supported by a simple plan that shows the castle and the status (ok/destroyed) of its parts. The keep is the innermost part, so the attacker has to destroy several parts (e.g. moat, walls) before he can land the final blow. For each part a special action card and siege machine is needed. There is also a mechanism for starving the defender out.
After a game is won (attacker: starving out the defender or destroying the keep, defender: holding out for four weeks), roles switch.
The game was originally planned to be extensible, but I've never seen one. The main game is subtitled "Basis-Set: Ritter" (base set: knights).

name: Tour of New Zealand
description:
Each player strives to be the first to complete a tour of New Zealand, visiting many towns and cities along the way.

Rules:
1. Each player takes a separate counter and by casting the dice in turn, determines how many spaces he or she will move.
2. The players will follow the instructions printed on the squares on which they land.
3. Should a player land on a square occupied by another player he or she will return to the nearest town.
4. Should a player throw a six, another turn will be taken.
5. A player must cast the exact score to finish the game.
6. The first player to complete the tour is the winner.

name: Medellin
description:
This game is a wargame published by the French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 13 - Feb 1983).
The game covers the Medellin battle (28 march 1809) opposing French and Spanish troops.

name: Pisa
description:
The game consists of a base with eight large plastic tower sections which are built up into a leaning tower. Each tower segment has 16 columns molded on the side and these are aligned before the game starts.

The simplest game consists of rolling two dice to find the tower segment to be rotated and how many columns it is to be rotated, either clockwise or counter-clockwise. The player who causes the tower to collapse loses the game.

In the more advanced version, players may choose which tower segment to rotate and by how much - between 1 and 3 columns - and the player scores 1 point for each column rotation.

In the final version of the game, players chose a tower element for the player on the left to use and all players are involved in constructing the tower before rotation begins.

(Note: The English language rules don't state that you cannot reverse the last move made. This is compulsory to make the game playable. For the simplest game, if the same tower segment is chosen, then it must be rotated in the same direction as the last move. Alternately, you can use a House Rule that states that the towers can only be rotated clockwise.)
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Paartie
description:
Paartie - Plauderspiel für Partner is a cardgame for adults. Players use cards to try and gain gems. You win gems by knowing what your partner thinks, feels, wants. A game for relationships.

Ages 18 and up. Released: Essen 2007.

name: 1,000 Drinking Games
description:
1,000 Drinking Games combines rounds of classic and new drinking games with off-the-wall plot twists and a variety of drink assignments. This set includes all of the popular drinking concepts: dice games, card games, word games, tongue twisters, spinner games, categories, ranking-based games, etc. Players can enjoy their favorite games over and over or learn a new game each time they play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Mature / Adult

name: Animality
description:
Guide a species from the earliest beginnings to the height of the evolutionary ladder.

Brief Description:

Players begin with their animal only having a single body part, such as a torso, and must evolve to gain additional appendages and abilities.

Each species has a set of stats that will increase as the game progresses and they gain new abilities (such as Predator).

Each player begins with a single adult of their species. You have a limited number of actions to split between hunting for food, birthing new offspring, changing the current environment, or claiming an effect tile which will give their species a new ability once they can afford to put the tile into play.

If a player's species is strong enough they can also attack one of the other players and try to slow their progress.

Whichever species has evolved the most by the end of the game wins.

name: Zig Zag
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to move both your pieces from the bottom row to the top row of the board by alternate throws of the dice.
If you are lucky enough to land on a space your opponent already occupies your opponents peice is sent back to the start.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Affengeil
description:
Each player has five lives (bananas).

The first player rolls two dice and say a number. The highest number is always the first. For example: 4 and 5 is 54. The next throws are possible: 31 (lowest), 32, 41, 42, 43, 51, 52, 53, 54, 61, 62, 63, 64, 65, doubles 11, 22, 33, 44, 55, 66 and finally 21 (best throw). Whatever you say, the next player must throw a higher number than you said. You can bluff, and tell a smaller or a higher number. The next player must decide if he believes you or not. If you believe the number, you roll the dice again and gives a higher number. If you say that the player is bluffing, the bluffer must show the dice. If you're right loses the bluffer a banana. If the throw was right, you lose yourself a banana.
When a player said 21, the next player decides if he believes the throw or not. Believing does mean not to look the dice and you lose 1 banana. Are you saying that the thrower is bluffing, then check out the dice. The loser pays 2 bananas.

If during the game you shake the dice and you don’t like the throw, you can shake you again. You may not look that throw and you must give it blind to the other player; and you must say a higher number.
The player can also say "more than enough". If the dice shows a higher number, you can call a low throw. So the next player has the chance to say a higher number without looking at the dice. The poker cup goes quickly around the table, but it could be a bluff.

The winner is the player who’s left with one or more bananas.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck
publishers: MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Money! Money!
description:
From Box:
"Build your knowledge of money, how to earn it, and how to spend it in this exciting game!"

Players advance on the board by rolling a die. Generally at each space the player earns the indicated amount of money, but before collecting, must spin the arrow which often excludes a coin denomination from the payout. The player then takes the earned money from the bank honouring the exclusion. Some special spaces provide a cash windfall or the ability to earn additional money by exchanging coins for higher denomination coins. Game ends when a player reaches the Finish space and winner is player with the most money.

Educational game aimed at developing children's knowledge of coin money and their ability to perform basic addition.

Canadian version has $1 'Loonie' coins in place of $1 bills.

name: Monopoly: Trier
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Trier, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Championship Sumo Wrestling
description:
Championship Sumo Wrestling is a short, simple game simulating Japanese wrestling. Sumo wrestling is a sport in which the object is to either force your opponent out of a circular ring or to force him to touch the floor with any part of his body except his feet. Action is fast and furious, and typical bouts seldom last more than thirty seconds. A good way to play is for each player to generate several wrestlers and fight a series of bouts at one sitting.

Each player rolls a six-sided die for each of five characteristics- Speed, Agility, Strength, Weight, and Balance- to generate their character. When battling an opponent, certain stats are cross-referenced with any of 8 wrestling moves: Charge, Attack, Step Aside, Slap, Lever, Lift, Push, and Pull, in order to determine a result.

The game was included in issue #64 of Dragon Magazine.

name: Supermind
description: This is an absorbing game where players strategically place their pawns upon a circular playing board where placing holes are joined by a web of lines. Depending upon where pegs are placed, depends much on where a player already has pegs in that line of direction, because, on their subsequent turn on placing another peg in that same line will then be able to 'expel' the opponent's peg from the board! The web of lines and number of pegs in play at any one time helps confuse issues that inevitably leads to increased concentration, and the players subsequently taking the game far more seriously!

name: Adventures of Riley: Penguin Rescue
description:
From the publisher's website:

"Get ready to travel across Antarctica with Riley and his family as you race to rescue five penguins in danger and return them home safely! Packed with informative facts, twists and turns, Penguin Rescue is based on the award-winning book Adventures of Riley: South Pole Penguins."

On a player's turn, two dice with colored faces are thrown. The player may elect to resolve the dice in either order, which offers one of the minor strategy points in the game. One side of the die says WILD which allows a card to be drawn which immediately has an effect on the player (move back, move ahead etc).

Be the first to collect a full set of the five colored penguins and return to home to win.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Små kloka barn på bokstavsjakt
description: Find the letters needed to complete the words on your game board. Only problem is, the ABC-thief has taken all the letters. Fortunately there is a hole in his bag and all the letters are scattered on the streets of the city. The first one to find all the letters for the words on the game board wins and is honoured with a song by the other players.

name: Monopoly: Bretagne
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the region of Bretagne, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Touraine
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Touraine region, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Stora Bostadsspelet
description:
The players start with a one-room apartment each which they will renovate, improve and sell when the market is at its best.

The players will continue doing this until they have enough money to buy their dream apartment and win the game.

name: Jogo da Bol$a
description:
Jogo da Bol$a is a game about stock market investment, based in buy and sell actions of four sectors (mineration, electricity, petroleum and telephony) you need make the best with your money.
The high and low of the stock market is decided for cards.
The game was produced like a tool to teach the public how to work the stock market and for the variations that might occue.

www.jogodabolsa.com.br
http://www.oficinadainovacao.com.br/

name: Kopfsalat
description:
A german quiz game.
There are five different disciplines, so the game enfolds a mixture of luck communication, trivia and luck.

name: Theories: it's a game
description:
Theories are old, theories are new,
Theories abound, they’re all around you.

Theories is also a fun-filled game to play with your family and friends

* Easy to learn
* All players are involved on every turn
* Lots of interaction and laughter
* Fun to play

More than 450 questions and answers based on weird, wacky, scientific and humourous theories through the ages will keep you entertained and enlightened.

Just use your knowledge and problem-solving skills to select the right theory, and your intuition (and poker skills) to decide when to bluff and when to call a bluff.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Stop Thief!
description:
Object: To capture 5 robbers from the other players.

A simple movement game for children. Each turn they move their policeman to try to catch a robber, and then move their robber onto the space just vacated by the policeman.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Suomi Tietopeli Matkaversio
description: The game includes a total of 600 Finland concerning questions! By responding to the questions you tick off the pyramid in your subject areas. You be the first to check off 5 circles, you are a winner!

name: Get out!
description:
Object of the game:
To be the first player to get rid of all cards.

How to play:

1. Shuffle the cards and deal 6 to each player.Place the remaining cards face down as a "draw" pile, within reach of all players for use throughout the game.

2. Elect a player to start

3. Player 1 starts by placing any one of their cards face up beside the "draw" pile as a "Call card". Cards placed on top of his in turn become the call card.

4. The game continues in a clockwise direction with each placing one card from their hand onto the call card pile. The card played must be:
(a) a card of any number but the same image as the call card OR
(b) a card of any image but the same number as the call card
OR
(c) a GET OUT! card which can be played as any image

5. If a player cannot play a card onto the call card pile they must take the top card from the draw pile and add it ti their hand. That player's turn ends on drawing a card - they cannot play it on the same turn.

6. GET OUT! cards can be played by any player, on their turn, on to any call card. The player may then declare the image to be represented by their GET OUT! card which dictates the next card to follow. The player may choose an image that will help himself or hinder their opponent. One GET OUT! card can be played on top of another GET OUT! card - to cancel a previous call or to keep it the same.

7. Players do not have to play a card even if they are able to, but they must pick up a card from the draw pile. This might happen when player is playing defensively.

8. If draw pile runs out, the last call card is left face up in the center of play and the rest of the cards are placed face down (without shuffling) and the game proceeds as before.

9. The game ends when one player runs out of cards - who is declared the winner.

Play of GET OUT! may be extended by continuing as follows:

10. When one player runs out of cards, all other players add uo the total value of the cards in their hands. GET OUT! cards count as 20 points.

11. Write the scores down by player on the sheet of paper.

12. The player who wins the round deals for the next game and play continues round by round. The scores are accumulated after each round.

13. If any player passes a total of, say, 100 points they are out.

14. the game ends when only one player is left - the overall winner.

Content:
3 rule cards
12 Geoff Tipps (Square) (values 1,2,3,4,5,7,8,10,11,12,13,14)
12 Samantha Tipps (Pentagon)
12 Kevin Tipps (Diamond)
12 Shirley Tipps (Octagon)
7 The Tea Picer (Oval) (count double when scoring)
3 GET OUT! cards
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: But
