description: French soccer game. Players can either play 1 Vs 1 or in two teams of two players each. The board consists of a football field with small squares on it. Each team has a set of 11 players (one set is in blue, the other in red). The players simulate a soccer match and try to score more goals as the other team.

name: Jostle
description: Jostle is a combinatorial game (i.e. two player, perfect info, etc.), which uses a 10x10 square grid, 16 red checkers and 16 blue checkers, as shown in the figure. On your turn you move one of your checkers to an unoccupied, orthogonally adjacent square, subject to the following. The value of a checker is its number of friendly orthogonal adjacencies minus its number of enemy orthogonal adjacencies. You can only move a checker when you increase the moved checker's value. The last player to move wins. I.e. if you don't have a move on your turn, you lose.

name: Get H2O
description:
Geth20 Game is a new ’serious’ mobile game about Peace Building. It is specifically developed for Kenyan youth, to enhance understanding of the basic dynamics of conflict, conflict escalation, the role of the community and the role of individuals in preventing conflict and promoting peace.

Game scenario
You find yourself in the slums of Nairobi, your aim is to survive and build houses for you and your extended family. You have to build a certain amount of houses per level to win the game. Remember to keep the community bar in the green too! otherwise you still can’t win. Drought, crime and corruption are rife.

name: Spider-Man
description:
From the Publishers website:
When Peter Parker, bitten by radioactive spider, he received a spider's relative speed, force and movement. He became Spider-Man.
Such amazing talents like to hang the web and climb the walls, he used to fight against crime.
Now Spider-Man is in danger of losing his power to his secret enemies. The radioactive spider has disappeared from his dark secret laboratory.
Now all the Spider-Man disguised enemies are terrorizing the New York. They all are now more dangerous than ever, because now they hold the key to Spider-Mans power.
The only way to cope with precarious situation and restore order to New York is to find the radioactive spider and take it to security, a secret laboratory.
Your task is not easy, because all the players will try to find the missing spider.
During the game you need to survive action events and traps, you also have to fight against other players. Who is the right and true Spider-Man? It will not become clear until the very end of the game. Right Spider-Man is the one who succeeds in bringing the radioactive spider back to the laboratory.

Content: Board
1 dice
1 Spider-Man spinner
6 Spider-Man character (pawn)
6 colored tripod pawns
5 reels
sticker sheet with 5 stickers
50 cards (14 Syndicate Cards, 12 Surprise Cards, 24 Accessory Cards)
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Terra Ventura
description:
A great explorer, you want to discover unknown, mysterious lands! Speed and observation skills will help you to reach new natural habitats and glimpse the extraordinary cultural diversity of the peoples of the Earth.
Game Objective: Study the card closely and be the first to find the coordinates of the next place you’re looking for. The “action” dice will guide you to get to the spot, but sometimes it’s a bit ... acrobatic! If you are curious and open-minded, the wonders of the planet will be yours, and the locals will welcome you and you win the round!
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Cars 2 World GP
description:
From the publisher:
In this exhilarating new game, players get to race with the cars from the Disney film Cars 2. In two different GP's, the players drive as fast and skilfully as possible to ensure the best possible result at the finishing line. The aim of the game is to win as many points as possible - a race winner will receive more points than his competitors. After two races, the player with the most poinst wins the World Cup!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: La Boîte à énigmes  spéciale police scientifique
description:
Another version of the La Boîte à énigmes.
Twenty-five murder mysteries in three levels of difficulty. The game master becomes aware of the full puzzle with its solution, and then reads the beginning of the investigation to the players. These can then ask questions that will be answered by yes or no. The gamemaster can help players by giving up three indices.

name: Monopoly: Cork Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Cork, in Ireland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Bacchus' Banquet: Bad Gas
description:
If you are given poison, you may choose to flip the bad gas token. If the token lands blank side up, there is no effect, and play proceeds as usual.

If it lands bad gas side up, immediately move your belt down one notch. Additionally, neighboring players might be affected by your gas.

The player to your left and the player to your right must check to see if they are affected! They each flip the bad gas token. If their flip lands gas side up, then they are forced to purge and immediately move their belt down one notch.

If both your left and right neighbors purged, you are sickened by their acts and must move your belt up by the same number of spaces as the poison you originally received.

name: Game Drive
description:
From website:

Board your safari truck for an adventure through Southern Africa to save Africa’s Big Five animals!

As a conservationist working in Southern Africa, you’ll travel to five major Reserves, sighting and researching famous wild animals known as the Big Five: the rhino, leopard, lion, elephant and buffalo.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Zombie Solitaire
description:
Zombie Solitaire is like regular Klondike solitaire with one big difference: you get to save survivors and destroy Zombies!!!

Components:
Zombie Solitaire requires [2] decks of regular playing cards (including one “joker”), One deck will be used for the [52] cards and [1] joker. The other deck will supply the [7] zombies "the logo side of the cards" and four sets of A thru 6 for the [4] ammo boxes with 6 shots each.

You could use 4d6 instead of the four sets of A thru 6 for the ammo.

COMPONENTS:
Two normal decks of cards
• [1] 52 card deck for basic game play.
• [1] Joker, which represents you!
• [1] second 52 CARD deck, from which 31 cards are needed. These cards represent zombies that must be destroyed and ammo for your gun.
• [4] six-sided dice, representing a supply of ammunition for your gun

Zombie Solitaire can also be played using a specialized PnP version “Zombie deck”.
PnP cards
• [4] Ace: a Safe House
• [4] King: Grandpa – the only character willing to sacrifice himself for his family
• [4] Queen: Grandma
• [4] Jack: Dad
• [4] 10: Mom
• [4] 9: the children and their friends
• [4] 8: the children and their friends
• [4] 7: the children and their friends
• [4] 6: the children and their friends
• [4] 5: the children and their friends
• [4] 4: the children and their friends
• [4] 3: the children and their friends
• [4] 2: the children and their friends
• [1] Joker: You, the armed and dangerous hero
• [7] Zombies - Cards from the second deck (logo side only)
• 4D6 die: ammo box (6 rounds each)

Setup:
Zombie Solitaire is set up like regular “Klondike” solitaire with 7 stacks, four collection zones for aces, and a draw pile – all from a single deck of cards. In addition, 10 cards from a second deck are set, faced down, in a pile to the right of the 7 stacks. The joker is placed below the zombie pile, with the [4] dice off to the side.
• Draw pile: crowd of survivors from the zombie apocalypse
• 7 stacks: temporary shelters to which some of the survivors have fled and others may follow. Cards that are face-down are temporarily hidden from view; when they are turned over, they can be spotted by the zombies
• 10-card pile (from second deck): zombie horde
• Collection zones: areas in which safe houses may be established

Game Play:
The game is played like regular Klondike solitaire, with the usual options – moving cards from stack to stack, turning cards over when they become open, pulling the aces out and setting cards on top of them as appropriate – until the first card is drawn from the deck. That’s when the zombies finally arrive – and all bets are off!

In Zombie Solitaire, only one survivor card – the top card of the deck – is drawn each time.
Play the game as normal, but with the following adjustments:
• You do not have to play a survivor card that you have drawn from the draw pile even if you have an available play. It is always your choice whether or not to play a card.
• You cannot play a survivor card on top of a zombie card.
• You cannot move any card (or stack) that is under attack from a zombie and you cannot move any card (or stack) onto a stack that is under attack from a zombie – until the zombie is destroyed
• You do not come under attack for drawing an ace from the survivor draw pile (or from one of the stacks) and setting it up as a safe house and you do not come under attack for moving a survivor to a safe house.
• You can move a king (and its stack) to an empty space on the board without coming under attack as long as there is no zombie on the king's stack. But if you move a king from the draw pile to the board, it will come under attack .
You do not come under attack when a survivor moves from stack to stack.
When you draw the last card from the draw deck and flip the deck over, this causes a zombie to attack the oldest survivor at the bottom of a stack.

When a second zombie attacks a stack the lowest card on the stack is eaten but that survivor destroys both of the zombies.

Zombie threat:
Individual zombies are not a threat to the survivors. They are endangered only when two zombies attack at the same time. When a second zombie card is added to a temporary shelter stack, the bottom survivor card is removed from the game (where it will contribute no victory points to the player’s total). The attack will also destroy one of the zombies, whose card is returned to the zombie horde.

Victory:
The game is over when you no longer have any available moves, no kings to sacrifice and no ammunition. Count up the number of Safe Houses you established and the number of survivors who made it to a Safe House. You get [1] victory point for each.
A perfect score is 52.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Horror, Print & Play, Zombies

name: Jolly Roger
description:
Jolly Roger is a simple dice game containing six dice, each of them has the "1" replaced with the image of a Jolly Roger.

The goal is to capture the most cargo and score the most points. On his turn, a player rolls all dice and for each Jolly Roger rolled, he can "capture" one other die and score its points. The player may re-roll any dice two times. Should he come up with 5 Jolly Roger symbols, he scores no points this round.

After a given number of turns, points are tallied and the player with the highest score is the winner.

name: Assemblage of Eternity
description:
Assemblage of Eternity brings the competitive feel of fighting games to the traditional gaming arena, and much like its digital counterpart AOE is designed for 2-4 players in either 1v1, 2v2, Scramble, or Tag modes.

After selecting their favorite combatant, each player attempts to reduce his opponent's life to zero before going to time. The game is, at its foundation, a strong game of rock/paper/scissors with the advantage of being able to mitigate and reverse engineer your opponent's capabilities. Assemblage of Eternity is built to give players who know everything about the game a huge advantage and, like its counterpart, a slim chance at losing against an opponent who just pushes buttons.

Over the course of the game you'll find yourself learning your character, finding effective set-ups for their Ultras, and learning how to play them better. Some characters are harder to play than others, so the game includes set-ups, bios, and strategies to help new players, as well as suggested match-ups.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Humbug
description:
This 18th century game is about the simplest two-player adaptation of Whist that can be imagined.

This game uses a standard 52-card pack.

The dealer deals all the cards one at a time, turning the last card face up. The suit of this card, which belongs to the dealer, is the trump suit for the hand.

The Play
The aim is to win tricks. Each trick consists of two cards, one played by each player. The first player plays any card and the second player must play a card of the same suit if possible. In this case the higher card wins the trick.

When all the cards have been played, the player who won more tricks wins in proportion to the difference in tricks between the players - for example 8 units if the winner has 17 tricks and the loser 9.

name: War Skull
description:
War Skull brings the action of first-person shooters to a fast-pace board and card game!

A ominous entity called War Skull has transported players to a battle arena called zones. Each player must gather various weapons and equipment to defeat other opponents, until only one is left victorious.

Let the battle begin!

- - - -

The gameplay is fast, simple and easy to pick up.

There are 12 zones which is determined by a dice on every turn as well as drawing your card from a pile where you will gather weapons, shields and special items from each turn.

Each card has its limitation of attack and range, but if another player is within reach, that's where the fun begins.

Players will take turns and battle until only one is left standing.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die frechen Mäuse
description:
Cheese, sausage, bread and old stuff - everything is scattered in the attic. Each mouse tries to remove as much as possible to a safe place as stock. However, the cat is just silently lying in ambush; suddenly it appears between the mice, the mice quickly speed into their holes before they can start their next search again.

Who has collected the most points at the end wins this perky game as the cheekiest mouse.

name: Jožin z bažin
description:
A childrens' game based on the story/song of Joey the Swamp Thing. An auto-translated description:

"Coming clear and cold night, which is mainly for people from Prague campers around Vizovic very dangerous. Occur ideal conditions for Joey to come out of the dark swamp hunting. And for you, the hunter, comes the moment of truth. Attracted by the beauty of the chairman's daughter, the size of the local collective farm and a reward for the capture of Joey for a while and jumping into the fight, which is likely to lose. Jožinovy ​​ingenious traps and Jožin you handled yourself before you say love Cak. To the right you owl hooted and bog you down oval stale cold. One last question. It is the good love you for it ...? Jožin swamp - Exciting board game with unexpected propadáváním into the swamp. Try to catch Joey in the original game from Ivana Mladek. Přelstíte him? Can you avoid the sharp teeth while nezahučet in the swamp? Unique gaming principle, 3D game board and author Ivan Mládek guarantee that you will all be great fun. Contents: game board, 25 pieces (1 x Jožin, 3 x 8 color-coded hunters), 2 dice, instructions game is designed for 2-4 players from 5 years old. Made in the Czech Republic."

One player is the monster, and the rest are competing teams of hunters, who must avoid both being eaten by Joey, and sinking into the swamp. Some of the board spaces are holes which open and close with hidden gears that are turned.

name: Press Start Pocket: Series 2
description:
Press Start Pocket is a 2 player game deck of 56 cards.

Each deck (Series 1, Series 2, Series 3) is a stand-alone 2 player game. Two decks can be combined for a 3-4 player game, and 3 decks can be combined for a 5-6 player game. Combining decks also gives expanded capabilities for warriors.


Battle to win control of the pixel world.

Players start with a video game warrior and battle their opponent to take control of the video game universe.

There is no hiding, to win you have to battle.

Overview:

Both players get 7 cards and the rest of the cards are placed in 2 piles face down in the middle of the table.

Pile 1 is a warrior card pile

Pile 2 is an action card pile

The first player draws and action card then either attacks, plays a gather card to earn points toward another warrior or discards.

During a battle the players follow the attacks and counters rule according to the reference card.

To win a player must win 3 battles or earn 4 soldiers all alive at once.

Integrates with:


Press Start Pocket: Series 1
Press Start Pocket: Series 3

name: Flatterspatzen
description:
The birds are on the loose in Flatterspatzen, and you need to put the flock together!

Eight different birds fly on every playing card – four on each side — and players start with the same number of cards on the table before them. To start the game, one card is laid in the center of the table, then everyone tries to play out their cards at the same time starting from this single card, matching the birds as they go. Whoever first lays out all of her cards wins!

name: Mathe-monster
description: Players take turns revealing tiles showing numbers and mathematical operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) and score points for correctly solving the revealed equations. The first player to score four points wins.

name: Perfect Partners
description:
How well do you know your nearest and dearest? There's a dangerous myth that once you know all there is to know about your partner, that's all there is to know!

Perfect Partners is a humorous myth-shattering party game of love, friendship and blush, designed to test exactly how well you know your other half. Boys, do you know what her most embarrassing moment was? Girls, are you ready to admit whether you find his jokes funny?

Players split in teams, usually by couples. In turns, you draw one question card from the corresponding deck (boys or girls) and read out loud the question given by the die roll. Then, all partners write down what they guess their mates would answer before they actually do. Finally you go team by team answering the question and revealing if it matches what the partner has written. Be prepared to be open and honest and don't spare your blushes as it could win you valuable points.

If there is a match, you score the question. Simple yes-or-no questions score 1 point, multiple given choice score 2 points and open-answer questions score 3 points. Round ends and it's turn for next player. After a set number of rounds, the team with the highest score wins!

name: Office!
description:
It's time to challenge your fellow employees on a climb up the career ladder, taking revenge on them whenever possible when your expectations don't come to fruition in reality.

In Офис!, however, the battle for position is played out through a card battle, and playing the largest number isn't a guarantee of success. Instead the second best card is what boosts people up the corporate ladder...

name: Not Your Average Joe
description:
Collect as many "Golden Beans" and other material possessions as you can before the final auction ends.

Great fun for the whole family as you wheel and deal yourself into huge mansions, exotic cars, and other rarities that can only be achieved if you're "Not Your Average Joe"

name: Pizza Wars PL
description:
Four pizzerias, four city districts and four groups of starving customers… It is here, where Gill Bates created his Micropizzas while listening to Jack Michaelson singing “Eat it”. It is also here where the world-famous scientist, Stevie Falconing, is looking for holes in dough and Beat Oven composed his Grosse Funghi…

Pizza Wars PL is a hilarious game for both children and adults in which you take over as an owner of one of four pizzerias and you compete with others, trying to pay the credit off, taken to set up your business. With every baked pizza, you are one step closer to achieve your target..!
Will you meet all your customers’ needs or will you rather meet… a debt collector..?

In Pizza Wars PL, you run a pizzeria in one of four districts of the city Margherita. These are:

business district,
bohemian,
villa
district of poverty.


There are 15 unique customers (customer cards) originating from each of them (a total of 60). Each player starts with a different game board and some money.
As an owner of the premises in a given social background you possess a special feature (fixed bonus) helping you to serve guests from your neighbourhood. During the game you can also acquire an extra piece of equipment:

fridge
oven
trolley
table
“connections”


These increases your chance of victory and modify the strategy.

Each customer requires a pizza with particular ingredients that you have to acquire to bake (cards of ingredients). You may buy them from the market place (on display) or draw randomly for free from the deck. After each round the market place changes (ingredients rot).

There are as many turns as players and within your turn there are also two phases:

you may either collect new ingredients or bake a pizza,
pay your credit off (move on the board) or acquire a piece of equipment.


You can have a maximum of 2 customers and 6 ingredients (some bonuses can change this rule) on hand.

Having baked a pizza, your customer pays you some money, one’s card is discarded and you compulsorily draw a new customer – you may decide if you want one from your own district or from the common deck. The money you earn has to be spent on new ingredients and on a rate of the credit. The player who pays the credit off as first, wins the game.

There is an extra set of easier rules for younger children.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Auktionshuset
description:
An auction game based on the tv series of the same name. You bid on a number of real-life objects (each on a card), hopefully buying things much cheaper than the amount hidden on the cards.

The game ends when one player has won five auctions or purchased stuff for DKK 999,900.

name: Los Rollos
description:
Tick ​​Tack - the clock is ticking - Let it roll! Quickly Choose the right track in this ball tower before time runs out! Roll your ball into the right goal - or goes it in the tray of your opponent? If the ball lands with you - well done - then go to the points you!

In this game you drop a ball in a ball tower. As the ball drops you only have six seconds to get it in the right tray. So you will need to find the quickest way down. Shift tracks and get the best way for your ball to roll.

name: Mi Primer Juego de Palabras
description:
Scrabble puzzle for children. They must form the words they see on the board. This game is intended for children who have learnt the alphabet but don’t know how to form words yet. This game includes a board, tiles/letters and cards. The cards are used to keep score; the player that completes the word takes the cards. The game includes instructions with different versions depending on the level of difficulty you want to play.

Cognitive aspects

We have based this proposed classification of toys on recent studies and investigations, as well as recent domestic and international classification systems. Our proposal aims to be coherent, unified and practical at all times.
1. Visual perception: Perceptual ability to visually differentiate the objects multiple characteristics.
2. Motor skills: Ability to perform different movements with adequate precision.
3. Hand-eye coordination: The ability to synchronize visual perception with precise manual movement.
4. Spatial orientation: The ability to maintain oneself in a space with the help of spatial references in relation to the surrounding area.
5. Reasoning:

Concrete: Ability to select forms, categories and objects, and then link them together.
Abstract: The ability of thought to systematically analyse the possible combinations of elements or ideas to discover specific relationships.


6. Concentration: Ability to detach oneself and keep the focus on certain elements.

name: Domino Dungeon
description:
A solo domino and dice game.

You have become lost in the Domino Dungeon, a place of randomness.
Now you must survive the nine levels of this dungeon to make it to the gate.
What awaits you at the gate? Possibly nothing, possibly a couple more monsters.

The game is played by matching numbers on the dice to the numbers on the dominoes.
Making matches keeps you out of fights, and the blanks on the dominoes represent possibilities to get more health.

name: Marvel Comics Trivia Box
description:
From Back of Box:

So you think you know the Marvel Universe?

Includes 20 character cards 100's of trivia questions

Braggin' rights with every win!

name: Smoke
description:
User summary
The third game from Kunpu is bound to stir up some controversy amongst our current health-concerned society.

Smoking has been labeled as a dirty habit.
Increasingly more places are banning smoking and the price of cigarettes is continuously raised. Tobacco has been villainized to the point that there are specialized clinics and monetary rewards from employers for quitting.

But to heavy smokers, cigarettes are a simple pleasure.

The players of this game become heavy smokers trying to smoke as many cigarettes as possible before their lungs turn completely black. Even if you fail to smoke during a round, your lungs may still grow progressively blacker all the same from the secondhand smoke of your peers.

This game is both for those who are proud to call themselves smokers and those who disdain them. Outwit your fellow smokers to puff your way to victory (and an early grave).

Game Play
Each player gets an ashtray in which they place smoked cigarettes.

-Draw 3 cards
-Players choose 1-2 cards to place face-down on the table (one card must be a cigarette card)
-Players open the chosen cards at the same time
-The player with the highest number of cigarettes wins (unless special cards are involved)
-The winning player can smoke that round (therefore he collects the cigarettes into his ashtray). However, he also must gather tokens that mark the deterioration of his lungs, based on the number of tokens written on the card(s) he played.
-The losing players cannot smoke (they discard their opened cards) but they may receive the effect of secondhand smoke from the winner's played cards. They gather tokens according to this lung cost.
-Refill hand and continue until someone reaches 10 lung tokens (and therefore dies of blackened lungs).

The ultimate winner (even in death) is the person who smoked the most.

name: La Boite à culture geek
description:
From the publisher (translated):

We all have a little Geek side, but are you a true one? 1000 questions, quiz, multiple-choice, riddles, true or false to review the Geek culture!

In this card game, every player gets a subset of cards divided into 6 categories around the "Geek" theme:

Geek & Start
Geek & She
Geek & Pop-Corn
Geek & Spandex
Geek & Techno
Geek & Strass


Each player in turn picks one of his cards and reads the question aloud, the first of the other players to give the right answer gets the card and the points that comes with it. When all the cards have been used, the players count their points and the higher score wins.

From the publisher :
On a tous en nous un petit côté Geek, mais en êtes-vous un VRAI de VRAI? 1000 questions, quiz, QCM, devinettes, vrai ou faux pour faire le tour de la culture Geek !

Dans ce jeu de carte, tous les joueurs reçoivent une ensemble de cartes divisées en 6 catégories sur le thème de la geekitude :

Geek & Start
Geek & She
Geek & Pop-Corn
Geek & Collants
Geek & Techno
Geek & Strass


A chaque tour, un joueur sélectionne une de ses cartes et lis la question à haute voix. Le premier des autres joueurs qui donne la bonne réponse, remporte la carte et les points qui vont avec. Lorsque toutes les cartes ont été utilisées, les joueurs comptent leurs points et le meilleur score gagne.

name: Pop Culture Trivia
description: Pop Culture Trivia party game is hours of trivia fun for fans of everything Pop Culture. From Marlon Brando to Miley Cyrus and Walkmans to iPods, this game is littered with the people, products, and trends that have shaped our world.

name: UNO: Spider-Sense Spider-Man
description: Uno with Spider-Man theme and special "Spider Sense" cards. The "Spider Sense" cards, when played, require all players to reveal a Spider-Man card from their hand. Those who cannot are forced to draw two cards. These cards also act as "Wild" cards, allowing the player of the Spider-Sense card to choose the color with which to continue play.

name: Tigerilla
description:
In Tigerilla, players can assemble animals in new ways thanks to the velcro on the game tiles.

In game terms, players decide whether they want to assemble animals or search for patterns, then they place the tiles with the desired thing face down. On a turn, a player reveals two of the tiles; if they match (animal or pattern, which is desired), then they turn over a third tile. If that tile matches as well, they earn a point, and whoever earns five points first wins.

name: Rites of Cthulhu
description:
"The most merciful thing in the world, I think, is the inability of the human mind to correlate all its contents."

-H.P. Lovecraft

The entirety of mankind hefts no consequence, for our world is merely a borrowed rock. Long before ancient life, as indicated by human evidence, winked into existence, the Great Old Ones walked our landmasses, lived in our oceans, and hung in our skies. But most of them eventually left Earth and fell into a death-like sleep. These horrors of the universe render us no more significant than the insects that we crush under our boots as a matter of living.

Rites of Cthulhu offers a new dimension to traditional card play. Players who like face card games like hearts will love this Lovecraftian twist on standard gaming. Players compete against each other as rival cultists in a series of 6 rites (mini games) to win artifacts. Each artifact adds new interest to the game by introducing a new rule that effects play. After playing all 6 mini-games, the player with the most points from artifact cards wins and becomes the grand cultist.
categories: Bluffing, Book, Card Game, Horror, Novel-based, Party Game

name: I Am Legend
description:
Mechanics: States of Siege style game
Player #: Solitaire
Game Time: 25-35+ min
Age: 12+

Synopsys:
You are Robert Neville, a scientist who was unable to stop the spread of the terrible virus that was incurable and man-made. Immune, Neville is now the last human survivor in what is left of New York City and perhaps the world. Mutant victims of the plague -- The Infected -- lurk in the shadows... watching Neville's every move... waiting for him to make a fatal mistake. For years Neville has search for a cure testing the blood of the infected and he is close to discovering that cure. He only needs ten more samples of blood to create his antidote. Perhaps mankind's last, best hope, Neville is driven by only one remaining mission: to find a way to reverse the effects of the virus using his own immune blood with the blood of the infected. He knows he is outnumbered... and quickly running out of time. They are building in numbers and preparing for a major attack! Can you survive long enough to find the cure?

I AM LEGEND: is a solitaire "States of Siege" game where you control Robert Neville who is trying to find a cure for the plague which has turned the living into vampires. Each day you travel into the city looking for supplies, medicine, ammo or a blood sample from the infected. Don't stay to late because once the day turns to night and you haven't made it back home, the infected prepare for their attack. Each night the infected gather their forces and move closer to your home base; testing your barricades and looking for weaknesses.

Goal:
Search the city for [9] samples of blood to create the cure and reverse the plague before the vampires gather enough forces to penetrate your barricades and destroy you. Also search for supplies to replenish ammo and materials to build up your barricades to fend off the vampire forces.

Victory conditions:
Accomplish the above requirements before they vampires kill you.

Losing conditions:
If the vampires gather enough forces to breach your barricades and kill you before you can figure out the cure; you lose!

COMPONENT LIST:
9-Cards, 9 d6 dice and 9 cubes make up the entire game component list.

CARDS
1 – Home Base card
4 - Vampire path cards – “with numbers descending from 5 or 6 to 2” double sided
4 - City Search cards - double sided

CUBES
2 – Green cubes – “Blood sample”
2 – White cubes – "Free choice"
1 – Green cube – “Virus Cure test track”
1 – Red cube – “Vampire movement check”
1 – Black cube – “Vampire movement check”
1 – Yellow cube – “Vampire movement check”
1 – Blue cube – “Vampire movement check”

DICE
4 – White d6 die - "Supplies, Health, Ammo, and Barricades"
1 – Purple d6 die - "Robert Neville "
1 – Red d6 die - "Vampire movement tracker"
1 – Black d6 die - "Vampire movement tracker"
1 – Yellow d6 die - "Vampire movement tracker"
1 – Blue d6 die - "Vampire movement tracker"
categories: Card Game, Dice, Horror, Novel-based, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: Quantum Quest
description:
Quantum Quest is a standalone card game that challenges two or more players to put together teams of stalwart adventurers to outlast their opponents in a living dungeon. Electrifying spells, sinister traps and treacherous monsters stand in the way of survival, but things only grow more difficult when the heroes start acquiring chambers in the dungeon. Escape is futile; survive while you can!

In Quantum Quest, each player takes control of a party of five adventurers, and goes through a dungeon of at least twenty chambers, with more added for every additional player over two. This dungeon crawl is always different, thanks to the assortment of cards. Almost all of these chambers exist for only one purpose: to put the hurting on the adventurers.

Player's spend mana to control these chambers, which serves two purposes: first, they can no longer harm their owners; second, the owner decides how their enemies take damage when landing on these rooms. It's a fun, spiteful way to come out on top!

Quantum Quest also benefits from an interesting end-game phase. If all your adventurers perish in the dungeon, you're not kicked out of the game. All the rooms you owned before your untimely demise remain yours, and get a boost since they're haunted. You can choose to deal double damage to your surviving foes when they land in these chambers!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Wheat Fields (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Based on the original idea by wellidesigns, and tiles by Chris Lynn, which enable double turn for cloisters.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Raging Sun (fan expansion for Rising Sun)
description:
Raging Sun is a fan expansion that allows players to utilize the miniatures from Blood Rage in a game of Rising Sun.

This expansion has a focus on combat and monsters with mechanical inspiration from Blood Rage.

Raging Sun contains three modules which can be used together or separately in a game of Rising Sun.

Those modules are:

The Viking Card Set: A set of five cards per season that can be chosen as the card set at the beginning of the game (similar to the Teapot Card Set).

Additional Monsters: Utilizing the Kickstarter exclusive monsters, these four monsters can be added as the
additional monsters at the beginning of the game

The Asgardian Kami: A ruleset for using the Asgardian Gods as Kami, (Odin, Loki, Thor, Frigga, Heimdall & Tyr) These shrines can be combined with Kami from the base game or you can pick all four of your shrines from the set of Asgardian Kami. Also included are rules to utilize the Asgardian Gods with the Kami Unbound expansion.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology, Negotiation, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Prendi la Parola
description: An easy-to-learn and fast-to-play party game that will remind you of the classic category game. Flowers, fruits, cities or animals? Choose a category among the dozens available, start the hourglass and let the fun begin! You play together, you have to be able to take the word before others and even a little lucky to not find the hidden malus.

name: Mots Cochons
description:
This is your chance to wake up the sex beast that lies in you or hides in your pants ... all without having to lower them. In short, no need to touch to make fun! Speak dirty, mime dirty and draws dirty to score like a champion.

How's it going?

Divide your gang into two teams.
Choose the sex beast of your team, it's this player who dominates for the game turn.
You draw a card. There are three types of cards: Find the dirty words, Naughty expression, Think dirty.


Who starts? It's the team whose members have had the most sex lately ... And it's not always the ones we think!

—description from the retailer
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Numpty
description:
Numpty is a strategic card game for 2 to 5 players, where you climb the corporate ladder by throwing your friends under the bus!

The Goal:
Build your career to become the company CEO.

Game Play:
The deck is made of 68 cards with a mix of MANAGEMENT CARDS, used to promote yourself, IMPULSE CARDS, used to block or defend promotions and ACTION CARDS, used to breakdown your opponent's Office.
Each player takes turns making proposals into the Boardroom, if the proposal is successful the cards are actioned if not they are thrown into the "bin" (discard pile). Until one player builds up their career from Junior to Middle to Senior Manager and holds that top spot and becomes the CEO.

Numpty brings all the absurdities of work-life into full view, how will you play to be the top Numpty? work hard at your job and hope your efforts will get you there or self promote and throw everyone else under the bus?

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Harry Potter: Reveal the Death Eaters
description:
In Harry Potter: Reveal the Death Eaters, the Ministry of Magic leads a group of witches and wizards, disguised as Muggles, through alternating night and day cycles.

At night, the Death Eaters secretly capture a player. During the day, players discuss who they suspect is secretly a Death Eater, then it's up to the accused to convince others who they really are — but they could be lying!

Can Dumbledore’s Army sniff out the Death Eaters before it's too late?

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Voting

name: Miss Match
description:
Miss Match is a fun, quick and simple game for 2-12 players of all ages.

Players race to find a link between the cards on the table in fun and creative ways. The cards are always changing so, think fast and shout out a match before someone else can. You keep the cards you matched and that’s how you score points in the game. The more cards you can match at once the more points you score each round.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: innsbruck spiel
description:
From the Golden Roof to the Hafelekar.
The joyable quiz about local knowledge for everybody who wants to know Innsbruck better.
Travel with you pawn trough the city districts up to the mountain answering questions about culture, sports, nature, history and play some "Activity-actions".
—user summary

Vom Goldenen Dach'l zum Hafelekar
Das vergnügliche Wissensqiuz für alle, die Innsbruck noch besser kennenlernen möchten.
—description from the box

name: Spouse-ology 2nd Edition
description:
How to play:


Make sure each couple has an answer board, one dry erase marker, and three Off Script tokens to share.
The game is played in rounds. For the first round, each couple will answer an "Ask Her question Ladies first
Choose a couple to go first
The couple who goes first will roll the die to see which category question to answer from the "Ask Her" card.
The couple reads the designated question aloud, along with the multiple choice answers
Each husband writes the answer he believes his wife will choose (A, B, C, D. or E) on his answer board. The couples will take tums revealing their answers by each wife announcing her answer verbally-followed by her husband presenting his written answer to the group.
Matching answers earn 1 point, or 2 points with a 2x roll, or 3 points when an Off Script token is used.
The couple to the left rolls next!
On to round two.










Couples should not talk when being asked a question or while writing their answers, and they should be certain written answers cannot be seen by their spouse until it is time to reveal their answers. Have fun!

Off Script-After hearing the question, but before answering it, the couple has the option of choosing to use one of their three "Off Script" tokens to triple their point potential for that turn by selecting "E." A matching answer is worth 3 points

Wild Card - The couple who rolls the Wild Card chooses the category for the table for that round.

Double points-All correct answers will be worth 2 points intead of 1, and the couple rolls again to determine the category. (If the Wild Card is rolled again, they may choose the category, and if they roll the 2x again, they may roll yet again until they get a category rall.)

3 Ways to Win! Be the: 1) 1st couple to score 3 points in each category or 2) couple with the most points after a designated number of rounds or 3) couple with the most points at the end of a designated time frame

name: That's So Nerdy
description: Get your geek on with the That's So Nerdy Quiz. 1000 fantastically geeky trivia cards for boffins everywhere! Team up for a battle of brains! Can mix and match with other Ridley's collection trivia games.

name: Paper Railroad
description:
You are the manager of a railroad company, responsible for the running of trains. Recently, the railroad company has developed several routes to connect the farms through the different areas.

Your task is to make a well-designed plan to sell all kinds of products at a good price and bring the maximum profit for the company. But beware, you are not the only one who works for the company.

The game is played using 3 dice. Players need to use dice numbers to manage actions, including moving trains, hometown actions, and unlocking farm rewards. Earn points by moving trains and fulfilling the orders. Players with the highest at the end of the game win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cztery Sery
description:
Cztery Sery ("Four Cheese") with the Treflik Family is a hilarious board game where you take on the role of a pizza delivery man!

Move around the board, play action cards and block your opponents. Remember to come back for another new order. Watch out for Auntie and Cat cards, who are already waiting for their favorite treats!

Be the first to deliver the ordered pizzas to the indicated addresses and become the winner!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Cztery Sery z Rodziną Treflików to przezabawna gra planszowa, w której wcielisz się w dostawcę pizzy!

Poruszaj się po planszy, zagrywaj karty akcji i blokuj przeciwników. Pamiętaj, żeby wrócić po kolejne, nowe zamówienie. Uważaj na karty Ciotki i Kota, którzy już czekają na swoje ulubione przysmaki!

Bądź pierwszy, dostarcz zamówione pizzę pod wskazane adresy i zostań zwycięzcą!

—description from the publisher

name: Wander: LaCluck's Revenge
description:
Wander: LaCluck's Revenge is the second game in the Wander series. A fully cooperative, campaign-driven, miniatures board game. The Cult of Barnacle Bay was meddling with magic far beyond their understanding and accidentally resurrected the Ghost Pirate Chicken Lord LaCluck and her mutinous crew of Ghost Pirate Monkey Grunts, Ghastly Pig Gunners, Wailing Albatross Banshees, and Rampaging Rhino Cannoneers!

In Wander: LaCluck's Revenge, players will select one of five unique heroes from the Wanderer's Guild and join their friends to fight back against these ghost pirate phantoms to save the poor town of Barnacle Bay. Defeating foes and surviving random encounters earns players experience points and loot. Loot, like weapons and armor, is a persistent upgrade, staying with the heroes as they continue on their adventure. Experience points are used to level up heroes during their current adventure in the campaign. A dual-facing upgrade tree allows players to continually try new combinations of skills each adventure to determine what fits their play style, or current set of foes, best.

Using a modular tiles, players assemble maps as indicated in the choose your own adventure campaign book, then use action points to move or attack with their hero.

All enemies in the game are controlled by a simple line of sight A.I., and automatically hit the players' heroes once they're able to. This means there is no player rolling for success for enemies' attacks. Heroes will, however, be able to roll for defense in an effort to prevent incoming wounds. One set of custom dice determines a hero's success for both defending and attacking. Random encounter cards, which are revealed when players enter an unexplored "darkness" space, also promise that no campaign adventure is ever be the same.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Blacksad: le jeu d'enquête
description:
"A star has slipped away," headlines The Inquerer on the front page of its morning edition. Natalia Wilford, a famous actress on the rise in 1950s New York, has been murdered in her home. Who could have committed such a murder?

In this collaborative game, play as John Blacksad, Clerk Smirnov, Weekly, the nosy reporter with keen senses, and Jake Ostiombe, boxer and former bodyguard to Natalia. Scour the city, follow the clues, gather evidence and bring the truth to light

name: Самый ужасный человек (The worst person ever)
description:
How do you like the idea of walking naked through the museum?

Let's be honest: deep down, under certain circumstances, you could. Or not? But your friends unanimously answer yes. In general, in this game you will find out what nasty things you are capable of, according to your friends.

Each turn you choose one nasty thing from random cards. For example, "Which of us would drink to unconscious at own grandfather's funeral?" or “Which of us would spit in the food of a child in a Spider-Man costume?” And then - choose one of the players!

The goal of the game is to socialize and have fun, but you can also play for victory points.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Bias, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Les Lapins Crétins: Heroes
description:
Rabbids are back for epic 2 player (duel) or multiplayer (battle royale) battles!

Choose your hero among the magician, the pirate, the knight, the scientist, the ninja and the hunter. Adapt your strategy according to your hero and your deck to win.

Make the most of your Moona crystals to use your weapon, stance, item and trick cards to take on the other players. But beware of your opponents who will try their best to eliminate you with their card combos which, depending on the hero, can be devastating.

This game is for all strategists who like to build their decks but also for those who love general brawls and are looking for glory and fame.

Let the battle begin!

name: Le Rouge et le Noir
description:
Le Rouge et Le Noir is a card game for 2 or 4 players that can be played in 15 minutes. This is a modern, smoother arrangement of a traditional French card game Le Truc from the 16th century.

Your goal is to win two tricks and score as many as points you can. On your turn, you play a card from your hand of three cards with its face up to win, or play face down to call a double (by bluffing, perhaps). To earn more points, it’s the key to make smart decisions on when to call a double, pass, or take!

name: It's Bananas!
description:
It's Bananas is the hilarious new party game for kids, teens, and tipsy adults. Split into two teams, and compete in a series of monkey challenges. The team with the most bananas wins! Tail tricks, find the fleas, monkey talk, coconut races more than 18 challenges to keep your friends, family, and kids laughing! Gameplay lasts 30 minutes, is for 6+ years, and takes 4+ players, making Its Bananas! the ideal game for large groups, dinner parties, ice breakers, games night, thanksgiving fun, kids birthday parties, family gatherings, and Xmas.

—description from publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: #inconversible: Magnificent Yomi
description:
#inconversible: Magnificent Yomi a collaborative reasoning game where two or more players can play.

Yomi, a girl with red hands, has become an old man and traveled to the fantastic world of "Magnificent".

Now Yomi in bringing together local children to show them her album of memories and tell the story of "Magnificent" that she experienced.

But be careful because her album contains a fake memory. If you mention that fake memory (that is, if you flip it over), everyone loses.

name: Entertainment Tonight: The Trivia Game
description:
From the box:

Entertainment Tonight: The Trivia Game is the family-fun board game that challenges everyone's trivia IQ. The game contains 3600 questions in 6 categories, including the fields of History and Geography, Entertainment, and Sports. Questions are graded on each card in levels of difficulty from 1 thru 6. You choose the level of difficulty to win faster or win safely. Strategy counts!

name: Gregs Tagebuch: Von Idioten umzingelt!
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Gregs Tagebuch: Von Idioten umzingelt!, you're new at school and (as might be expected) at the very bottom of the class in terms of popularity – but that situation can change through your cool actions. Just don't risk too much for popularity as whoever touches the stinky cheese gets cursed by the cheese and will see his prestige plunge!

In the game, each player represents a character from the first volume of the popular book series, and everyone wants their character to rise to the top. To do this, you need to select one or more cards from a pile. Most cards have positive values and help you climb the ladder of success, but negative cards exist as well. Worst of all is the stinky cheese that adheres to your fingers and drops your popularity. Your only hope is to pass the curse on to another player, who will then stink even worse than you...

name: Griddly Headz Baseball Game
description:
One of seven in the line of Griddly Headz Boardgames, Baseball sees a different cast of “Griddly Headz” (regular Joes) duking it out on the diamond for ultimate supremacy.

Played on a large, two-tiered board, Griddly Headz features the chance to choose both your players and how you match up them up against your opponent’s team.

Gameplay consists of numerous dice challenges that take place when two players meet on the same play square of the board; the loser forfeits a piece of their gear (represented by puzzle pieces). If a player loses all twelve pieces of their gear, or one of their Griddly Headz is ejected from the game, they are immediately eliminated from the game.

To win, you must score 10 runs.

Available in Special, Deluxe, Family, and Mini editions.

name: Fringers
description:
Fringers is a co-operative action game. You play as a team and based on a goal card try to rearrange the rings on your fingers before time runs out. The players are allowed to give their rings only to their neighbor on the left, while your neighbor on the right will put new rings on your fingers — hopefully with the right color on the right finger.

—description from the publisher

name: Die drei ??? Kids: Das Schloss-Geheimnis
description:
Story: The three ??? kids find 16 burglar-proof doors in a castle. What might be hidden behind them? With luck and combination, the players are able to open the doors, and find a treasure map. Who will get moist coins from the treasure chest?

The playing area consists of 16 cardboard doors. Each one gets a cardboard "lock" attached randomly, which shows tree colored dots. The player in turn tries to open one of the locks by rolling 3 color dice. If necessary, he may re-roll some or all dice up to two times. In addition, one die shows some sides that act as wild card, or hurt the leader.

If the player matches the colors of a lock, he turns over that door. The back shows a part of the treasure map, along with 1-3 coins, which he collects. Goal is to have most coins at game end, when all doors are opened and the map is complete.

name: Helt hysteriskt!
description:
A crazy family/party-game.
Its a game to play when you want to have a real fun time with your buddies. The game includes that you need to do charades, answer questions with only yes or no and you also may get forced to do very silly stuff, like jump on one leg and sound like chicken every time its your turn.
When you do all this stuff you move a piece on a scoringtrack, the more your do right the more points, if you fail you loose points. If your reach the finnishline first you win.

name: Welcome Back, Kotter: The Up Your Nose with a Rubber Hose Game
description: Be the first player to complete the expression "up your nose with a rubber hose". Each player in the game will assume the identity of one of the student characters in Mr. Kotter's class. By moving to the front desk of each row, a player collects six word cards that complete the expression. Drawing of Woodman and Kotter cards may also help.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rate Your Mate
description: The object of the game is to have fun while you discover just how well you really know your mate. You and your mate pit yourselves as a team against other couples and win points by answering questions about yourselves and your relationship.

name: Schmear!
description:
SCHMEAR! is the build-a-bagel card game with round cards.

Turn over the cards and match up slices and toppings in a contest to build the biggest bagel sandwich.

But watch out: If you add a life preserver, a CD-ROM or an old tractor tire, your sandwich is wrecked and it's the next person's turn.

At the end of the game, score 1 point for each complete bagel, plus 3 bonus points if you've got the biggest bagel of them all.

name: UNO: Peanuts – A Charlie Brown Christmas
description:
This Christmas-themed Uno variant comes packaged in a plastic Snoopy doghouse, and introduces a new type of Wild card: The "Happy Holiday" Wild card forces all other players to draw 1 card, but they may discard it if it matches the color called.

From the packaging:

"It's time to come together and celebrate an all-time classic with the Charlie Brown Chrismas edition of Uno .


112 custom cards feature the Peanuts gang getting into the Christmas spirit, including Snoopy, Charlie Brown, Lucy, Linus, Woodstock, and more.
Same cheerful play plus the exclusive Happy Holidays card & rule.
Bring your family and friends together to try to be the one to sing "UNO" first and go for the win!"
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lexico Suomi-Englanti
description: Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language!

name: Traffic Jam Game
description:
Traffic Jam - A zany gridlock game of limited strategy and outrageous bumping and blocking fun.
If you can avoid the patrolling policement and dodge your fellow drivers you have a chance of winning the game. It sounds easy... but players become ruthless as the intersection grows more more congested. One minuted you may be on the verge of winning and the next ... your card is bumped back to the start.
(Back of box)

name: Woordzoeker Turbo
description:
In this Turbo-version of the original Wordquest, players spin the wheel which decides the word you should search all toghether.

The player who's first able to grab the totem and to show the word gets the token.

Be the first player with three tokens to win the game!

name: 라온 더하기 (Raon Plus)
description:
라온 더하기 (Raon Plus) is a game of making the best use out of transparent cards with Hangul (한글) alphabet or special characters to make words. Combine the alphabets in various ways and freely express your imagination.

라온 더하기 comes with three different ways to play with the components in the box.

name: Paradice
description:
The game is for two players, a "Giver" and a "Taker". At various times in the game, the players need to switch roles. Pieces consist of 4 types of trees (7 of each), 4 forest spirits, and 4 humans. The main play board is a 6x6 grid. There is a track which runs around the edge so that the whole board is 8x8.

From the publisher's Web site:

"Paradice is a world like Earth where human beings live in and depend on the vitality of their forest environment. At different moments in their lives, human beings are driven by different needs. At one time, a human may need to consume and acquire goods. At other times a human may be driven by a need for social connection or the desire to replenish the environment. The circumstances that influence those needs and the resources available in a human's life are determined by a mix of predictable patterns and random opportunity."
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Penguin C
description:
A simple roll-and-move game where penguins run around the board trying to carry fish tiles home. The first player to reach a specific number of points wins. If you land on a corner space or in the middle of the board, you may take a shorter route but you also have to draw an event card.

The game uses Korean two-sided dice, which are rolled through a dice tower.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: See-Know-Buzz
description:
See-Know-Buzz is a trick-taking game in which players use ninja to stalk one another, trying to catch opponents off-guard in order to trip them up.

The card deck consists of fifteen cards in three colors, with each color having cards valued 5, 4, 2, 1 and -3. Each player gets a hand of three cards. The start player places a card face down — either in front of himself or in front of another player — and states its color. Each other player must play a card of this color if possible, either in front of himself or in front of another player; if you already have a card in front of you, then you must play it elsewhere.

When a card is placed in front of you (except for the start player placing in front of himself), you can decide to fight by leaving your card in a vertical orientation or flee by turning it horizontal. Once each player has a card, those who fight reveal them, with the high value card winning the fight and leading to the next round. Those with the lowest-valued cards lose the round and gain one point. (Off-suit 2s and 4s reverse the trick to make the low card win, with multiple reverses being possible.)

If the trick had a single loser, that player can charge someone who fled. The fleeing person can take points equal to the number of cards in front of him or reveal his card and fight, with the winner losing one point and the loser gaining one point.

If players still have cards in hand, they play another round. Those who fled in the previous round will now have two cards in front of them, and the values of those cards are summed in a fight. Should a player's cards sum to three, then those who fled must fight in the round. When players have no cards in hand, players pick up cards in front of them, then deal out the discards until everyone has three cards.

The game ends when a player has five points. Whoever has the lowest score at this point wins.

name: La Cucaracha Card
description:
The sink in the restaurant kitchen is a real cockroach paradise — until suddenly the chef appears, and now everyone is running around wildly and all jumbled up.

Who can find their cockroaches first in KakerlaCard and place them in safe hiding places?

name: Revelation War
description:
Revelation War: The Coming Struggle for the Holy Land is a near-future what-if that presumes the US continues its zigzag withdrawal from imperium into neo-isolation, leaving Israel alone to face a hostile coalition of Islamist nations plus Chinese and Russian ‘expeditionary forces.’

There’s one large-hex 34x22” map, at 7.5 miles per hex, along with one sheet of 176 large-size (5/8”) NATO-style counters. Each of the seven turns equals one day of ‘real time.’

Playing time is about two to three hours and, though designed for two-players, it can easily be adapted for solitaire use.

name: The Lorax Card Game
description:
From the box
Players collect Truffula Trees to save the environment. But be careful -- a Once-ler can take them away. Only a Lorax placed on top of a pile of Truffula Trees can protect them from a Once-ler.

There are 56 cards total. Each player is dealt 5 cards to start with. Each player draws 1 card per turn.

name: Xi Gua Qi
description:
西瓜棋 (xī guā qí́), or Watermelon Game, has been described as a traditional folk game from Hangzhou for children. The set I have was purchased from a toy shop in Shanghai.

Xi Gua Qi is played on a board that vaguely resembles a watermelon. It is a game of abstract strategy and the object is to capture the opponent's pieces by immobilization. Each player starts with six pieces and moves them from intersection to intersection on the board. If you succeed in surrounding an opponent's piece with your own pieces, it is removed from the board. The winner is the player who reduces his opponent to less than two pieces.

The game is available as computer software by Locke Corp for the pocket PC.

name: 1830 Lummerland
description:
Lummerland is an island from the novel for children 'Jim Button and Luke the Engine Driver (Jim Knopf und Lukas der Lokomotivführer)' by Michael Ende.
In the original map the hexes are named after the figures in the novel

C4 = Jim Knopf (came to the island by post),
C8 = Lukas, the engine driver,
C6 = Alfons, quarter to twelfth (the king),
D7 = Mr. Sleeve ,
B5 = Mrs. Waas (has a little shop).

In principle the rules of 1830, an 18xx game, apply. The tiles of 1830 are used, although not all of them will be needed.

There is only one private company, the "Mailship". Its price is 20$ and it has the characteristic of the "Schuylkill Valley". No Hex is blocked by the Mailship.

There are only two Corporations: "Jim Knopf" (JK) and "Lukas, the engine driver" (LL). Both corporations may build a station at C6 beside their home stations.
There are the following trains: Two 2, and one 3, 4, 5, 6, Diesel each. In the phase "purchase of trains" a corporation may buy only one train.
Wenn the 5-train is bought Mrs Waas bakes a "Gugelhupf" (A kind of cake in a special shape). In the following Operating Round B5 is worth 20$.

The total money is 2000$, 1200$ are divided between the players in the beginning.
At the start of the game each player may make a bid. The player with the highest bid chooses his seat first. The other player follow in order of their bids. If two or more players have the same bid, roll a dice. In the end of the game the bids are subtracted from the money of the players.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Scoop
description:
From the back of the box:

Beat your friends to the SCOOP! Roll the dice and play your cards to match the ice cream cone created by the roll. Watch out for the flavor of the month and the Milkshake card, though. They can change everything and leave you holding an empty cone.

name: Army of Dice
description: 2 player fast paced dice game. 6 different factions of spellcasters to choose from. First turn players throw max 5 dice from 8 dice and make the result out of it. Dice is d6, but instead of numbers there are symbols, all related to the fraction you are playing. Each fraction have 7 different combos possible to do with those dice. There are 2 kind of effects, those that remains and have upkeep cost, or one time effects. Different effect might require more than one kind of symbol of dice, so you might want to load one big effect by saving dice for that. Next round you throw again max 5 dice (you get one more dice each round to pool) and this goes on unless one player has 0 life. Starting life is 16.

name: EscapeRUN Alcatraz
description:
The players control 2-6 characters each, who are experts in different fields. They have been invited to see the hyper modern, fully automated Alcatraz Prison, before it is officially opened. As luck would have it, though, something goes wrong, and the characters become inmates of the penitentiary. Now they all want to flee the island.
Each turn a player chooses a character to move on the island, trying to collect Escape Cards they could have use of when performing their Run. While moving they have to look out for Sentinel guards, and Drone attacks. Each rescued character gives the player a point, and the player with the highest score at the end wins.
The game is semi-cooperative, and players can team up to raise their chances of successfully fleeing. While the game goes on, the Prison System is gradually waking up. At the point it is fully activated it becomes impossible to flee. The game ends when this happens, or when no living prisoner remains on the island.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That

name: Igor: The Life of the Party
description:
From BoardgameNews.com:

"Igor: The Life of the Party, from newcomers Dug Steen and Nate Beeler, blends a trick-taking game with some of the rules craziness of Frédéric Leygonie and Sylvie Barc’s Elixir.

"The trick-taking element of Igor: The Life of the Party works mostly as you’d expect. Players are dealt a hand of cards, which come in five suits numbered 0-9, and each turn they play one card to the table, following suit if possible. If all the cards played are in suit, the player of the highest numbered card wins; if one or more cards are out of suit, however, then the highest one of those cards wins. The trick’s winner scores three coins, and the player with the most coins at the end of the game, which lasts several hands, wins.

"What makes the game tricky are the rule cards, two of which are in play at the start of the game – make that in play face-down, which means you have to remember what the rules are throughout the hand. Sample rules are 'When you play a card that has an Igor on it, you must say "Yes, Master"' and 'When you laugh, you must follow your laugh with a "Meow."' At the start of each turn, the dealer can add or remove one rule from play, and the player who wins the most tricks in a hand has the same option, so rules are constantly popping in and out of the game."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Solitaire Tiles
description:
Solitaire Tiles is a variant of the classic solitaire game Klondike. It can be played solo using standard Klondike rules or can be played using a point system. Each tile has a different point value so choosing the right tile to play can affect your score.

In the two player game, players take turns placing tiles. Points are score for playing your own tiles but not your opponents. As different tiles have different point values, it may sometimes be beneficial to play an opponents tile to block him from getting the points.

The game uses a standard "deck" of 52 tiles plus an 4 special tiles (wild & swirls).

name: Santa's Rooftop Scramble
description: It’s Christmas Eve and Santa needs to make sure all the presents are delivered on time, and to the right addresses. Sounds easy enough, but in this game - you are Santa. You start in the workshop, preparing all the presents, and as soon as you have everything ready, you can start making your way across the rooftops, dropping the correct presents through the letterboxes. There are a few stumbling blocks to look out for, and although there is some strategy involved, the game is mostly relying on luck. With easy to grasp rules, even the youngest players can skilfully play with the older ones. The first player to deliver all their presents is the winner. A wonderful and fun way for the whole family to get into the Festive Spirit, and is sure to be a family favourite year after year
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Thomas & Friends: Round the Rails Game
description: A Thomas & Friends game played on a circular, plastic track/board with a Fat Controller spinner in the middle. Contains a plastic Thomas the Tank Engine with two troublesome trucks, 4 color-coded lorry cards and 4 sets of 4 cargo cards.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains, Transportation

name: 2 erste Spiele
description:
Two simple games of (color-)dice for children 3 and up, both set in a playground setting.
In the first one, the players try to collect sandbox toys in 5 different colors, whoever has all five colors first, wins.
In the second one, the players move across color-coded steps by throwing a color dice. Ladders act as shortcuts, slides move the pieces backwards. The player who reaches the tower at the end of the steps first, wins.

name: HashTagIt
description: Each round begins with a completely ridiculous photo. Play the best Hashtagit caption from the cards in your hand. Be voted the best Hashtag and win the Picture Card! Play continues until one annoyingly lucky player gets 7 cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Luck or Logic
description:
Billed as 'The Game of Riddles', Luck or Logic is a light game that will appeal to anyone who enjoys strange humour and paronomasia.

Players roll a die to move around the board, collecting money from artifacts purchased and from answering riddles. Some of the riddles can be answered through logic:
Q. How do you stop a kid from crying in the back seat?
A. Make him move up front.
And some of the riddles are puns:
Q. Why did the grizzly buy a pair of shoes?
A. Because he had bear feet.

Most of the squares landed on will either give a player money or force a payment... slightly weighted in favour of the players. If someone cannot pay his bills, he is bankrupt and starts over with $40,000.

The winner is the first player to accumulate $1,000,000.

name: The Secrets Game
description:
Players take turns as the "Storyteller", drawing a card with the beginning of a tale, for example "To avoid getting a ticket, I once told a police officer...".

The Storyteller reads the card, filling in the rest of the story from personal experience - or by making something up! The other players use special tokens to vote on whether the Storyteller is telling the truth or not. The Storyteller earns points for convincing people he's telling the truth. The other players earn points for correctly guessing whether the Storyteller was telling the truth or not.

Each round allows each player a turn at storytelling. After four rounds, the scores are tallied and highest score wins.

name: Constellation Station
description:
Text from introduction:

The starry sky is full of lore and legend. Learning about the constellations, or star patterns, is often a first step into amateur sky watching and ultimately the study of astronomy and space science.

In Constellation Station you will encounter interesting information about the stars and constellations while you are enjoying the game. As you play you will find yourself learning the names of all the leading constellations in the northern sky, some of the brightest stars they contain, and other basic information about them.

The game board has a big sky map surrounded by a hemisphere wheel. The map provides a general picture of where the constellations are in relation to one another. The named spaces of the Hemisphere Wheel "point" to the corresponding constellation on the Sky Map. The constellation can be found by following a straight line from the name on the wheel to its map location.

The game can be an introduction to sky watching outdoors. After playing the game, turn out the lights to see the stars on the game board glow-in-the-dark. Practice recognizing the star patterns. Then go out and see the night sky! You might want to make up your own stories and legends about the star patterns you see.

The game board map by itself won't identify which stars are where in the sky, since that depends on the date, time of the night and latitude on earth. Good guidebooks and other sky watching aids that take these things into account are described in the suggested reading section. Have fun and keep looking up!

name: Lords, Lands, and Legends: The Lost Treasures of Tabreh
description:
Lords, Lands, and Legends is a fast action, fantasy/adventure game of luck and strategy. With only ONE sheet of rules, players can begin their quests almost immediately.

Be the first Lord to find and return 100,000 gold pieces to his or her capital city and become a Legend ... sounds easy, right! Wrong! The fantasy world of Tabreh (pronounced Tabray) contains a wide variety of magical and non-magical obstacles designed to slow each player down. The players must overcome these obstacles by using magic, or by using objects that may be found throughout Tabreh.
mechanics: Events, Lose a Turn, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Blast It!
description: In this frantic word game everyone plays together and everyone plays against the clock! The subject on the card is read out loud. The dice dome is shaken, the ticking timer started and players have to write down as many words as possible that relate to the subject but starting only with the letters shown on the dice. Not suitable for nervous types!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Electronic, Word Game

name: Die Börse
description:
This is a game promoted by a German TV-magazine which deals with economy and financial affairs etc. The game tries to introduce the players to the mechanics of the stock market (Börse).
Probably the best description for the game is Monopoly meets Broker, because it's mainly die rolling to move your pawn around the board, buying and selling shares on the way with some nice twists and drawing a risk card occasionally.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Stock Holding
publishers: Braintrust Games, Damm / Egmont, Spiel Spass

name: Wind Up Sumo Smash
description:
From the publisher:
Sumo wrestle anytime, anywhere with the ultimate Japanese wind up game! In its very first US release, Tomy Classics: Sumo Smash combines old school style with timeless fun.

Wind up your wrestler and cheer him on in possibly the maddest sport of all. The first wrestler to force his opponent out of the ring or knock him down wins!

Great for travel - comes with its own stow-n-go carrying case. 6-1/2x5-1/4". Ages 5 and up.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fighting, Sports

name: Anima
description:
Age: 4+

Description:
These little ghosts are lost. Help them get back to the graveyard but be careful and avoid the dangers. 26 Bamboo pads in six colors, 4 little ghosts, 1 starting pad, 1 Graveyard pad, 1 colored die.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: MoNoPOLi Board Game
description: In the game MoNoPOLi (Molybdenum, Nobelium, Polonium, Oxygen, Lithium), players try to acquire complete sets of element groups including alkaline Earth metals, d-transition metals and halogens, while answering questions regarding lab ware, chemical principles, periodic table trends and more. Along the way, they try to avoid Unfavorable Enthalpy and Binding Energy and hope to land on a Reaction Pathway Shortcut.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Make-A-Scene
description:
Info from back of box:

Set the scene for laughter and fun with Make A Scene, the uproarious Category Drawing Game! Start with a deserted main street, or an unused barnyard, or maybe a bare bedroom. Now draw as many items you can think of into the scene before time runs out. Here’s the catch - each item must begin with the same letter and must really belong in the scene.

The drawing is exciting, but get ready for real laughs when it comes time to justify your choices. Go ahead... explain what the MERMAID is doing on MAIN STREET next to the MAILMAN and the MUTT!

Scoring:
A team receives one point for each item drawn and two points if the item is unique (drawn by only one team). After 4 rounds, the team with the highest score wins.

For 2 players or 2 teams.

name: Acronymia
description:
A.C.R.O.N.Y.M.I.A = A Creative Response Only Needs Your Most Inventive Acronym. The name says it all - a great new Australian designed game.

Object of the Game:
To be the player with the highest score at the end of Round 10, after adding the scores of each round.

Playing the Game:
Shuffle the Word Cards and create a face down pile.
Write the names of each player on the score pad and commence play in your chosen order.
