Combine luck, skill and strategy to acquire a hand of cards that allows you to solve a winning combination of square(s) that will outrank your opponent. Take risks ... be bold and win big!

But beware: being greedy may mean that you draw too many cards and Kra$h! But then again, you could always bluff your way to a win!

Home Page: http://www.playkrash.com

name: 3:2...Sieg!
description:
Rather unusual soccer game: 11 players for both teams, but no ball and dice included!

Movements can be done in every direction as far as wanted, but several areas on the board can hold a limited number of players only. Goals are scored by moving a player on a free space of the goal, when that player is within the shooting area.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: Göteborgsvarvet
description: Göteborgsvarvet is a localized and simplified variant of Monopoly. The players move around Gothenburg (the second largest city in Sweden), and buy investments in the city's tourist attractions and famous sites.

name: Dragon Tower
description:
A prince and a princess are locked up in a tower, guarded by a Dragon. The players try to free them.
The box of the game is the board on which you build a tower. And on the tower sits a Dragon.
To throw the dice, you throw it in the tower and it rolls out underneath.
Players move along the board, trying to collect good apples (there are also bad apples). Finally the ascend the tower, but must be careful not to fall down.
First on top of the tower, wins the game.

name: Blue Nile
description:
Equipment: A 61-cell hexagonal board (5 spaces per side) and a large supply of stones, all of one color (blue works nicely.)

On each turn, each player drops a stone on an empty cell adjacent to the last dropped stone, but not adjacent to any other stone. The player without any valid moves, loses.

You can think of your mission as finding the source of the Nile. You follow the River until it goes no farther. The last player to move is the first to find the source, and that player is the winner.

name: Little Storm's Daytrip
description: This game takes players to the beach, the playground, into town, into the park, to the port, into the woods before finally having a picnic. The game encourages children to put their own experiences into words.

name: UNO: The Golden Compass
description: Typical UNO themed edition with the addition of a themed Alethiometer card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Benji Detective Game
description: Benji turns detective to solve a robbery. Some of his friends have been stolen by dognappers. Valuable coins and jewelry are also missing. Join Benji as he travels around the board searching for clues. Help him find the right cards so that he can locate the robbers and recover the stolen goods. The object of the game is to find 5 cards that match the figures on your clue card.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Computer Perfection
description:
From the 1979 Lakeside box:

4 Unique ELECTRONIC Games
Thousands of variations.

ROLL BACK THE DOME
See and hear a welcoming show of electronic lights and sounds.
SELECT ONE OF FOUR GREAT GAMES
Play at any one of three skill levels. Take your clues from the electronic lights and sounds.

Choose a new game every time or repeat your last game to improve your score.

PLAY THESE GREAT ELECTRONIC GAMES

COUNTDOWN
ONE PLAYER - Light lights in the proper order. Do it in the least number of moves.

BRAIN BATTLE
TWO PLAYERS - Battle to turn all lights either on or off. Computer will keep score.

BLACK HOLE
ONE PLAYER - Make a mistake, lights turn off. Take too long - computer wins.

LIGHT RACE
TWO PLAYERS - Race to capture as many lights as you can. The ultimate game for fast thinkers.

name: Destination Norwich
description:
A game of taxi driving through Norwich. It's a rather random process of collecting fares, avoiding fines, and other such mishaps, while visiting many of Norwich's tourist destinations.

One of many in the "Destination" series.

name: Monopoly: Koblenz
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Koblenz, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Dortmund
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Dortmund, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Det Store Parløbsspil 6-Dagesløbet
description:
Danish indoor cycling game published early in the 1970's.

The game represents a 6-day race in teams of two riders. One of the riders moves slowly (with 1 die) on the outer lane while the other tries to gain points by speeding (with 2 dice) on the middle lane and try to breakaway on the inner lane and gain a lap. Use Breakaway chits to move your rider to the inner lane and he'll goes twice as fast.
Play for 3 or 4 hours and have intermidiate sprints every half hour where the riders are lined up at the start line and goes one lap. Fastest rider scores 6 points, second 3 points, third 2 points and fourth 1 point.
Use points to buy extra Breakaway chits (one for 18 points).
1 Breakaway chit are given to each team at the start and after each sprint.

name: Versichern
description:
A Game about insuring for the whole family.

Get your policies so you are protected by going your way all over the plan.

name: Game of Cub Scouting
description: Players move around the colorful, authentically illustrated game board, answering questions to earn achievements and badges. Watch out for the Camp Cards, though...they may tell you to give up an achievement!

name: Iceberg
description:
Iceberg is a Piecepack game for 2 - 4 players. The tiles represent icebergs and coins the survivors of a ship wreck that have made it onto the ice.

The objective is to be the last player with coins on the ice(tiles).

Tiles can be flipped which moves the coins around, coins can also be purposefully moved, coins moved off of the ice(tiles) are removed from play.

The rules can be downloaded from :
http://www.piecepack.org/PiecepackGames.asp

name: Impossum
description:
[Text by the publisher:] 3 card games about very strange names of animals, such as "blood-striped blenny", "bobolink", "spectacled warbler" and "brown egg frog" (these are eqivalents of the names in English - by now the game ist available only with German names).
You try to get rid of your cards. Each card shows six incredible names of animals, each of them belonging to one of these species: mammals, reptiles, fish, birds, butterflies, and impossums. Only the first five species are "regular" species. The impossums are fake animals (impossible animals). Their sole purpose is to provide suggestions for bluffing. Bluffing is important for winning - and for having fun!
One game is about guessing to what species an animal belongs. As the animal names must be read aloud, it is good exercice for kids to read and pronounce.
The other two games are different in depth and demand. There are alphabetical and morphemic rules for putting down cards. For example:
You can put down a card only if
- either it shows the name of an animal of the particular category that fits alphabetically (= starting with the same letter as the reference animal or with its first letter following or coming before that letter), or if
- a part of the name of an animal is identical with a part of the name of the reference animal (example: "blue-and-gold-fusilier", a fish, thus matches with "blue-crowned motmot", a bird). If it belongs to the same species, you can put down a further card, if it belongs to another category you just switch the species.
If both is not possible, you can try some bluffing. The cards are played face down.
You must pronounce the name of the animal when putting your card down. Each card put down can be controlled. When your bluffing is detected, you get malus points. When you habe put your cards down "regularly", however, the one who has controlled gets malus points. Chances are good not to be detected when bluffing: all animal names (more than 1250) are very strange indeed, so its not obvious, when you invent a name on your own or use an impossum. Unless you blush... [end of publisher's text]

name: Monopoly: Lorraine
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Lorraine region, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Thomas The Tank Engine Game
description:
Two, three or four engines collect their trains and race to the seaside.

Make a complete train of one engine and three trucks or carriages by collecting from two sidings and a third at a station. Who will win by having the first train to arrive at the seaside station?

Simple roll and move game for children based on the popular books and TV show.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing, Trains

name: Cymbergaj
description:
Cymbergaj (pronounced like 'tsim-berr-guy') is a traditional tabletop game that simulates European football (soccer). It was quite popular in schools, the matches took place on classroom desks during breaks between classes.

Each of two players has a team of footballists represented by coins. There's one big coin 'the goalkeeper' and three medium-sized coins 'field players' in each team. To distinguish between teams one of them is 'heads up' the other is 'tails up'. There is also one small coin in use - representing the ball. The goals are usually gaps between two boxes or books each.

The game mechanics is similar to Carrom or PitchCar - players finger-flick their respective team coins to hit the ball and eventually to score points by shooting goals. The rules of fair and foul plays depend on the variant of the game. And the variants are numerous!

name: Bet Royal
description: Using a standard 52 Card Deck and a special track on a board, the players play cards to three different piles. Once a King is played, a score is anounced and players bid for a bet, if the sum of the cards in a given pile amount to the score. Points are awarded on the outcome of the bet, 20 Points win the game.

name: Tutan Loot 'em
description:
From the publisher:

Collect ancient artefacts, but beware of looters !
A beautifully illustrated card game, in which players collect Egyptian artefacts. A friendly game right up to the point when the last player could 'loot' your winnings with their final play.

name: Gut geteilt ist halb gewonnen
description: Very simple math game. There is a stack of cards with numbers on the table. Players roll two special dice and have to perform division or multiplication of the top card of the stack. If they succeed, they discard a card onto the stack, if they fail, they draw one.

name: Tutti Frutti
description: You need to have lightning reactions in order to find the exact card that matches both colors of the dice. The person whose turn it is throws both dice simultaneously. The two top sides of the dice show which colors have to be found. Simultaneously, all players search as quickly as possible for a card that contains both colors rolled. The first person to find a match gets to keep the card. The player who has collected the majority of the fruit cards at the end wins the game.

name: Black Hole
description:
Black Hole is played with a standard deck of cards. Put the Ace of spades in the middle of the board as the base or "black hole". Deal all the other cards face up in seventeen fans of three (you can see all the cards).
Then you can play any cards from the tops of the fans. You put them on the base, following one simple rule: you can put on a card only neighboring cards (of any suit), i.e. for example only 6 and 8 on a 7. The goal is to collect as many cards in the middle, as possible.

name: Lexico Suomi-Ruotsi
description: Unique dictionary game is now completely renovated! Lexico contains a total of 9000 commonly used words, divided into five thematic areas: Human, Environment, Nature and Hobby, Science and Technology as well as the general words. Three different levels of difficulty thanks to the game is suitable for all ages and levels of language minds can play together - each of the chosen level of difficulty. Lexicon company you enjoy and learn a foreign language! You win by getting rid of all your cards!

name: Primal Rage: Rage On Urth!
description:
Object: You are one of the Primal Rage Dino Beasts! Use your battle ball to wage war with the other Dino Beasts. Win the Battle and "eat" the Primal Followers! Eat the most Primal Followers and win the game!

Players first assemble the arena, which uses the actual gamebox and 2 ramps on each of the short sides of the box. Players then "wager"
their followers (1-4) and place them in the arena on marked spots. Players place one of their 4 special attack features in the appropriate
spots without looking at them. Then both players take their Beast's battle ball and roll it from the
tops of the ramp towards the arena floor.

Scores are tallied, number showing on the beast's battle ball + their special attack, and the winner "eats" all of the followers that were
knocked down in that round. Play then rotates to the 2nd player vs. 3rd player, and then 3rd vs. 4th, until all players have had 2 matches each.

The winner of the game is the one with the most "eaten" followers at
the end of the game.

name: Panzer
description:
User Summary:
One of Gamecraft's Pocket Wars games. A series of short, simple 2-player Abstract Strategy wargames.

This game has players moving their force of 5 'panzer' tokens toward each other in a head-to-head manner along the 5 columns of the game board.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Wargame, World War II

name: Chezz Tactic Summoner Master
description:
When the world of Summoner Master is played as Chess equal to this game.

After setup the modular board, each player will lay down units like the Chess but different from Chess, each unit has its own movement pattern, attack range, HP and can be upgradable to be more powerful unit in the game.

The example of units in the game are Lord, Dragon, Priest, Clown, Assassin, Soldier, etc.

The dice is involved in the game for resolving the effectiveness of each unit ability such as Avoid, Reflect or Defend.

There are 2 goals of the game. First is capturing the opponent's Lord unit (by reducing its HP to 0 or less) as the eliminating of the King in Chess OR capturing as many opponent's units that can reach the unit level summation criteria. (total of 15 levels or more in all variances of the first edition)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Gooische Koeien
description:
Gooische Koeien is a parody on a dutch TV program that is a bit like the tv show: "Footballers Wifes".

It is the third part of the set: "Koe zoekt Boer" en "Klussen met Koeien". Just like the others it is a stand alone game but it can be combined with the others.

In "Gooishe Koeien" the cows now have a beautifull mansion and they now want a wealthy bull that buys them lots of designer presents. The cows love shopping and they don't do anything else, besides that they also have a playbull but you have to watch out that you are not seen with something fake.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Loto couleurs
description:
From the box...

An association game of images and language. You start by laying all the cards upside down and each player chooses a board. The first player turns over a card. If the drawing of the card corresponds to one of the images of his/her board, he/she puts it on top. It it does not correspond to any of the images of his/her board, the player puts it back upsside down. On his/her turn, the next player draws a card... The winner is the first to find all the images on his/her board.

name: Total Pacific Theater Pack I
description:
From the publisher:
TOTAL PACKS are a new scenario series featuring a wide variety of scenarios set on geomorphic boards—and including BONUS items like overlays and die-cut counters!

TOTAL PACIFIC THEATER PACK I features EIGHT brand new scenarios depicting varied actions with all scenarios set in the PTO but not overwhelmingly cave and beach landing oriented. Each scenario has been reviewed and your enjoyment is assured by a full money back guarantee of the purchase price if not 100% satisfied!

TOTAL PACK scenarios are OFFSET printed on bright white heavyweight cards and feature an offset printed presentation. They also feature some of the finest AFV art in the form of highly detailed and accurage line drawings, featured prominently on the cards.

Tournament sized designs with the occasional monster mixed in all designed by experienced, die hard enthusiasts YOUR FELLOW HOBBYISTS. Varied actions. That's what TOTAL PACK scenarios are all about.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Wackelblume
description: A dexterity children game in which players take turns to place as many glittering drops as possible on a flower. But they must beware -- when the drops are too heavy, they will lose balance and the flower will shake off the dew. The first player to place all of his dew drops on the flower wins the game.

name: Through the Clues
description: Through the Clues is a great new word game with a twist! You can only believe half of what you see! Players guess words based on a series of two word clues…but only one of the words in each two word clue is meaningful, the other is a decoy. Players' alternate turns writing a series of five distracting two word clues for all their opponents who are trying to find the common link between the clues and then guess the answer. Guessing begins as soon as the first two word clue is placed in the easel. Play continues until all five easel cards are placed in the easel. If the no one answers the word in the allotted time, the clue giver scores the points. With 300 answer words complete with clues/decoys listed and the option to make up your own decoys, there is no limit to the fun.

name: Quick-Wits
description: Card game, featuring cards giving a range of categories, and a second deck of letters. There are several variations, but the basic idea is that players must name something which fits the current category and starts with the current letter.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Let's Learn About Flags
description: A fun and simple game for children who want to learn what those colorful things are adult call "flags". Solving tasks like finding Finland or Estonia and setting the tiles shuffled on the table. If we solve all the tasks correctly, you win the game! The game includes 1 playing boards and 6 different pawns, 2 dice and a lot of markers. Just pick a marker, turn it around and find a place for it on a board (European map). Name that place and keep the marker. You win the game when you get 3 markers.

name: Etelä-Pohjalaanen Alias
description:
New Alias version in which instead of regular words you now have 2000 words from South Finland language dialect.
Try to explain these words with regular words. Can you do it? Do you even know these words?
categories: Educational, Party Game, Racing, Word Game
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: In geheimer Mission
description:
Every turn a sequence of symbol cards is placed face up in the table. On player tries to memorize a sequence of cards, while the other players are allowed to try to disturb him in a way specified by another set of cards (for example by making noise, tickling, etc.)
After a certain time (limited by an hourglass), the cards are turned face down and the player hast to designate the correct sequence.

name: Musik Quizzen
description:
The boardgame version of a quiz show aired on the danish radio station P3. Players compete in seven different categories; the 60's, 70's, 80's, 90's, grand prix, danish rock and the idols of today.

Each turn players roll a dice to determine from which of the categories they will receive a question. Each question card has three different question difficulties which rewards a right answer accordingly with 1, 2 or 3 points. A right answer also lets the player roll the dice again.

If a player is the first to reach 10 points in a category, the category is closed and that player receives a victory point. The first player to accumulate 4 victory points is the winner.

name: Munchkin Plutonium Dragon Shot Glass
description:
This shot glass has a special rule for all Munchkin games:




During any combat, you may drink one complete Potion of Plutonium Dragon Summoning from the Munchkin Plutonium Dragon Shot Glass to retrieve the Plutonium Dragon from the Door discards or deck (reshuffle the deck, in that case) and add it as a wandering monster. You may only do this once per game.If the Plutonium Dragon is in some other player's hand, or is already IN the fight, your use of the Potion is wasted. If it is in YOUR hand, go ahead and play it as described above.





Note that the "shot" can be any liquid and does not have to contain alcohol.Part of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Galileo Kids: Entdecke Wissen
description:
A trivia game with 780 questions and answers.

By turning the colored roulette wheel the children choose the questions for each card. They select one of the answers to score points, in which each answer option is associated with a symbol, and a color.

There are many interesting topics from the fields of history, geography, biology, wildlife, art, music, sports and culture in general etc.

name: ZnajZnak: Pamięć
description:
Everyone is familiar with memory games. With their simple rules and the excitement of rivalry, memory games appeal to both children and adults, and older players do not necessarily have an advantage over younger ones. Ever since they first appeared in the 1950s, games that involve looking for pairs of identical objects have enjoyed unflagging popularity and thousands of versions have been produced. While ZnajZnak – Pamięć continues this long tradition, it also introduces a certain element of novelty, because players acquire knowledge automatically while playing.
The game is composed of 48 cards. There are 16 pairs of the symbols of recent Polish history and also 16 cards with the names. Among the cards players have to find a pair of the same symbols and then point one of the 16 cards with the names of symbols.
A historical commentary on each symbol is provided in the enclosed brochure.

name: Star Wars, The Clone Wars  3-Card Match Game
description:
"Match all characters with their action shot and vehicle to win! Different game rules included withint the pack."

Thirty double-size cards, making 10 sets of 3. Basically Memory with Trios instead of Pairs. Also included are rules to use the deck for a game of Donkey.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Pretty Ugly
description:
Mirror, mirror on the wall, who is the fairest one of all? Of course, me! In Pretty Ugly every player thinks so, but only one will be declared the next top model by the strict jury.

Pretty Ugly is a satirical game about beauty contests and Top Model TV shows. The game is interactive, funny, and contains a good mixture of strategy and luck. The game mimics the absurd real-world beauty mania: players can never completely reach the beauty ideal, the beauty ideal changes over time, and finally, beauty sells!

In Pretty Ugly the players represent models that want to win as many beauty contests as possible. Each turn a player either takes 3 open cards to add to their hand, or plays an action from the hand to adapt their looks to the random (and maybe not so “pretty”) beauty ideal. But be careful: other players can be mean and “uglify” you! After three rounds there is always a beauty contest where the player with the most matching aspects with the beauty ideal wins the most money, and the player with the least matching aspects wins the least money. Then the beauty ideal changes completely and players need to adapt to the new ideal again. After 9 rounds and 3 beauty contests, the player who has won the most money in total wins the game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: DrunkQuest: Level Counters
description:
These custom dice will be used to keep track of your levels and feature bold clear numbers and a custom beer icon for level 6! Each set will include 6 dice.

Each set includes the Loaded Dice treasure card, which allows you to change the outcome of the next dice roll.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game

name: Laundromat
description: Laundromat is a card game about picking up "chicks" at laundromats. The object is to date enough women to obtain “12 women points” before the other players do. Each card has a value from 1-5 depicting a woman doing laundry. On their turn, players will either date the unattractive (low value cards) gals outright, or roll dice for chances at the "hotter babes" (higher value cards).

name: Kakuro: Das Spiel
description:
This abstract game is based around the Kakuro puzzle rules (basically, a crossword with sums as questions/tasks and the solutions limited to numbers 1 - 9, one per square and no duplicates within a solution).

During setup, players place the potential solution numbers onto the empty 8x8 grid as they see fit. Each player also gets a number of partially randomly selected action tiles that can be used to replace numbers later in the game, swap two numbers or allow to create a solution with one duplicate number.

Each turn, a random sum tile is drawn. Players then simultaneously try to create a solution for that sum on the board, using only their own action tiles for any changes to the numbers on the board and placing beginning/end markers for solutions. Numbers already used in previous solution can not be altered in any way. The player who comes up with a legal solution first scores points equal to the length of the solution and the solution is applied to the board. If the sum was odd, all players draw an additional action tile after the turn.

The game ends when the players fail to find a solution for the third time. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Alpacalypse
description:
From the website Example of Play:

"1 person plays the light alpaca, 1 plays the dark alpaca.

Each turn you roll the dice.

The 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 are movement numbers- how many hexes you can move your counter through. The last hex you walk on you flip over. If it was dark alpaca territory, flip it to light alpaca territory or vice versa.

The House icon means that you put a red house token on the tile you’re standing on. The tile now cannot be flipped.

Once you have 10/16 tiles in your colour, you win immediately!"

Additional rules inferred from draft image of game:

If you roll a 1, you do not move but, instead, place a red house token on your current tile.

To setup the game, place 8 tiles black-side up on the left and then 8 white-side up on the right. Place the light colored alpaca counter in the top right of the white section and the black alpaca counter in the top left of the black section of hex tile layout.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Press Start Pocket: Series 3
description:
Press Start Pocket is a 2 player game deck of 56 cards.

Each deck (Series 1, Series 2, Series 3) is a stand-alone 2 player game. Two decks can be combined for a 3-4 player game, and 3 decks can be combined for a 5-6 player game. Combining decks also gives expanded capabilities for warriors.


Battle to win control of the pixel world.

Players start with a video game warrior and battle their opponent to take control of the video game universe.

There is no hiding, to win you have to battle.

Overview:

Both players get 7 cards and the rest of the cards are placed in 2 piles face down in the middle of the table.

Pile 1 is a warrior card pile

Pile 2 is an action card pile

The first player draws and action card then either attacks, plays a gather card to earn points toward another warrior or discards.

During a battle the players follow the attacks and counters rule according to the reference card.

To win a player must win 3 battles or earn 4 soldiers all alive at once.

Integrates with:


Press Start Pocket: Series 1
Press Start Pocket: Series 2

name: Odd 1 Out
description:
You or your team is trying to guess which of the four choices doesn't belong to the same category with others. You must also try to give the reason why it doesn't belong to that category. Categories can be nearly anything: members of pop groups, types of cheeses, different materials etc. You or your team gets two points for right guess and additional point for the right reason, which you can find from the card. The team that first gets to 15 points wins.

The game is deck of 60 cards in a nice tin box. Two cards has the rules and every other card has six different categories with four choices on each. Right answers are bolded, so the player reading the card, can't participate on that round.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Backcountry: The Game of Wilderness Survival – AT Edition
description:
Backcountry is a strategy board game about backpacking created to be played on the trail or at home. The AT edition is built around the Appalachian Trail. The game offers 3 different starting positions and five characters to choose from with which to begin your hike.

Gameplay includes managing food, navigating bear and snow danger zones, trading gear and planning your route. It offers the full experience of hiking in the wild. You will get the experience of all the joys and struggles of the Backcountry. Find your way through the trail using a Map and Compass. Speed up your hiking with Poles. Prepare for the Snow Danger Zone with Snow Gear. Hike to the top of Mount Washington or be the first hiker to reach Katahdin. You can barter Gear with your friends or buy Gear with Food Units.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: étranger
description:
User summary:
エトランゼ (étranger) is a mystery game from Spieldisorder. Players are freelance writers, chasing around the world to uncover the genius "Etranger". Special reports are left in certain places, and players must find and announce them to the public to gain prestige. The game has absolutely no element of luck.

This was the first game produced by Spieldisorder and is designed to be packaged in a DVD case. The components were ordered from Germany.

Publisher's summary:
プレイヤーはフリーランサーとなって、謎の天才「エトランゼ」を追います。各地にレポートを残し、それを世間に向けて発表します。運の要素が全く無い、多人数確定ゲーム。

Main board is DVD disc and instructional movie is in it.
All components(expect DVD package) are water proof!
publishers: シュピールディスオーダー (Spieldisorder)

name: Magical Legend: Demons
description:
This is the first game in the Magical Legend series of games. The game is set in a mythical Chinese world like that of the Chinese classic "Investiture of the Gods". The game world is further fleshed out in other Magical Legend comics and novels.

There are 2 game modes.

Game Mode 1 (Deities vs Demons):
Gameplay-wise this is similar to Bang. There are 3 roles (Deity, Demons, Spirits). The Deity wins if he kills all Demons and non-subjugated Spirits. The Demons win if they kill the Deity. The Spirits win if they kill the Deity and 1 Demon or 1 Spirit who has killed a Demon. The Deity has 3 power up cards which he can offer as a reward to subjugate(ie. ally) a Spirit. Spirits can renege on the alliance/subjugation but will suffer penalties for doing so. The game replaces the suits (Heart, Spades, etc) of Bang with a 5-element system (Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth) and characters, abilities and card actions vary depending on the elements involved. There is no concept of Distance and no Missed cards. Attacks succeed or are countered based on the elements. Card actions often require Magic points to power them. Otherwise the gameplay is quite similar.

Game Mode 2 (Faction Battles):
This mode can only be played with an even number of players (4-10). Players split into 2 camps and a representative from each camp draw 1 of 5 faction cards to see what faction they are. Factions have specific powers which can be triggered to allow cooperation between members of the faction. There are no hidden roles in this mode and all players of a faction win if the other faction is eliminated. Other aspects of gameplay (ie. drawing, attacking, etc) are similar to game mode 1.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Liar Poker
description:
Similar to Liar's Dice and also known as Poker Menteur, the game is played with a standard poker deck of 52 cards, with jokers as wildcards.

A player is dealt five cards, and names a poker hand that can be formed with it (eg. "pair of kings", "royal flush"). They may lie. The next player chooses to challenge or accept - if they challenge, the hand is revealed and the loser of the challenge take a penalty point. If they accept, they take the hand, discard 0-4 cards and draw replacements, and then make a call as previously.

The game continues until a player reaches a pre-agreed number of penalty points, at which point they are declared the loser and the game ends.

name: The Great British Trivia Quiz
description:
A roll-and-move, question-and-answer trivia game with 1200 general knowledge questions about the British Isles. There are six question categories:


History & legends
Famous people
Art & entertainment
General trivia
Geography
Sport

name: Iceland (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Camera Roll
description:
Description from the rules:

Camera Roll is played using your own photos - no Internet searches allowed!

Each player must have his/her own device whether it is a Cell Phone, iPad™/Tablet, Laptop, iPod™, Camera, etc. Grandma can even play with her photo albums!



OBJECTWin a predetermined amount of rounds to win the game. A “round” will conclude after each player has had an opportunity to be the “Judge”. The player with the most points at the end of each round wins that round. The number of rounds and players will decide the length of the game, you can play as many rounds as you like.

Points are scored by finding pictures on your device that match the categories that are revealed. There are 3 ways to score points on every turn:


A point is awarded to everyone who can find an appropriate picture for the category within 30 seconds.
An additional point is awarded to the first player to find an appropriate picture.
A third and final point is awarded to the player with the “best” photo for that particular category as decided by the Judge.


If only one person finds an appropriate picture for a category within 30 seconds (before the timer sounds), that player gets all 3 points. If no one in the group can find an appropriate picture within 30 seconds, no points are awarded for that round.



YOU BE THE JUDGE!Players take turns serving as the “Judge”. When a player is the Judge, they are responsible for selecting and announcing the new category, starting the timer, and deciding who the “first” and “best” photo points are awarded to. The player with THE MOST pictures on his/her phone shall be the first Judge,with the role rotating clockwise around the table after every category. The Judge does not play that round.

name: Kuddelmuddel Schnupperspiel
description:
There's a big mess on the table! Who can clean up the cards the fastest, while also lining up cards that match one another?

In Kuddelmuddel – German for "hodgepodge" – players try to put together chains of cards in order to score points. To set up the game, the players scatter the 80 cards in the deck face down on the table and place the bell within reach of all players. Everyone then simultaneously starts looking at face-down cards one by one. You can place the first card you see face up to start a row in front of you. To place another card next to this first one, whether on the left or right, the newly placed card must have at least one image in common with the card already in place.

As soon as a player has seven matching cards in a row, she rings the bell. If she goofed up, she sits out the round until another player creates a row; if she did everything correctly, she scoops up those cards and places them in a pile beside her while all other players reshuffle their cards into those that remain on the table.

The game ends whenever the last card is taken from the center of the table. Whoever has collected the most cards (i.e., rows) wins!

---

This is a small, promotional edition of Kuddelmuddel containing 32 "cards" to cut out yourself.

name: What's It Gonna Take?
description:
From the publisher:

Does everybody have a limit? You'll find out playing this lively party game. No matter how well you know someone, you will know them better after playing this game. It measures the limits you didn't even know you had. So go ahead and answer that age old question, what's it gonna take? But if you kiss a boa constrictor, we had nothing to do with it.

In this party game the active player draws two random hypothetical situations and a money card depicting an incentive. The active player has to decide whether they would be willing to do either, both, or neither of the situations for that specific reward indicated on the Money card.

All other players cast their votes by using voting cards to indicate which Hypothetical situations they think the Reader would do for the reward. All players responses are revealed and scoring Chips are earned for correct predictions of what the Reader Player would do. Each player at the table takes a turn, and then count up their chips. The winner is the person with the most scoring chips at the end of each round.

name: Where on Earth?
description: The planet-sized game of famous places & landmarks! On every card there's a location and 5 key clues that help reveal it's whereabouts... the quicker you can solve them the better you'll do!

name: Teotihuacãzinho
description:
Description from the designer:

In Teotihuacãzinho, each player is an architect making a small Pyramid to become the Master Builder and erect the Pyramid of the Moon in Teotihuacã. The game lasts until any player completes his Pyramid or at the end of the 14th round. During a round, eight dice are rolled and every player selects three dice to use each one as an Action or as a Block. The Action varies with the color of the die: green dice are used to push blocks and move the workers, yellow dice are used to gain gold, blue dice are used to acquire objectives and gray dice are used to make buildings.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: It's a Deal
description: Players roll dice and move around a circular track. Players can buy shares in various companies, draw card, earn money, sometimes lose money etc. An easy playing family game. Goal is to earn as much money as possible.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cockroach (fan expansion for Hive)
description: The Cockroach moves like the Ladybug, first on top of the Hive, and then one space down to ground level. The Cockroach must move onto the Hive as its first movement, and must move onto ground level for its final movement, however, its total movement on the hive is not restricted, except that it cannot move over pieces belonging to the opponent. The Cockroach is on the same tile as the Ladybug.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Whew!
description:
Words, Wits, Whims & Woes!

First, download the FREE Whew! timer APP (You could use a sand timer or egg timer but, the WHEW! timer is fun!)

Then, lay out the board, pick your game pieces.

Next, someone grabs either a red or green card and rolls the die. The die determines which word to use for matching sounds AND how many moves the player that is "caught" has to move.

For green cards, you must match the sound of the front of a word (alliteration). For red cards, you match the back of the word (rhyme).

Now, start the timer, say and write a word that works and pass the pencil! Try not get caught with the pencil when the timer goes off! And hope that the player that has to move doesn't land on a space that is the same color as your game piece! (You'll find out why.)

Play until there is one loser or keep playing until just one player is left on the board! (The ultimate winner!)
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rodzinki
description:
Jak rosną zwierzęta?
Każde zwierzątko ma mamę i tatę. Najpierw jest dzieckiem, potem rośnie, zmienia się i samo staje się mamą albo tatą... Obrazki umieszczone w pudełku przedstawiają kolejne etapy rozwoju ośmiu gatunków zwierząt. Młodszym dzieciom proponujemy układankę, starszym – ciekawą, dynamiczną grę.

Tile game with animal theme. For younger players it is essentially a Memory-type game and the one who completes their sets first is the winner. For older players it has additional educational value and the winner is determined based on their accumulated points.

name: Doujinshi of the Kings (王たちの同人誌)
description:
王たちの同人誌 (Doujinshi of the Kings) is a game about that most noble of quests, selling your own fan comics.

The game takes place in two phases. First everyone works on building their doujinshi, working to get one each of Title, Cover, Element, and Genre cards. If you have two of the same card, you can turn one to the dark side (usually worth negative points) and force it on to an opponent. After one person has one of each card on the Light Side you move on to the Event Phase.

In the Event Phase, it's finally the big day of the convention and everyone tries to sell their doujinshi. While base points are decided in the first phase, in the Event phase a variety of surprises can change everything around.

name: Shit Happens: Little Shits
description: 100 Little Shits question cards to add to your existing Shit Happens game.

name: The Awkward Family Photos Movie Line Caption Game: Vol. 2
description:
The sequel to The Awkward Family Photos Movie Line Caption Game is here!

All the elements of an epic game night await, as players caption awkward images with comical, offbeat, dramatic and action-packed lines from hundreds of memorable movies. Many lines you’ll know and others will be new to you. The gameplay is inconceivably fun and easy…and no movie knowledge is required! Our original game debuted in early-2014 and contains 330 of the most memorable movie lines up to that point, so we turned to popular movies from 2014-2018 for the bulk of this Volume 2 edition’s movie lines and relied on some great pre-2014 movie lines to round out the content. Enjoy!

Every player is dealt eight cards featuring a movie line from one of hundreds of popular movies. One player, ‘The Critic’, picks the next Awkward Family Photos card and places the card on the table for everyone to see. All other players decide which one of their eight movie lines best captions the photo, by placing their selection facedown in the play area. ‘The Critic’ reads each card aloud and picks the movie line that he/she thinks best captions the photo in play. The player with the winning card wins the round! First player to get 10 cards win.

—description from the publisher

name: SQULA Familiebordspel
description:
Educational kids quiz game.

Roll the dice, answer quiz questions about all the classes in school and try to earn the most points.
Every player gets questions that match his/her level. The player with the most points wins. This makes learning fun!
Do you know better than your parents at table. The tension stays til the last minute.
—description from the box (translated)

name: Mopseinander
description:
The pugs are out of control! Bright colours and many, many pugs bring joy, fun and also trouble in this turbulent and fast nightcap game! You have to recognize the right pugs in the right number quickly. A little confused is everything at Mopseinander.

—description from the publisher

name: F-Life: A Card Game About Adulthood
description:
F-Life: A Game About Adulthood is a dark-humored party card game about life and all of the terrible things that happen to us all.

Each player begins at a young age based on their chosen education level. As you age, you draw many different types of cards that can change everything. The goal is to collect the most amount of money until you die. Once everyone dies, the player with the most money wins!

Grow old as you work and earn money. Get too old, and you'll hit retirement. Ahh, shit! Did you die? That's okay. Continue playing from the graveyard and use cards to screw over the remaining players that are still alive.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Trapped: Mission to Mars
description:
Escape Room Game Pack
Series 1, Room 4
Difficulty level: MEDIUM

TRAPPED turns any room into a family-friendly escape-room adventure. Each game is loads of fun as you move around the room actively solving puzzles and decoding clues. Every pack is different and contains everything you need to create your very own escape room experience. Packed with loads of content including clues to solve and puzzles to crack, all you need to add is family or friends to play and the cunning to escape/live the dream!

In Mission to Mars, you and your crew are on a mission to Mars! Approaching the red planet in search of a new Earth, you wake from your cryosleep pod, gasping for air… As the alarm echoes through the ship, your ears adjust to the message… It’s one no astronaut wants to hear: “WARNING! WARNING! WARNING! CRITICAL FAILURE!” A life-threatening system failure means you must now land the ship manually. Check your coordinates. Steady the thrusters. Solve the problems… Can you and your crew save the mission? The fate of humanity is in your hands!

name: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
description:
Get into a spin with this board game adaptation of the hit BBC One show that has reinvented The Wheel!

This time, you’re the contestant in a race to complete your own set of seven questions and make it through to the End Game, where one final question stands in the way of victory.

Choose any seven categories from the set of 14 different subjects and place these cards around the edge of The Wheel.

There are 532 category questions and 39 End Game questions included in the game.

The centrepiece of the game is a large 20cm mechanical spinning wheel with unique push down mechanism.

Spin the contestant spinner board to select which player or team is in play.

Choose a category then press the push button to “Spin the Wheel!”

If The Wheel arrow lands on the gold space, the player or team is asked an easy gold question; if it lands on blue then a trickier blue question awaits... but watch out for the red as you’ll be Shutdown and thrown off The Wheel!

The first player or team to complete their Wheel by clearing all seven categories around The Wheel goes through to the End Game, where they face one final question to win the game.

name: Can You Dig It?
description:
There's never a dill moment in this absolutely radishing game of Can You Dig It? from Ridley's Games!

In this fast-paced card game, gardeners use trowel and error to harvest fruit and veg from the 4 community plots to develop the most impressive feast by the end of the game.

Cultivate sets of the varieties of fruit and veg cards that are thriving in the garden with the ultimate aim to collect the ingredients needed to make as many of the four recipes (salad, sauce, soup, and stew) as you can to win the most points!

But watch out for roaming chickens -- players can play a chicken card to steal a harvested vegetable from a fellow gardener!

Perfect for plant and gardening lovers, this game is suitable for ages 8+, 2 to 4 players, and has an average 20 minute gameplay.

—description from the publisher

name: Circus
description:
Circus is a board game, a family filler in which you will have to find out the secret combination of circus characters. To do this you will have the help of a blackboard where you can write down everything that happens during the game.

At the beginning of the game and randomly 5 character tokens will be placed face down on the board. Taking turns, all the people will roll the die, the number they get will be the number of tokens they will be able to flip over. That will be the first information they will have. The rest they will have to find out during the course of the game.

To facilitate the work there are the character cards that have their own abilities.

Track boss: you can move a card from the playing area to the discard deck.
Clown: you can swap the position of two character cards on the board.
Bullet woman: everyone must quickly put his hand on this card, the last one to do so must uncover a card from his playing area.
Trapeze artist: swap a card from your hand with a card from an opponent's hand.
Juggler: choose who must lose the next turn.
Magician: secretly uncover as many character cards on the board as the result of the die.
Audience: use this card to defend yourself from the effects of the trapeze artist, juggler, or ringmaster.


To win, you must not only find out the combination of characters on the board, but you must also have in your playing area the combination formed by the cards that you have had to keep during the game.

The following actions are available each turn:

Draw a card from the central deck and raise it to your hand.
Use a card from your hand and execute one of these actions:
Lower it face down to your playing area
Turn the card



The winner is the one who manages to find out the combination of characters on the board and has the generated combination in his playing area. To end the game, the person who thinks he has the winning combination must play a Carp card.
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Bogyó és Babóca Úton az oviba
description:
Who gets to the ovi sooner, where the nanny is waiting for Dongó's kindergarten teacher and Aunt Pettyes Futrinka? It is a long journey through the woods and it hides a lot of games and fun.

Almost all the characters in the fairy tale series are featured in this lovely board game. Swing with a ax lock, pick up peanuts with Squirrel Rego! If you are good at throwing and you are lucky, after a lot of forest adventure you will be the first to go to kindergarten! The easy-to-understand yet exciting game is great fun for little friends of Bogyó és Babóca Tales.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: 5 Letter Wordlet
description:
5 Letter Wordlet is a fun and addictive word puzzle game that can be played by people of all ages, and is especially suitable for word game fans of scrabble, upwords and dabble or boggle games. In this entertaining family board game, players compete to discover the secret 5-letter word using the same wits, strategy, deduction and a bit of luck that are popular in games like mastermind and codenames. The player to first identify the secret word wins the round, and the player with the most wins at the end of the game wins big! 5-Letter Wordlet from University Games is both competitive and addictive.

—description from the publisher

name: Hip Town
description:
Start with a blank canvas. Then fill your streetscape with niche businesses of your choice, from craft pickleries to modern speakeasies. Will you construct a culinary empire? A nightlife epicenter? Or something else entirely, marked with your own brand of wit and wisdom? Over 100 unique businesses and a wide variety of game-changing “reality” cards.

On their turn a player rolls a custom die, taking the resulting action. Then they may build a property if they have one that is valid based on the size of their neighborhood.

Once any player has 10 properties, the end of the game is triggered and the person with the most Hip Points and Destination bonuses wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management

name: Equivocy
description:
Equivocy mean "equivocal". It is an analogy of most popular party game Activity from Russian designers.
In this game offered to explain the words of 7 different ways: wording, drawing, pantomime, words-backwards, yes-no-answers, singing and molding from clay.

Players are divided into teams and explain each other words. To determine a way of explain, player roll a die. The value on the dice shows it and how many cells the team's pawn will advance if it guesses the word.

The goal of the game - reach the finish line before others.

—user summary

name: The Grand Museum of Art
description:
Catastrophe! The Grand Museum of Art may have to close forever! The Museum Director just jumped ship, leaving behind an enormous hidden deficit.

It’s up to you and your fellow curators to increase visitor attendance and keep the museum running. To do this, you must present grandiose exhibitions that will attract crowds of visitors and fill the museum coffers to save the institution from financial ruin.

The curator with the most popular exhibitions will become the new Museum Director!

In the beginning every player has got a couple of art (painting) cards and also a couple of (secret) exhibition cards as goals to complete collections. Every exhibition card consist of art cards, but there are a lot of paintings that belong to more exhibitions. If a player collects every card of her/his exhibition card she/he gets more victory points than the independent cards have.
To collect cards players have to roll dice and move pawns, they can get cards (art or exhibition) in various forms, they can steel from each other, they can answer trivia about the paintings. At the end of the game the player with the most victory point wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Swipe
description:
Dating apps are full of unknown people, and until we get to know them better, we have stereotypical thinking, right? How can you choose a person, having only their appearance and just a little bit of info about personality? Imagine there is a fragile charming girl and a handsome athlete guy in front of you — which of them looks so reliable that you would take him or her with you to the ISS? What if the girl spoils the series but is a jack-of-all-trades, and the guy is the passive-aggressive mom's friend's son? What will you do: swipe right or ignore?

Swipe is a party game with extremely simple rules. At the start of a round, one player becomes the leader and closes their eyes. Another player draws two character cards from the deck and places them in slots 1 and 2 in the plastic organizer to make them easy to see, then draws an action card from the deck and places it between these characters. Each player other than the leader receives a goal card that shows either 1 or 2 — and your job is to make the leader pick that character so that you score 1 point.

On your turn, give characters trait cards — whether positive or negative — by playing them from your hand. The leader then chooses the character to whom they will apply the action drawn at the beginning of the round: to kill, to marry, to have sex with, etc. All the players whose character was chosen receive 1 point.

Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Hidden Roles, Player Judge

name: Smack it!
description: A combination of War and Slapjack. Players place cards on the table, then duke it our War-style when a challenge card comes up, or try to slap the pile when a Smack It card comes up. Whoever has the highest card for a challenge, or is the first to slap the pile on a Smack It, gets the pile. Players who run out of cards are out of the game. As a twist, eliminated players may slap card piles to remove cards from play completely.
publishers: Arizona Game Co., Santa Maria Group LLC

name: 1001 Odysseys
description:
1001 Odysseys is a game of fantastic space adventures. The first human FTL ship, the Odyssey, sets out to explore a new sector of the galaxy after finding an operational alien stargate. Players take on the roles of the Odyssey's bridge crew, as they find planets, meet strange new aliens, and eventually try to find the way back home!

Each time a group sits down at the table, they play through one chapter of a story: a co-operative adventure will result in a new chapter being unlocked for the next session. The chapters aren't linear though, your path through the story book will be determined by your choices. Every standalone book tells of one of the Odyssey's adventures through alien space, but they do not require the same set of players each time. No two playthroughs of a given story book will be exactly alike!

While playing, the Mission Control board will track your progress through the Chapter. When the crew wants to do something in the game, they combine the letters of an Action, Mission, and Location to form a code such as B-3-D4, and look up that paragraph in the book. After reading the paragraph's story and game instructions, you'll advance your adventure one step, and have new options to choose from. Your journeys are recorded in a booklet called the Passport, which holds items, chapter data, and is effectively the "save file" for the game.

1001 Odysseys comes with 4 full story books, spanning approximately 400 pages. Each chapter can last anywhere from 30-75 minutes, depending on the group and the size of the chapter.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Hands On
description:
From the publisher's website:

Ready, Set, Go! Nimble hands and sharp eyes will lead to victory! An action packed and fun-filled game. Great for the entire family.

The Object:

The moment a card is drawn, quickly imitate the card hands pattern. The last one is the loser! Be the first, and be aware of any illogical hand combinations.

name: 花と吹雪 (Bloom in Blizzard)
description:
Once upon a time, there’s was kingdom nobody knows. Everybody wanted to marry the young, wise, beautiful princess, even though they knew she could be troublesome sometimes. One day the princess said “The man who brings me a handful of these flowers will be my husband”. The “task” the princess proposed wasn’t easy at all for the flower she named was “Gem Flower” which can only be raised in dead-cold weather. Now the battle of suitors has begun.

You’re one of the suitors who gained relative’s support to acquire “Gem Flower”. You are in the coldest county of the nation where you can find “Gem Seeds”. Whoever gathered enough seeds to obtain 2 Flowers(20 Seeds) is the winner.

Players put one of the cards they have face down to determine “Sunity”(The higher the number, the more sun you see) each round. There are numbers from 1 to 50. The “Sunity” will determine which regions will be hit by blizzards. One of the numbers played this round will become current “Sunity”.
Once all players played their cards, each player guess current “Sunity” and move one of their player tokens to a region on the game board.

The numbers (10~40) shown on the game board is the required Sunity in order to receive reward from that particular region. The regions with the numbers less than equal to Sunity will be hit by a blizzard. When everyone moved their player tokens, turn all the played cards face up and determine Sunity.

All the player tokens that were hit by blizzards will be removed from the game board and sent back to their hometowns. Players will receive rewards from each player tokens remained on the game board. The number +1~+4 shows how many seeds you can receive from each region.

Avoid blizzards by figuring out Sunity and become the first one to acquire Gem Flower!

name: Entdecke die Welt
description:
Description from the publisher (Translated):

Where do the zebras or the elephants live? Who knows the Statue of Liberty and where the pyramids stand? Many pictures invite the children to discover the earth and to assign the animals to their continents.

The children have to compare their tiles with the game plan and have to find the places of the pictured motifs (which consists of two tiles). When the children complete the picture of an animal or a sight, they receive the accompanying motif card and thus gain points.
Without text for a first orientation of the world map or with additional information on the backs of the motif cards, the game is getting older with the children.

Description from the publisher (German):

Wo leben Zebra und Elefant? Wer kennt die Freiheitsstatue und wer weiß, wo die Pyramiden stehen? Viele Bilder laden die Kinder ein, die Erde zu entdecken und die Tiere den Kontinenten zuzuordnen.

Sie vergleichen die Kärtchen mit dem Spielplan und finden die Orte der abgebildeten Motive. Anschließend vervollständigen die Kinder diese Bilder von Tieren oder Sehenswürdigkeiten und gewinnen so die meisten Punkte. Dabei wiederholen sie ihre Zuordnung und prägen sich das Wissen über Geographie oder die Heimat der Tiere ein.

Ganz ohne Text für eine erste Orientierung auf der Weltkarte oder mit zusätzlichen Informationen auf den Rückseiten der Motivkarten wächst das Spiel mit den Kindern mit.

Content:
30 Cards
42 Cardboard Tiles
4 Map Parts
6 Continent Counter
1 Dice

name: Pet Hunt
description:
Each player starts with a hand of cards. On each card are four pictures of pet shop animals (goldfish, puppy, turtle, etc.). A set of smaller cards is turned over one at a time. On these smaller cards are two animals, sometimes one or both will have a red "X" over it. To win, players try to get rid of all their cards by matching them to the requirements on the small cards. So, if a small card shows "turtle not-kitten," any card a player has with a turtle but no kitten on it can be discarded.

The game is attractive and the play is quick. It has a minor educational value, teaching pattern recognition and very, very light analysis. Winning is entirely a random prospect.

The game will play well with very young players. Optimally, I think Ages3 - 5
is the right age for it, though the game box says Ages 4 and up
.

The game includes 35 big cards, 28 small cards, a tray, and rules. The storage box is conveniently small (no over packaging).

Awards include:
Great American Toy Test - Recommended - 2002
Oppenheim Toy Portfolio Gold Award - 2002
Oppenheim Toy Portfolio Best Educational Toys - 2002
Canadian Toy Testing Council Three Star Award- 2003

name: More or Less
description:
Meer of minder is a card game that teaches the concept of speed (fast or slow) and weight (light or heavy).

Each player holds a set of cards depicting items like a car, a plane, a bird, a boat or an elephant. Each time a card has to be played that is different than the previous one. A pointer is turned to determine whether the card should be faster, slower, lighter or heavier.

If a player cannot play a card that meets the criteria, he has to draw a card instead. The first to play his/her last card wins.

name: Grimaces
description: From Djeco: Grimaces Memory Card Game from Djeco is a nutty, fun game. Observe, memorize... then prove that you have mastered the subtle art of the grimace: 3 conditions for being the winning team!

name: Circle Out!
description:
The new and exciting Circle Out! game will challenge both your friends and your family. It will stretch your mind as you look for circles among the triangles.

Circle Out! game is one of the great modern classics. It calls upon parts of your brain that rarely get much exposure. For this reason, little children can often gain an advantage over adults who are just beginning to learn the game. Playing the game is an excellent visual memory exercise. Circle Out is filled with strategy – and winning is never a simple matter of chance.

Instructions:

To play the game shuffle the deck and lay out 12 - 16 cards on the table. All players must race to find the most circles of the largest size.

Players should not touch the cards until a circle has been found. When you find one, say "Circle!" and then you may take the cards that form your circle.

One predetermined player will lay out additional cards to replace the ones that have been taken. Continue to play until all of the cards are gone. Two decks may be combined to lengthen the game.

What? Circles? All I can see are triangles! Think of each card as a link that belongs to a chain. A circle happens when the ends of your chain come (link) together.

Just remember that same colors link together and that triangles on the top may only link to triangles on the bottom and vice versa. For example, a blue triangle at the bottom right corner of a card will link to any blue triangle at the top left corner of another card.

Scoring:

Circles of three are worth 1 point, circles of four are worth 2 points, circles of five are worth 3 points, circles of six are worth 4 points and circles of seven cards are worth 5 points.

Or just subtract 2 from the total number of cards in your circle and that is how many points it is worth. For example, a five-card circle is worth 3 points (5 - 2 = 3).

There can be up to seven cards per circle only because there are only seven colors. Each color may only be represented once in each circle by one top triangle and one bottom triangle.

name: 3 Little Pigs and the Big Bad Wolf
description: Exciting game for the youngest of family! Who is afraid of the big bad wolf? This game is a little adventure towards safe stone house, which rescued them from danger. The game can be played with 2-4 players who each receive pork. Piglets built straw house, stick house and finally the stone house, in that order. But the task is not easy. Hungry and always on guard Big Bad Wolf waits impatiently for the moment when it could blow down the houses of the piglets. You win the game if you reach the stone house without the wolf catching you!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: NHL Slapshot Card Game
description:
from the publisher:

NHL Slapshot is a fast paced 2 player card game that simulates the exciting action between 2 NHL hockey teams. The excitement begins when each player draws action cards from the shared deck of cards placed between you. Play your strongest cards in order to win “Possession” of the puck, and then go on the “Attack” to try and score and win the game. The team with the highest score at the end of 3 periods wins. Do you have what it takes to
build a winning team? Open
a deck and find out!

Each Deck contains 60
cards and 1 rule book.

name: Black Stories: Bloody Cases Edition
description:
A Black Stories edition with riddle stories about real crimes, strage deaths and stupid accidents.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Santa's Little Elves
description: A guess/collection game for 2-5 players (elves). 4 tiles (presents) are up for collection at any given time and randomly assigned around a board to spaces labeled one through four. The current player uses a die and secretly rotates the die to match the number a present is assigned to (one through four. Keeping the die hidden, the next player attempts to guess which number the die was turned to (one through four). If the guess is correct the present corresponding to that number is stolen and added to that person's toy chest. If an incorrect guess is made, then the current player who selected the number/present receives it and adds it to their toy chest. The missing tile is replaced, turn order changes and the game continues until there are no tiles left to replace the missing tile. The presents have various ways points are collected and there are also negative point presents (broken toys) as well as tiles that effect game play. The elf with the post points after bonuses and negative points are counted is declared the winner.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Turn Order: Auction

name: Disney DVD Bingo
description: Disney-themed version of Bingo played on home DVD units. Players attempt to form Bingo on their cards from the numbers revealed through the DVD player. Numbers correspond to various Disney characters. Short Disney movie clips are often interspersed throughout the game. Helps young children learn numbers, colors, and patterns.

name: Crazy 8ths
description: Crazy 8ths is a music based educational card game that introduces many variants to popular card games, and is designed to help children learn to read music.

name: Splickety Lit
description:
From the publisher's website:
This game will wip your flig (flip your wig)! Sometimes known as a spoonerism, we’ve renamed this clever wordplay exercise Splickety Lit. Each question has words or phrases that have their beginning fonsonants clipped (consonants flipped…you pet the gicture). The challenge is to answer the Splickety Lit question correctly in the mame sanner. So, if asked who Skuke Lywalker’s father was, you can confidently shout out (spoiler alert) "Varth Dader!” Engaging your memory, word skills, and comprehension speed, Splickety Lit is a winner that’ll keep everyone guessing, from fart to stinish!

name: Ghouls
description:
Ghouls are coming out from the sewer of the town. Groups of human volunteers (police, medics, teachers, housewives, students, role-playing gamers, ...) move through town location (hospital, university, wharf, TV station...) to fight the ghouls.
One player takes the ghouls' side and moves them through the sewer system trying to pop out into an undefended location and destroy it. Two or three players controls groups of humans who try to fight the ghouls and prevent destruction.
Ghouls win if they destroy the cathedral, humans win if they occupy the ghouls headquarters in the sewer.
Game mechanics are designed to give ghouls a large advantage in the long time, so humans must hurry up.
In Italian only.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: UNO: Sesame Street
description:
Basic Uno-themed card game.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "GROUCH" card. This card allows the player to throw out their trash. The player playing the card can dump up to three of their cards by distributing all the cards to one player or spreading them out to multiple players.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Käseschieben
description: Players roll the special 6 sided die and move their mouse pawn accordingly. The goal of the game is to push as many pieces of cheese as possible over your own edge of the board. Some of the pieces of cheese have worms in them and are not counted for scoring in the end of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Complete the Atlas
description:
Complete the Atlas, a.k.a. ブランクワールド (Blank World) is a Japanese game of world exploration. Set in Portugal in the late 15th century, King Afonso V enters into a trade agreement with Lisbon's great merchant Ferdinand Gomez. Instead of granting subsidies to explore, the agreement entitles Gomez to exclusive trade in the specialty products obtained from the voyages. Players become one of the admirals employed by Ferdinand Gomez, pioneering the wilderness, discovering unknown creatures and natural wonders, building harbors and trading posts, trading, and preaching Christianity. Players want to increase their fame and become the world's best admiral.

Proving that the world is round, a new world map similar to — but not identical to — the real world will be created. Initially the game board shows a large map of the world known to Europeans in the 15th century, with all of Europe being depicted along with parts of Asia and Africa. The rest of the board is blank, and players place land tiles as they travel across the seas. In this way, they literally complete a new atlas (rather than trying to mimic the actual globe), and the game will play out differently each session.

As players draw tiles and discover new lands, they also close off potential sea routes. Balancing the need to discover and the need to trade is one of the game's challenges. Building a church and propagating Christianity to a greater extent also increases a player's fame.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Medieval, Nautical, Religious, Travel
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Map Addition, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Tank Attack! Card Game
description:
Presented at Lucca Games 2010 by Editrice Giochi.
Tank Attack! Card Game is for 2-6 players.

Content:
A fleet of tanks and flags are useful to keep track of the points scored by the players during the game. The big ones 5 points, small one 1 and the flags 10 points.
A tin box to contain tanks and flags.

"The United States have been invaded by an unknown enemy. The players must free the inhabitants of the 50 American States, one at a time, playing the cards in their hands strategically."

110 cards: 50 "States" and 60 "Tanks". 50 States represents 50 States of US and each card indicates the name of the state, its position within the USA, the flag, the geographic boundaries and a value which is proportional to the actual number of inhabitants of each states.

How to play.
The first "states" card is turned and represents the objective of the current hand.
Each player choses one card among his 5 "Tanks" cards, when all players have chosen their cards, the cards played are revealed.

The player who plays the card with greater value wins the State.
The value of the state represents the score obtained and who won this card take relative number of tanks and flags and placing in front of him.

The game ends when all the States are freed or when one of the players reaches a pre-set score that varies according to number of players.

The Tanks cards are discarded and replaced by other cards.

Integrated Risk: a new complete set of fleet of a new color give option to add a new player to Risk.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Modern Warfare

name: Pommes Fritz
description:
Objective: Avoid collecting too many plastic 'French fries'
(= penalties you must take if the potato 'bomb' makes music)

Starting player gets potato
1. Rolls the die and draws a corresponding card
2. Pushes the potato button (primes it)
3. Shouts a word which must be related to the term on the card
4. Throws the (hot) potato - direction was told on the card - to another player, who has to catch it
5. Player must respond with a word related to the last mentioned term and passes the potato further on - hopefully still making music
6. If the potato stops making music - that player should pick up a golden plastic chip
7. Game ends if anybody picks up the last chip

Content:
1 making music potato (with timer), 1 special die, 1 chip box, 30 chips, 1 card box, 56 cards, 1 rule sheet

similar approach compared with 'pass the bomb', but a bit easier to play
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Knotsgekke knikkers
description:
a tower in the middle between the two players contain a bunch of marbles.
they roll out of the tower on 2 sticks, the sticks are manipulated by the players, to guide the balls over a filed with holes.
The holes have different points.
publishers: Hasbro, MB Jeux, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Wo war's? Mitbringspiel
description:
